job_description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working as a Facilities Manager or Chief Engineer.
Experience in facilities management, including facility, technical and team management.
Experience managing a facilities portfolio.
Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience collaborating with other business units to meet company goals and standards.
Understanding of the operations and maintenance of electrical, control systems, and mechanical systems in a data center environment.
Ability to set, prioritize, and achieve business objectives.
Ability to develop and grow team members, through coaching, mentoring, and training.
About the job
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facility Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You'll provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.
You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.

As a Data Center Facilities Manager, you will be responsible for leading a team in 24/7 Data Center operations. Our goal at the Data Center is to keep 100% uptime, ensuring that Google critical Data Center Operations are uninterrupted 24x7x365 days a year.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency.
Plan and execute campus operational budgets, expense forecasting and manage established budgets.
Be responsible for meeting service level agreements (SLAs) with internal teams on uptime, efficiencies, and cost.
Lead efforts to integrate Google-wide strategy and execution with internal and external business partners.
Be responsible for leading and growing a large team in data center operations.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

ViacomCBS (NASDAQ: VIAC; VIACA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.

Overview & Responsibilities:
The ViacomCBS paid social team buys media across disparate social platforms (Facebook, Google, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat, etc)! We are seeking a candidate who will extract and harmonize the large data sets that come from those social platforms via Datorama (by way of social APIs) and then make sense of those volumes of data, as it relates to pattern recognition and useful insights.

Responsibilities:
Create data lakes by pulling data from different sources (i.e., social APIs)
Build data visualization dashboards using Datorama and Tableau
Build and manage reports showing the health of key performance metrics
Query a data warehouse for data via SQL
Present insights and analysis to different teams and partners
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for reporting, planning, and other predictive work
Work closely with Finance, Marketing, and Buying teams in achieving team business goals and initiatives
Develop automated dashboards and reports that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Make recommendations on tactical adjustments to improve performance

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 2+ years of work experience in Data Engineering/Operations field
Proficient in Datorama and Python
Ability to write SQL to perform common types of analysis
Strong problem-solving and creative-thinking skills
Experience developing solutions to business problems via hands-on discovery and exploration of data
Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences

ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.

At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. ViacomCBS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, and Veteran status.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access. https://www.viacomcbs.com/careers as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by calling 212.846.5500 or by sending an email to viacomaccommodations@viacom.com. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

About the Quality Data Manager position

We are looking for a Quality/Data Manager to assist in ensuring that our supplier services and materials provided to the customer are capable to drive sustainable growth and must meet all necessary requirements before they reach the consumer. One of the main duties of this role includes inspecting the final product/service to make sure quality meets compliance with standards and meets customer expectations.

You should be thorough and observant with an eye for detail, fully understand the requirements for the product or service and have a sense of responsibility towards our potential and existing customers as well as the competition.

Quality Data Manager responsibilities are:

Maintain adherence to product quality standard in department for incoming materials and finished goods.
Identify, record, and resolve any problems relating to product, process, and quality system.
Coordinate / support activities.
Initiate, recommend, or provide solutions through designated channels.
Verify and document implementation of solutions to problems.
Manage reduction of further processing, delivery, or installation of nonconforming product until the deficiency or unsatisfactory condition has been corrected
Represent the Company to our customer and vendors, including quality-related supplier visits and contacts as required.
Ensure customer satisfaction in other internal departments.
Make independent decisions / referrals to resolve potential quality problems as required.
Think, resolve, and document all quality issues in a disciplined approach.
Responsible for evaluating, transacting, and disposition non-conforming material.
To ensure compliance with all Company rules / policies / practices.
Analyze data and performance and evaluate quality of incoming and outgoing product
Control product quality through development and use of FMEA’s control plans, flow charts, and solid problem-solving skills.
Create computerized graphs / reports that clearly demonstrate quality characteristics.
Maintain budget, record purchase, and supply needed material to others in departments.
Maintain parts drawings, document, and organize prints as required.
Complete required reports accurately and in a timely manner.
Compile and submit (PPAP) sample submissions to meet customer requirements.
Maintain documentation accurately between Process Flows, PFMEA’s, Control Plans, and ODS’s.
Maintain flexibility in ability to adjust to changes in job requirements and hours, while completing other functions daily without fail.
Operate computers and technical measuring equipment.
Maintain 5S in work area.
Incorporate safe working procedures into all daily activities in and around facility.
Read blueprints.
Train and assist in problem solving.
Performs functional quality tests, as required.
Ensures that color evaluations and verifications are performed by qualified Team Members.
Supervise work performed by members of the Quality department.
Identifies opportunities for continuous improvement, ensures that continuous improvement activities are planned, implemented, measured, reported, and reviewed in the respective area of responsibility.
Communicates daily with the team.
Develops and controls documents and data within the functional area. Reviews, approves, distributes, and maintains file documents and data for which there is management authority. Responsible for releasing external documents, and for ensuring that obsolete external documents are excluded from use.
Applies that corrective action process when discrepancies / non-conformances are detected.
Responsible for applying the preventive action process when potential issues/risks are identified. Also, responsible for assessing the importance/severity of the issues/risks and for initiating the preventive action for employees in the department.
Ensuring we meet safety and quality standards set by both GAA and regulatory authorities.
Seeks to instill a Quality Culture throughout the organization.
Develop, lead, and execute the quality strategy in the warehouse. This includes direct leadership for the quality assurance teams ensuring superior product and process quality.
Lead and improve all aspects of site quality performance ensuring alignment with business objectives and key stakeholders.
Quality Data Manager Skills Desired are:


2+ years' experience of working in a Quality/Data Manager or other similar position
Significant experience with quality control procedures and relevant legal standards
Significant experience with data analysis and statistical methods
Excellent math skills together with close attention for detail and
Responsible and conscientious, with a results driven approach
Strong organizational, leadership and communication skills
Good knowledge of MS Office
BSc or BA degree in business administration or other relevant area; additional certification of quality control, such as ISO 9000, will be a bonus

Physical Requirements:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds unassisted.
Work Environment:
While traveling and performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to various warehouse work environment where all safety rules and regulations must be followed.
Scope of Authority:
Has the authority to stop production if defective or unsafe parts or condition appear. Has the authority to reject non-conforming material from the supplier. Is empowered to prevent non-conforming material from reaching the customer.

Minimum qualifications:

7 years of experience managing technical teams as a team lead or manager.
3 years of experience in site-level data center leadership.
Experience managing and developing managers.
Preferred qualifications:

4 years of experience working in data centers and building out infrastructure.
Understanding of HVAC and power requirements for high-availability data centers.
Understanding of networks and server hardware architecture, including maintenance and repair.
Excellent strategic problem-solving skills.
About the job

The Hardware Operations team deploys and maintains the hardware components of Google’s Compute, Storage and Network infrastructure in the most efficient, reliable, secure, and scalable way possible. We monitor the physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. You will stay informed on how the site is performing and anticipate and address challenges and roadblocks. You’ll also participate and lead global conversations, initiatives, and strategies, working in close collaboration with the data center site facilities manager and their team.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Be responsible for the hire, management, and implementation of multiple projects for your team.
Ensure data center related priorities are consistent with company objectives.
Oversee the computing hardware and networking operations of a data center site.
Work with others to set and implement short-term and long-term strategy for the site, and identify problems and create solutions for computing and network architecture.
Be the face of Google to the local community and lead the community affairs program for the site.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Kevala is looking for a Manager to lead the Load Modeling team. This individual will help develop creative data-driven solutions to difficult and often unconventional problems; collaborate with project and product stakeholders to ensure the solutions are valid, appropriate, and delivered on schedule; and own development of these solutions all the way into production. The Load Modeling team is particularly focused on time series modeling of electrical supply and demand in the past, present, and future. The team works closely with other Data Science and Software Engineering teams to develop robust and innovative end-to-end solutions to problems in a wide variety of areas that are core to Kevala’s mission: solar power, electric vehicles, energy efficiency, demand response, batteries, wholesale markets, and more. If you would enjoy working with other professionals who believe in accelerating a clean energy future by making electric and environmental data meaningful, transparent and broadly accessible, we encourage you to apply.What you will be doingLeading people: conducting regular 1 on 1 meetings, providing frequent feedback and support, conducting periodic performance reviewsLeading technical development: project planning and technical design, writing and reviewing code, model development, QA, and maintenanceCollaborating cross-functionally: Representing the team and coordinating with other teams on project, product, and platform development effortsScaling the team: mentor current and new team members to support Kevala’s goals of growthResearch and development of new models to support project or product needsWriting research reports, whitepapers, and other documentation to explain how our models workWhat you need to succeed Experience managing data scientists and/or data engineersProfessional-grade Python development skills, particularly the Pandas, Numpy, SciPy, scikit-learn data science stack and collaborative development with gitSignificant experience in time series modelingExperience developing research questions and designing experiments to test hypothesesExperience designing and developing complex data systems and pipelinesEffective and flexible communication skills, particularly the ability to translate across technical and non-technical audiencesCreative problem-solving skillsCollaborative mindset, empathy, curiosity, and eagerness to learnWhat will make you stand outExperience working with electrical load dataExperience in the utility, green energy, cleantech, or regulatory industriesExperience handling the challenges of a rapidly-growing start-upExperience with large scale data processing tools and conceptsExperience with cloud data providersJob Type: Full-timePay: $110,000.00 - $160,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):What are your preferred pronouns?Why are you interested in joining Kevala?Experience:Python: 2 years (Required)time series modeling: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: Remote

Job Summary: The Department of Public Health Sciences is seeking a candidate to serve as the Data Manager for assigned DCU studies.

Job Duties:

Interacting with site personnel and monitors to ensure that sponsor specific timelines for data processing and cleaning are met. Reporting any problems with timelines to the data management director. - (Essential)

Checking data for discrepancies. Generating, tracking and resolving data clarifications requests. - (Essential)
30% - Providing user support for web-based clinical trial management system. Duties include: Creating user accounts for site personnel. Providing user training and assistance. - (Essential)
10% - Participating in the development of data collection forms. Duties include: Creating, editing, and reviewing project-specific data collection forms. Identifying errors prior to programming. - (Essential)

(Continuous) Ability to maintain hearing acuity, with correction. (Continuous) Ability to perform gross motor functions with frequent fine motor movements. (Frequent)

Position Purpose:
The Associate Project Manager is responsible for supporting teams by executing project management activities with minimal supervision. Associate Project Managers typically support low complexity projects in a non-vendor facing capacity. Associate Project Managers create and maintain project plans, develop and communicate status reports, manage issues and risks, and control project scope. In addition, they monitor and adjust to given budgets and complete associated internal cost-benefit analysis efforts.
Responsible for tracking labor spend
Performs follow-ups on discrepancies between forecasted spend and actuals
Creates and Distributes reporting related to project delivery, financials, staffing, and planning as needed
Manages small projects with direction and guidance from an experienced Project Manager
Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:
50% - Delivery & Support:
Executes project scoping and scope management planning; manages scope appropriately
Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met
Executes and documents cost benefit analysis and justification findings
Develops and communicates project plan, dependencies, and status updates highlighting any potential issues, including schedule, resource, cost, and risks; manages to project plan effectively
Applies lessons learned to subsequent projects
Executes change approval process and implementation of approved changes
Completes toll gate artifacts (Charter, Business Acceptance Document, etc.)

10% - Monitoring:
Identifies, defines, and takes action to mitigate project risks in a timely and effective manner
Monitors, tracks, and adjusts project plans based on critical milestones
Monitors budget; makes necessary adjustments to remain on budget, escalating as necessary
Monitors project activities to predict, mitigate, and remediate misalignments with The Home Depot's compliance regulations

40% - Administration & Operations:
Updates The Home Depot systems (including financial systems and project closeout)
Creates, documents, and uploads lessons learned
Executes other Project Management duties as needed
Monitors outstanding invoices and collects funds as necessary, escalating as needed
Publishes and tracks creation of related artifacts

Nature and Scope:
Typically reports to the Technology Coordination Manager or Sr. Manager.

For Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City residents: The pay range for this position is between 60k and 130k. Starting salary may vary based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, the position being offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. The Home Depot offers additional competitive financial and non-financial benefits, which may include a performance-based bonus program or a profit sharing program depending on position.

Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Standard Minimum Qualifications:
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Additional Minimum Qualifications:
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States

Education Required:
The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED.

Years of Relevant Work Experience:
0 years

Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Preferred Qualifications:
Highly proficient with Excel - pivots, vlookups, visualization
Ability to analyze data to understand trends, identify anomalies, and provide insights
Experience with project management tools such as smartsheets, MS Project, etc.
Experience with labor management or financials management in a corporate environment
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder
Plans and Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Self-Development: Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels

job_title: Product Manager, Product Data Tools (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
job_description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to social media, digital marketing and the retail store experience, our teams at NIKE Digital are reimagining how design and technology meet to serve consumers more directly and personally. We invest in cutting-edge technologies and work with the most creative people in the world. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.
Omni-Channel Product Platform (OCPP) is the source of truth for product data needed for consumers to conduct commerce activities where they want and how they want. The Omni-Channel Product Platform is the natural evolution and response to the digital growth we are experiencing today and have the goal to grow in the next 5 years. The Product Data Tools team will be critical in moving Nike’s Operations teams into an Omni-Channel ecosystem, with connected tools, systems and re-envisioned Operations processes.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to help move our Product Data tools into a world where consumers can find our products where they want and how they want! Our team is looking for a candidate with a solid understanding of Nike’s tool ecosystem, Operational business processes and has the creativity to work across functions to move Nike into the Omni-Channel future. This person is passionate about delivering solutions for Nike’s world-wide Operations teams and has a track record of conceiving, building, and improving digital experiences that change the way users work well with their tools every day so that Nike can re-envision the commerce landscape for consumers. The selected candidate will obsess building trust with our Operations, Engineering and Program partners to recognise the real problems that need to be solved, develop a strategy for migrating users to a new platform and implement perfectly on that strategy. Our best Product Managers are detail oriented, data driven, consumer focused and outstanding communicators who work well across a diverse set of cross functional partner teams to deliver outstanding solutions.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
This will be working with the Omni-Channel Product Platform and Product Data Tools team as the owner for Product Readiness and Activations! As Product Manager you will help to define and implement the product strategy, lead the end-to-end lifecycle of a product and help identify key dependencies, handle risks and measure success.
A typical day/week looks like leading cross-functional meetings, working with key team members to identify requirements, coordinating with other Product Managers to ensure a seamless transition from the legacy tools to the new outstanding tools. This person will also be facilitating the Scrum/Agile ceremonies with engineering teams and developing and maintaining key artifacts to communicate plans and progress.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
In this role, this person will work across a set of cross functional teams including experience design, global technology & engineering, Nike Digital Direct Commerce Global and Geography Operations and nearly every other commerce digital product teams. You will lead through influence by using data and risk analysis to make informed decisions and will be a team member who effectively prioritizes resources appropriately to achieve business goals while delighting Nike’s customers.
Management of Feature Development for Product Readiness and Activations.
Pro-active Definition of Feature Specifications: Partner with other Product Managers and Experience Design to develop wire-frames while defining mutually exclusive and collectively comprehensive user requirements and stories in collaboration with multiple engineering teams.
Bring to bear Consumer Compassion: Live your customer’s reality – both your Operations consumers of the legacy and new tools AND the Nike consumer looking to make purchasing decisions in an Omni-Channel commerce environment, deconstruct the sophisticated Operations tools landscape at Nike and deliver a transition from old to new for both sets of consumers.
Exhibit a Bias for Delivery: Participate in Agile ceremonies and keep the cross functional team passionate about near term results in a constantly evolving environment.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor's Degree or higher or combination of relevant education, experience and Training.
3+ years of relevant work experience, working as a Product Manager on Agile development teams passionate about global digital products, preferably within the domain of digital commerce.
Strong analytical background and/or relevant data driven job experience.
Outstanding problem solving, with emphasis on useful data driven decision making.
High attention to detail including a consistent track record to document requirements.
Outstanding communication and decision making skills.

Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.
For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $117,000 per year. Information about benefits can be found here

Nike requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire, unless otherwise required by law. As an equal opportunity employer, Nike will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Remote, United States
Creative Production
About Netflix
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. Whatever your taste, and no matter where you live, we give you access to best-in-class TV shows, movies and documentaries. Our members control what they want to watch, when they want it, with no ads, in one simple subscription. We’re streaming in more than 30 languages and 190 countries, because great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere. We are the world’s biggest fans of entertainment, and we’re always looking to help you find your next favorite story.

There’s no better time to become a part of Netflix. We continue to revolutionize the way content is created and delivered to millions of users all across the globe while always striving to maintain a world-class user experience.
The Opportunity
Our mission is to revolutionize the way promotional content is created and delivered, finding new ways for prospective and current Netflix members to discover stories. This is your chance to help transform how Netflix titles are presented, consumed, and perceived.

As Netflix continues to scale across the globe, our Creative Planning team is a driving force in building how we ask for creative, how we find and prime the best creative talent around the globe, and how we streamline production. Made up of a diverse team of creative industry professionals, this team is reinventing how we create stories about our content.

One of our core objectives is to unlock the full potential of our creative partnerships including, but not limited to, ad agencies, creative freelancers, and production companies, who concept and develop creative campaigns and assets to promote Netflix titles. An important aspect of this work is establishing best-in-class onboarding and training programs and practices to prime our partners for success. As our team develops talent pipelines around the world, there is a need for someone to play a critical role in guiding the vision, strategy, and roadmap of our global onboarding and training programs, as well as driving ongoing adoption with internal cross-functional teams and creative partners.

The Program Manager - Onboarding & Training will also maintain a sustainable infrastructure that will ultimately support a pipeline of talent to creative projects, ensuring they are primed and ready for their first creative brief whether it be to develop a trailer or key art for an upcoming Netflix title or to ideate creative concepts for one of our audience-led social channels. This role will also aid in setting up key success metrics of these onboarding and training programs, analyzing partner performance data, and making informed decisions to enhance training efforts that steer towards partner success.

The role is based in the US (Remote) and will report to the Manager, Creative Planning.
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop, recommend, and execute onboarding and training programs and practices to ensure both new and existing creative partners are set up for success
Lead the establishment of the global onboarding and training vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmap
Evolve and maintain the onboarding and training infrastructure that powers training sites, playbooks, email notifications, training sessions, and partner events, as well as curate and design these resources
Optimize onboarding and training workflows as the business evolves to ensure clarity and accuracy
Lead the internal content working group and act as the key connector between all team members to ensure all activities are laddering up to the larger strategy
Co-develop training initiatives and resources to further enhance our inclusion and diversity program efforts
Drive the measurement strategy and reporting of initiatives to ensure they are meeting or exceeding our success metrics
Conduct ongoing assessments to understand the needs of important internal stakeholder teams
Maintain positive relationships with existing creative partners and promote a high level of partner trust and transparency
Stay connected to broader Netflix-wide training programs and platforms to identify synergies
Keep finger on the pulse of the industry at large (outside Netflix) to gain knowledge on how to improve our programs
Qualifications:
Working experience in the creative industry (Brand or Agency side) with an understanding of how creative is made
Proven expertise in developing and driving adoption of training programs for large scale creative engagements, including aligning internal stakeholders from many departments
Proficient written communication skills with the ability to make complex subjects understandable
Strong ability to unpack large scale problems to establish a roadmap based on impact
An unshakeable respect for the importance and impact of I&D at any organization and an openness to, and respect for, cultural differences
Self-starter with the ability to prioritize work in a dynamic and complex environment to maintain program progress
Confidence to rely on self judgment, discretion to work autonomously, and take smart risks
Experience with large scale problem-solving and rolling up their sleeves to build the solutions
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive them to successful and flawless execution
Comfortable working with and leveraging data to understand and action learnings
Exceptional communicator with strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and build relationships
Experience working with expanding global businesses and teams a plus
Prior experience working in Airtable, Zapier, CMS, eLearning a plus
Experience working in a cross-cultural international environment is a plus
APPLY NOW

job_title: Program Manager, Data Center Environmental, Health, and Safety
job_description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Engineering, a related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in designing and implementing systems to manage operational risks.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications:

Certification from the Board of Certified Safety Professionals or equivalent agency.
Experience in communicating with federal, state, and local authorities regarding Environmental Health and Safety issues.
Experience with managing and permitting air quality permits.
Experience with waste water and hazardous chemical management.
Knowledge of facilities management, engineering, and operations.
About the job
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

As a Program Manager of the Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) team, you will support programs including management system implementation, environmental compliance, and global oversight. You will play a critical part in ensuring all EHS issues are identified and addressed by working with a cross-functional team. You will provide program leadership and oversight to new initiatives to continue to create and iterate our EHS program.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Maintain environmental permits/programs to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations.
Identify and evaluate operational EHS risks assessing the impact to the business, analyze risk scenarios to determine their potential impact, and design/lead programs to mitigate those risks.
Conduct assessments of existing EHS programs to ensure alignment with our regional strategy, including analyzing EHS business risks and identifying, describing, and estimating efficiencies to be gained through established programs.
Assess EHS training needs based on identified operational risks and ensure that workforce training activities are provided to meet business and legislative requirements.
Investigate and analyze incident reports involving work‐related injuries, illnesses, and recommend measures to prevent recurrence.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

job_title: Data Center Site Security Manager, Global Security
job_description:
Summary
Posted: Mar 3, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200352009
Do you instinctively know how and when to take action? Do you love performing under pressure? As part of our Global Security team, you’ll help manage the security needs of Apple’s most valuable assets: our people, properties and innovations. Join us and you’ll play a significant role in preserving the highest standard of security for one of the most watched companies in the world. Apple's Global Security team is looking for a Data Site Security Manager to work directly with business units, vendors, and facilities teams to provide security services. Your work will help build solutions to a variety of unique security challenges, ranging from the physical security of sites and events, to the protection of our supply chain. You'll develop solutions to support our physical security capabilities, increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our operation, and coordinate critical incidents affecting Apple.
Key Qualifications
5+ years of corporate site security or program management experience preferred, global experience is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to react to changes in a time critical environment to meet security needs and quickly evaluate situations
Experience managing, coordinating and maintaining multiple projects
Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks within dynamic conditions
Demonstrate excellent communication with a strong attention to detail and courage to take initiative and drive projects to completion
Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally
Strong organizational skills
Experience crafting Keynotes and presenting to senior management
Must be able to work nights, weekends and holidays
Travel 10 - 25% of the time, with on-call responsibilities
Description
The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert (SME) ensuring a site remains secure, assess security risks, develop internal controls for privacy, incident prevention or proprietary information theft and ensure that employees are safe. In addition, the duties include but are not limited to: Work with leaders from the business groups who request security services to ensure each assignment and the scope of work are well planned, executed and confidential Perform security audits and assessments, review procedures and constantly evaluate facility activity/operations for security weaknesses that may reduce the facilities overall security posture Establish relationships with law enforcement, government agencies, EHS, facilities and outside vendors Manage daily security operations including the contract security guarding deployment Develop an in-depth understanding of Apple’s businesses and needs Build, implement and maintain site or project specific security procedures and plans Prepare and maintain security records for the site and complete routine statistical reports. Prepare operations orders as they relate to special events at the site Field security requests for short-term and non-recurring assignments Lead all aspects of a security budget, develop cost savers and resource planning Assist on other GS projects as requested
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.
Additional Requirements

We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 89 million accounts in more than 100 countries.

Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.

Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:

You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.
What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):

Manage a team of data scientists partnering with a cross functional team of engineers, designers and product managers who are building Coinbase’s new NFT marketplace, our GiveCrypto charitable offerings, our USDC stablecoin products and our Custodial products for institutional investors.
Help set goals and metrics to guide and prioritize product roadmaps
Design experiments to measure the impact of new product features
Scale data-informed decision making through ETLs and reporting dashboards created by your team
Identify opportunities to help inform the strategic direction of our fast growing business
Guide data scientists in their technical and professional development
Work closely with recruiting and other data team managers to help grow the team

What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):

5+ years of experience in managing other team members in a formal or informal capacity
10+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis at a technology company,
Proficiency with relational database (e.g., SQL) and statistical analysis/programming languages (e.g., R / Python)
Demonstrated ability to distill insights into strong product recommendations and utilize experimentation to test any data-led hypotheses
Experience communicating the results of analyses to leadership teams to influence the vision and roadmap of the company


Sounds Cool? Let's work together.

The Data Entry Clerk is responsible for recording confidential client information into multiple departmental databases. This is a part-time position and is not eligible for benefits. This position reports to the Data Manager.
Primary job Responsibilities
Record confidential information using a variety of data entry software
Maintain records and files
Photocopy and scan documents as required
Provide general administrative support to department and manager or director
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
At least one year of data entry experience
At least one year of record maintenance experience.
Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive information
Must be very detail oriented
Ability to handle multiple tasks with varying deadlines
Must have excellent time management and prioritizing skills
Must be a team player
Must have a professional attitude and work style

Position Purpose:
The Associate Project Manager is responsible for supporting teams by executing project management activities with minimal supervision. Associate Project Managers typically support low complexity projects in a non-vendor facing capacity. Associate Project Managers create and maintain project plans, develop and communicate status reports, manage issues and risks, and control project scope. In addition, they monitor and adjust to given budgets and complete associated internal cost-benefit analysis efforts.
Responsible for tracking labor spend
Performs follow-ups on discrepancies between forecasted spend and actuals
Creates and Distributes reporting related to project delivery, financials, staffing, and planning as needed
Manages small projects with direction and guidance from an experienced Project Manager
Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:
50% - Delivery & Support:
Executes project scoping and scope management planning; manages scope appropriately
Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met
Executes and documents cost benefit analysis and justification findings
Develops and communicates project plan, dependencies, and status updates highlighting any potential issues, including schedule, resource, cost, and risks; manages to project plan effectively
Applies lessons learned to subsequent projects
Executes change approval process and implementation of approved changes
Completes toll gate artifacts (Charter, Business Acceptance Document, etc.)

10% - Monitoring:
Identifies, defines, and takes action to mitigate project risks in a timely and effective manner
Monitors, tracks, and adjusts project plans based on critical milestones
Monitors budget; makes necessary adjustments to remain on budget, escalating as necessary
Monitors project activities to predict, mitigate, and remediate misalignments with The Home Depot's compliance regulations

40% - Administration & Operations:
Updates The Home Depot systems (including financial systems and project closeout)
Creates, documents, and uploads lessons learned
Executes other Project Management duties as needed
Monitors outstanding invoices and collects funds as necessary, escalating as needed
Publishes and tracks creation of related artifacts

Nature and Scope:
Typically reports to the Technology Coordination Manager or Sr. Manager.

For Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City residents: The pay range for this position is between 60k and 130k. Starting salary may vary based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, the position being offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. The Home Depot offers additional competitive financial and non-financial benefits, which may include a performance-based bonus program or a profit sharing program depending on position.

Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Standard Minimum Qualifications:
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Additional Minimum Qualifications:
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States

Education Required:
The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED.

Years of Relevant Work Experience:
0 years

Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Preferred Qualifications:
Highly proficient with Excel - pivots, vlookups, visualization
Ability to analyze data to understand trends, identify anomalies, and provide insights
Experience with project management tools such as smartsheets, MS Project, etc.
Experience with labor management or financials management in a corporate environment
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder
Plans and Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Self-Development: Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels

Remote, United States
Creative Production
About Netflix
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. Whatever your taste, and no matter where you live, we give you access to best-in-class TV shows, movies and documentaries. Our members control what they want to watch, when they want it, with no ads, in one simple subscription. We’re streaming in more than 30 languages and 190 countries, because great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere. We are the world’s biggest fans of entertainment, and we’re always looking to help you find your next favorite story.

There’s no better time to become a part of Netflix. We continue to revolutionize the way content is created and delivered to millions of users all across the globe while always striving to maintain a world-class user experience.
The Opportunity
Our mission is to revolutionize the way promotional content is created and delivered, finding new ways for prospective and current Netflix members to discover stories. This is your chance to help transform how Netflix titles are presented, consumed, and perceived.

As Netflix continues to scale across the globe, our Creative Planning team is a driving force in building how we ask for creative, how we find and prime the best creative talent around the globe, and how we streamline production. Made up of a diverse team of creative industry professionals, this team is reinventing how we create stories about our content.

One of our core objectives is to unlock the full potential of our creative partnerships including, but not limited to, ad agencies, creative freelancers, and production companies, who concept and develop creative campaigns and assets to promote Netflix titles. An important aspect of this work is establishing best-in-class onboarding and training programs and practices to prime our partners for success. As our team develops talent pipelines around the world, there is a need for someone to play a critical role in guiding the vision, strategy, and roadmap of our global onboarding and training programs, as well as driving ongoing adoption with internal cross-functional teams and creative partners.

The Program Manager - Onboarding & Training will also maintain a sustainable infrastructure that will ultimately support a pipeline of talent to creative projects, ensuring they are primed and ready for their first creative brief whether it be to develop a trailer or key art for an upcoming Netflix title or to ideate creative concepts for one of our audience-led social channels. This role will also aid in setting up key success metrics of these onboarding and training programs, analyzing partner performance data, and making informed decisions to enhance training efforts that steer towards partner success.

The role is based in the US (Remote) and will report to the Manager, Creative Planning.
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop, recommend, and execute onboarding and training programs and practices to ensure both new and existing creative partners are set up for success
Lead the establishment of the global onboarding and training vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmap
Evolve and maintain the onboarding and training infrastructure that powers training sites, playbooks, email notifications, training sessions, and partner events, as well as curate and design these resources
Optimize onboarding and training workflows as the business evolves to ensure clarity and accuracy
Lead the internal content working group and act as the key connector between all team members to ensure all activities are laddering up to the larger strategy
Co-develop training initiatives and resources to further enhance our inclusion and diversity program efforts
Drive the measurement strategy and reporting of initiatives to ensure they are meeting or exceeding our success metrics
Conduct ongoing assessments to understand the needs of important internal stakeholder teams
Maintain positive relationships with existing creative partners and promote a high level of partner trust and transparency
Stay connected to broader Netflix-wide training programs and platforms to identify synergies
Keep finger on the pulse of the industry at large (outside Netflix) to gain knowledge on how to improve our programs
Qualifications:
Working experience in the creative industry (Brand or Agency side) with an understanding of how creative is made
Proven expertise in developing and driving adoption of training programs for large scale creative engagements, including aligning internal stakeholders from many departments
Proficient written communication skills with the ability to make complex subjects understandable
Strong ability to unpack large scale problems to establish a roadmap based on impact
An unshakeable respect for the importance and impact of I&D at any organization and an openness to, and respect for, cultural differences
Self-starter with the ability to prioritize work in a dynamic and complex environment to maintain program progress
Confidence to rely on self judgment, discretion to work autonomously, and take smart risks
Experience with large scale problem-solving and rolling up their sleeves to build the solutions
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive them to successful and flawless execution
Comfortable working with and leveraging data to understand and action learnings
Exceptional communicator with strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and build relationships
Experience working with expanding global businesses and teams a plus
Prior experience working in Airtable, Zapier, CMS, eLearning a plus
Experience working in a cross-cultural international environment is a plus
APPLY NOW

job_title: Product Manager, Product Data Tools (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
job_description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to social media, digital marketing and the retail store experience, our teams at NIKE Digital are reimagining how design and technology meet to serve consumers more directly and personally. We invest in cutting-edge technologies and work with the most creative people in the world. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.
Omni-Channel Product Platform (OCPP) is the source of truth for product data needed for consumers to conduct commerce activities where they want and how they want. The Omni-Channel Product Platform is the natural evolution and response to the digital growth we are experiencing today and have the goal to grow in the next 5 years. The Product Data Tools team will be critical in moving Nike’s Operations teams into an Omni-Channel ecosystem, with connected tools, systems and re-envisioned Operations processes.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to help move our Product Data tools into a world where consumers can find our products where they want and how they want! Our team is looking for a candidate with a solid understanding of Nike’s tool ecosystem, Operational business processes and has the creativity to work across functions to move Nike into the Omni-Channel future. This person is passionate about delivering solutions for Nike’s world-wide Operations teams and has a track record of conceiving, building, and improving digital experiences that change the way users work well with their tools every day so that Nike can re-envision the commerce landscape for consumers. The selected candidate will obsess building trust with our Operations, Engineering and Program partners to recognise the real problems that need to be solved, develop a strategy for migrating users to a new platform and implement perfectly on that strategy. Our best Product Managers are detail oriented, data driven, consumer focused and outstanding communicators who work well across a diverse set of cross functional partner teams to deliver outstanding solutions.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
This will be working with the Omni-Channel Product Platform and Product Data Tools team as the owner for Product Readiness and Activations! As Product Manager you will help to define and implement the product strategy, lead the end-to-end lifecycle of a product and help identify key dependencies, handle risks and measure success.
A typical day/week looks like leading cross-functional meetings, working with key team members to identify requirements, coordinating with other Product Managers to ensure a seamless transition from the legacy tools to the new outstanding tools. This person will also be facilitating the Scrum/Agile ceremonies with engineering teams and developing and maintaining key artifacts to communicate plans and progress.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
In this role, this person will work across a set of cross functional teams including experience design, global technology & engineering, Nike Digital Direct Commerce Global and Geography Operations and nearly every other commerce digital product teams. You will lead through influence by using data and risk analysis to make informed decisions and will be a team member who effectively prioritizes resources appropriately to achieve business goals while delighting Nike’s customers.
Management of Feature Development for Product Readiness and Activations.
Pro-active Definition of Feature Specifications: Partner with other Product Managers and Experience Design to develop wire-frames while defining mutually exclusive and collectively comprehensive user requirements and stories in collaboration with multiple engineering teams.
Bring to bear Consumer Compassion: Live your customer’s reality – both your Operations consumers of the legacy and new tools AND the Nike consumer looking to make purchasing decisions in an Omni-Channel commerce environment, deconstruct the sophisticated Operations tools landscape at Nike and deliver a transition from old to new for both sets of consumers.
Exhibit a Bias for Delivery: Participate in Agile ceremonies and keep the cross functional team passionate about near term results in a constantly evolving environment.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor's Degree or higher or combination of relevant education, experience and Training.
3+ years of relevant work experience, working as a Product Manager on Agile development teams passionate about global digital products, preferably within the domain of digital commerce.
Strong analytical background and/or relevant data driven job experience.
Outstanding problem solving, with emphasis on useful data driven decision making.
High attention to detail including a consistent track record to document requirements.
Outstanding communication and decision making skills.

Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.
For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $117,000 per year. Information about benefits can be found here

Nike requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire, unless otherwise required by law. As an equal opportunity employer, Nike will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

job_title: Program Manager, Data Center Environmental, Health, and Safety
job_description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Engineering, a related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in designing and implementing systems to manage operational risks.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications:

Certification from the Board of Certified Safety Professionals or equivalent agency.
Experience in communicating with federal, state, and local authorities regarding Environmental Health and Safety issues.
Experience with managing and permitting air quality permits.
Experience with waste water and hazardous chemical management.
Knowledge of facilities management, engineering, and operations.
About the job
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

As a Program Manager of the Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) team, you will support programs including management system implementation, environmental compliance, and global oversight. You will play a critical part in ensuring all EHS issues are identified and addressed by working with a cross-functional team. You will provide program leadership and oversight to new initiatives to continue to create and iterate our EHS program.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Maintain environmental permits/programs to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations.
Identify and evaluate operational EHS risks assessing the impact to the business, analyze risk scenarios to determine their potential impact, and design/lead programs to mitigate those risks.
Conduct assessments of existing EHS programs to ensure alignment with our regional strategy, including analyzing EHS business risks and identifying, describing, and estimating efficiencies to be gained through established programs.
Assess EHS training needs based on identified operational risks and ensure that workforce training activities are provided to meet business and legislative requirements.
Investigate and analyze incident reports involving work‐related injuries, illnesses, and recommend measures to prevent recurrence.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 89 million accounts in more than 100 countries.

Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.

Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:

You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.
What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):

Manage a team of data scientists partnering with a cross functional team of engineers, designers and product managers who are building Coinbase’s new NFT marketplace, our GiveCrypto charitable offerings, our USDC stablecoin products and our Custodial products for institutional investors.
Help set goals and metrics to guide and prioritize product roadmaps
Design experiments to measure the impact of new product features
Scale data-informed decision making through ETLs and reporting dashboards created by your team
Identify opportunities to help inform the strategic direction of our fast growing business
Guide data scientists in their technical and professional development
Work closely with recruiting and other data team managers to help grow the team

What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):

5+ years of experience in managing other team members in a formal or informal capacity
10+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis at a technology company,
Proficiency with relational database (e.g., SQL) and statistical analysis/programming languages (e.g., R / Python)
Demonstrated ability to distill insights into strong product recommendations and utilize experimentation to test any data-led hypotheses
Experience communicating the results of analyses to leadership teams to influence the vision and roadmap of the company


Sounds Cool? Let's work together.

job_title: Data Center Site Security Manager, Global Security
job_description:
Summary
Posted: Mar 3, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200352009
Do you instinctively know how and when to take action? Do you love performing under pressure? As part of our Global Security team, you’ll help manage the security needs of Apple’s most valuable assets: our people, properties and innovations. Join us and you’ll play a significant role in preserving the highest standard of security for one of the most watched companies in the world. Apple's Global Security team is looking for a Data Site Security Manager to work directly with business units, vendors, and facilities teams to provide security services. Your work will help build solutions to a variety of unique security challenges, ranging from the physical security of sites and events, to the protection of our supply chain. You'll develop solutions to support our physical security capabilities, increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our operation, and coordinate critical incidents affecting Apple.
Key Qualifications
5+ years of corporate site security or program management experience preferred, global experience is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to react to changes in a time critical environment to meet security needs and quickly evaluate situations
Experience managing, coordinating and maintaining multiple projects
Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks within dynamic conditions
Demonstrate excellent communication with a strong attention to detail and courage to take initiative and drive projects to completion
Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally
Strong organizational skills
Experience crafting Keynotes and presenting to senior management
Must be able to work nights, weekends and holidays
Travel 10 - 25% of the time, with on-call responsibilities
Description
The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert (SME) ensuring a site remains secure, assess security risks, develop internal controls for privacy, incident prevention or proprietary information theft and ensure that employees are safe. In addition, the duties include but are not limited to: Work with leaders from the business groups who request security services to ensure each assignment and the scope of work are well planned, executed and confidential Perform security audits and assessments, review procedures and constantly evaluate facility activity/operations for security weaknesses that may reduce the facilities overall security posture Establish relationships with law enforcement, government agencies, EHS, facilities and outside vendors Manage daily security operations including the contract security guarding deployment Develop an in-depth understanding of Apple’s businesses and needs Build, implement and maintain site or project specific security procedures and plans Prepare and maintain security records for the site and complete routine statistical reports. Prepare operations orders as they relate to special events at the site Field security requests for short-term and non-recurring assignments Lead all aspects of a security budget, develop cost savers and resource planning Assist on other GS projects as requested
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.
