Harris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes.
Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease.
Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s Hospitals & Health Networks magazine.
Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to Excellence™ designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.
Skills / Requirements
Job Summary
This position reports to the Director Payroll & Time/Attendance and should require only minimal oversight. Responsible for functional aspects of the organizational Kronos Time and Labor (T&L) module(s) to ensure timely and accurate time collection and labor reporting in accordance with both regulatory standards/laws and organizational policies and procedures.


Oversees the bi-weekly Kronos close process. Maintains a controlled environment through the establishment of best practices and ensures continuous monitoring of the transactional data to prevent upstream T&L errors. Approves out-of-period historical edits and is able to compute complex hours calculations where needed. Performs research and analysis to correct errors and root cause process/system failures within span of control. Oversee maintenance and support of these systems and data quality assurance for the benefit of Harris Health System. Assure system optimization and data integration between multiple software applications. In concert with the Director of Payroll and Corporate Compliance, safeguard the system against fraud and abuse.


Ensures T&L processes are documented, periodically reviewed, and published in the respective repositories for appropriate access. Governing policies must be reviewed at least every (5) five years, or as regulations change, to ensure mandatory requirements are met. Possesses a solid understanding of federal and state wage and hour laws (e.g. Department of Labor (DOL) or other wage and hour mandatory standards is compulsory). Support the VP-Controller in establishing and enforcing accountability, cohesiveness and consistency in applying the policies and procedures across Harris Health.


Manages the T&L staff and coordinates the activities of a first-touch resolution like call center to minimize escalations and reduce lag delays in response times. Creates transparency for those involved in resolution efforts.

Continually identifies areas of automation, process improvement and optimization. Unafraid to fail, learn and adapt as needed to find better ways to achieve the mission of Harris Health. Remain current with the latest DOL or other wage and hourly standards, trends, processes, policies and challenges affecting payroll. Lead or participate in other special projects as assigned by the Director of Payroll while working with various cross functional teams such as Information Systems, Human Resources, Accounting, and Pavilions. Examples may include various process improvement initiatives, systems projects and reporting developments.


The successful candidate will have the ability to work both independently and in a team environment. The communication efforts by the T&L Manager are constant so proficiency in both oral and written communications are a must.

Minimum Qualifications

Degrees:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or related field

Work Experience:
Seven (7) years of work experience in high volume processing area required; System-wide time collection experience required; Experience preparing formalized documentation required

Management Experience: Two (2) years of Supervisory experience

Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal Communication (Heavy Public Contact), Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking); Writing /Correspondence, Writing /Reports

Proficiencies: P.C., MS Word, MS Excel

Job Attributes

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Analytical, Mathematics, Research, Statistical

Work Schedule: Flexible

Equipment Operated: Standard office equipment including multi-function printers, scanners, copiers, calculators.

Remote Work: At this time the position will work remotely from a Texas based home office. Candidate must be able to meet the requirements of Harris Health Systems Telecommuting Policies. The arrangement is subject to change at the level up leaders discretion. The position will report on premise as business needs dictate or as otherwise requested and with minimal notice (i.e. the next day).

Other Requirements: Prior system conversion a plus. Knowledge of federal & state wage and hour laws a strong plus. SharePoint and Kronos

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
The first spark of a product idea sets the NIKE, Inc. Product team into motion. The team of developers, testers, engineers, designers and managers obsess over Nike’s iconic silhouettes and create groundbreaking new styles. They collaborate, ideate and refine products’ construction, fit and materials. They maintain a keen understanding of consumer and market trends. They skillfully operate at the intersection of buyer needs, technical feasibility and business objectives. And they work lockstep with Merchandising, Design, Manufacturing and others to produce the final result: products that reflect the soul of sport and inspire athletes to reach new levels of performance.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We’re looking for a Global Product Data Governance Manager in Consumer Creation Operations who is highly motivated, possesses a strong business focused approach to work, and leads & drives through ambiguity. You will use your knowledge and experience to lead the development and maintenance of effective product data governance policies and processes for NIKE's entire product data and system landscape and will have an opportunity to partner with associates across the organization.
This role establishes & drives product data governance in Product Merchandising functions through routine engagement & influence. Aligning the business’ needs for information with existing data and defines & activates new data needs.
The candidate needs to have knowledge of Data Governance disciplines – Principles, standards, business processes and data integrity. Must have familiarity of Nike product, processes and product functions. Skills include:
Being a problem solver; identifying problems, analyzing, resolving and understanding impacts
Confidence in approaching and influencing business partners
Operating with minimal guidance, leading change and decisions within guidelines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, making complex scenarios simple
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
You will report directly to the Global Product Data Governance Director. You’ll be working with multiple cross-functional business and technical partners to align business needs, document & maintain data policies, processes, data collateral and best practices within each function. You will establish & drive governance in functions through routine engagement & influence. Lead term alignment and product data Intake vetting activities. Lead change management processes for product data. Lead data policy & process training.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
This role will work closely with other Product Data Governance Managers and data Stewards cross-functionally, Global and Geo. In addition, you will engage and partner with multiple cross-functional business partners in Product Merchandising, Product Development, Consumer Planning, and Finance. As well as Technical partners across multiple capabilities and tools.

WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience and training
5+ years of work experience in Finance, Data Governance, Information Management or a related function. Will accept suitable combination of education, experience and/or training.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate status, issues, risks, and recommendations
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, partners, cross functional business leaders, and peers
Excellent project management skills and experience leading mid-large cross-functional projects
Strong appreciation for working with data, quality, compliance and controls
High standards for attention to detail and process orientation
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment
Strong desire to learn and continuously improve
Advanced proficiency with MS Office suite

job_title: Manager, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Austell, GA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics or equivalent experience
10 years of experience working in related disciplines
8 years of experience leading data engineering and analytics, business intelligence and data models using SQL and Python languages
5 years of Technical Program Management experience in a data-related domain
Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics or a related discipline
2 years of experience as a people manager, implementing data programs like data warehouse platforms, ETL, data architecture, and data integration tools and business processes
Experience leading organizational change efforts using data tools and solutions to improve organization efficiency
About the job

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you will lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects for Google’s Data Center (GCD) teams. You will work with stakeholders to build and execute data ingestion, leadership dashboards, data modeling and data warehouse infrastructure projects, creating a framework for effective decision making using data. You will effectively manage program schedules, highlight risk, and communicates goals.
As a Technical Program Manager focusing on data centers, you will architect and build data engineering processes and drive quality/consistency of data across business functions. You will use your technical and data expertise to establish robust data pipelines and solutions to facilitate trusted data availability across multiple systems at Google Data Centers.
You will work with our Data Center business stakeholders to understand their data issues and challenges, utilize your technical expertise to build and deploy simple, efficient, secure, and scalable data solutions, services, and insights. You will manage a portfolio of programs that help GCD teams successfully operate, while transforming the organization by building and integrating the next wave of data solutions to increase trust in data, insights, and data-driven decision-making.
Responsibilities
Manage a team of Data Engineering Technical Program Managers to implement and build a portfolio of data tools covering data pipelines, dashboards, data alerts, predictive analytics and machine learning algorithms, translating raw insights into strategic directions for leadership and business stakeholders.
Lead the technical delivery, implementation, and business adoption of new scalable and reliable data analytics, and business intelligence solutions for cross-department leadership and business teams.
Manage all aspects of program deliverables from project inception to implementation and resource oversight.
Traverse complex large datasets to extract business insights that directly help to maintain up-time of critical data center operations, and increase operating efficiency of teams responsible for designing and building Google’s data center footprint.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
The Lens team creatively applies cutting-edge technology to bring products like Face Lenses, World Lenses, and Snapabbles to life for the more than 175 million people using AR daily on Snapchat. This team of designers, data scientists, and product and program managers are passionate about helping Snapchatters around the globe experience the magic of AR in their everyday worlds.
We’re looking for a Manager, Data Science to join Team Snapchat!
What you’ll do
Help build and manage a team of high performing data scientists and help them execute along the most important priorities and deliver world-class products
Establishes a positive, mutually supporting, inclusive and fun team environment where every employee can do their best.
Work cross-functionally and partner with product managers, engineers, and researchers to solve problems, and conduct analytics studies to identify new product opportunities and shape product strategy
Conduct in-depth analysis of all data sources, asking the right questions, testing hypotheses, identifying patterns and providing the necessary business context to translate what it all means
Lead the development & implementation of regular insights share-outs that drive the consumer voice throughout the organization
Deliver on data science and analytics roadmap including continuous improvement, accurate and timely reporting and measurement
Provide strategic direction, project clarity, methodological consultation and deliver results both individually and through managing a high performing team.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages, such as R, MATLAB, Stata, etc.
Working knowledge of predictive modeling, machine learning, and experimentation/ causal inference methods
Expertise in the data workflow and pipeline and lead a team responsible for data capture, measurement, and optimization capability management.
Expertise in SQL and familiarity with Python
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high attention to detail
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to balance practical business needs and scientific rigor
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as math, statistics, and computer science, or equivalent years of experience
5+ years of experience in data science doing quantitative analysis, and applied statistics or experimentation (i.e. A/B testing) at a technology company
3+ years experience in a leadership role within an data organization
Preferred qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field (Economics, Computer Science, Physics)
Experience forming partnerships with cross-functional leaders in engineering, product, design, research, etc.
Proven track record in transforming data into meaningful insights and opportunities to drive growth and performance.
At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com .
Our Benefits : Snap Inc. is its own community, so we’ve got your back! We do our best to make sure you and your loved ones have everything you need to be happy and healthy, on your own terms. Our benefits are built around your needs and include paid maternity & paternity leave, comprehensive medical coverage, emotional and mental health support programs, and compensation packages that let you share in Snap’s long-term success!

job_title: Data Analyst, Business Analysis and Reporting – VIRTUAL/REMOTE
job_description:
Publix is able to offer virtual/remote employment for this position in the following states: FL, GA, AL, TN, SC, NC, VA


If you want to solve exciting and cutting-edge analytics problems and also enjoy the stability of a Fortune 100 company, then the Publix Data Analytics team may be right for you. We use large data sets and analytic models to solve our most challenging problems. This includes mining and analyzing financial and operational data, designing and developing data systems and collaborating with internal partners to reveal insights that lead to great decisions. The Data Analyst reports to the Business Analysis and Reporting Data Scientist.

Additional responsibilities include:
develop new analyses, metrics and reports to provide insightful recommendations to supply chain analytics team members, senior managers, as well as retail and various support departments
develop algorithms and new analytical models which transform a process into a data model
participate and actively engage in strategic initiatives which require analytic support
coordinate with Data Scientists to proactively seek learning and training opportunities to enhance data modeling
Important: Please note that Publix will not sponsor any hire for this position for an H-1B visa or permanent residence.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, MIS, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or another analytical discipline from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience
demonstrated experience solving analytical problems (work experience or course work)
knowledge of data analytics best practices as they relate to optimizing financial performance, labor efficiency and customer service
broad understanding of Information Systems design methodologies, testing, processes and language
knowledge of accounting/finance principles and exceptional math/statistics skills
leadership skills, including the ability to influence others
excellent written and verbal communication skills, including interpersonal skills
intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Access & SQL
intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
exceptional multi-tasking and prioritization abilities
ability to work under minimal supervision and be self-directed with workload
strong negotiation skills
willingness to work extended hours and weekends to meet deadlines
Address: 3300 Publix Corporate Parkway

We are seeking a Senior Manager to join our Data Governance team. This role will lead a cross-functional team of data compliance and governance analysts to help implement controls across our data ecosystem and drive customer centric governance solutions across our products. You will directly contribute to the success of our data strategy by working cross-functionally with data, legal, marketing, engineering and product across our global footprint for Disney Streaming Services.

At Disney Streaming Services, data is central to measuring all aspects of the business, and critical to its operations and growth. Data Governance works closely with product, engineering, architecture, legal and information security teams to drive our governance strategy designed to ensure quality data that is both secure and compliant.

Prepare customer statements, bills and invoices, and reconcile expenses to the general ledger.
Calculate and post receipts to appropriate general ledger accounts and verify details of transactions, such as funds received and total account balances.

 Prepare monthly receivable statements, reconcile account and ledger balance sheets.
 Compile and sort documents, prepare and post invoices and credit and debit memos.
 Make copies of all checks, complete deposit slips and make bank deposits.
 Work with collections personnel to verify status of delinquent accounts and solicit payments on overdue accounts.
 Provide backup support to other groups in the accounting department, type periodic reports and perform other general administrative duties.
Rely on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job.
Work under immediate supervision and typically report to a supervisor or the manager.

Get a cup of coffee. This job description is long!
Our company helps people get what they want from technology so they can focus on running their business, law firm, or medical practice. We also manage technology for schools and perform project work for large organizations. Big picture - We do all sorts of things, from designing networks to providing ongoing maintenance; we are the company that our clients call for everything from essential computer support, to hosted solutions, to network management. Some clients want to push the envelope with new technologies and some want to keep things working and minimize costs.
We are looking for great people who are excited about technology and enjoy dealing directly with clients. We are fanatics about client service, we run a responsive and professional operation, and we love what we do. (OK, we don't love it every day but most days we do.) We are looking to build our team with people who want to learn about the latest technology and want to contribute to our team. Every day is different over here, and you must learn quickly and go with it. Now for the boring requirements…
Position Responsibilities:
The Customer Success Manager is responsible for nurturing existing customer relationships that promote retention, satisfaction, and loyalty. The position will work closely with customers to ensure they are satisfied with the services they receive and to improve upon areas of dissatisfaction.
The Customer Success Manager is responsible for creating policies and procedures that optimize the customer experience. The position will gather feedback from customers, study other customer success programs, and analyze customer data to identify the best practices. Sometimes it's a phone call, sometimes its a videoconference, and sometimes.... wait for it.... you will meet the client in person! Like the old days! The Customer Success Manager must establish policies the entire staff can adhere to, so all customers receive the same quality of service.
The Customer Success Manager must know the company’s products and services from a business solution perspective. They may even help customers plan and understand the best ways to utilize the company’s services or products based on the customer’s business needs.
The Customer Success Manager is not a sales position, but the person in this role will educate customers on the flexibility and capabilities of the company’s skills. We want our customers to know what we can do so they continue to use our services. Fear not- you will not be doing the technical work! No one will ask you to fix their network problems or make a change to their server!
The Customer Success Manager (CSM) should possess fantastic interpersonal skills and be a strong leader. The CSM needs to be highly organized. They should also be excellent communicators both orally and in writing. The CSM should have a passionate drive for success. You need to wake up every day, planning on how you will make a difference.
The CSM must align their daily duties to meet company defined metrics that are related to our client’s overall success. Examples are, meeting with client decision-makers on a routine basis, determining opportunities for the operational teams to deliver a better service or product to the client, and tracking client satisfaction, profitability, retention, and loyalty.!
Position Requirements:Great organizational, presentation, and client service skills. Skill in planning and preparing written communications. Basically, the ability to communicate with humans.4+ years experience in managing customer success in previous positions.Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quicklyAbility to work in a team and communicate effectivelySelf-starter who can take on tasks independently when necessaryThe ability to explain, at a high level, what we do to our clients who may not be interested in technical details. OK. "May not be interested" is a nice way of saying "Most of them don't know what we do but they know when things are working so you need to be able to explain the benefits of the services we provide."
Typical Physical Demands: Requires the ability to sit for extended periods, Requires normal range of vision and hearing.
This role is onsite with clients, in our office, and can be done remotely sometimes as well.
Education: Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Experience Required.
A couple of other things:You must provide your own car and smartphone (phone allowance provided)You must be fun to work with. Must understand humor.If you've applied before, I've got your resume and will give you a call if it's a potential fit.If, after reading all of this, you are still awake and interested, please apply!

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
3+ years of people management experience.
3+ years of program management experience.
Proven experience as a technical writer, editor or content strategist.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Demonstrated experience implementing and using Content Management Systems.
Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
Has a proven record managing multiple large cross-functional projects simultaneously with competing priorities and tight deadlines.

Job summary
In Books, authors and readers are at the heart of what we do. We offer a team environment that thrives on innovation and excellence, and our staff is talented, energetic, and passionate about creating an exceptional customer experience. If you want to work for a team who delights customers, solves problems, and is at the forefront of innovation this is the job for you!

The Books team is seeking a Manager of Content Management who shows strong ownership, leadership and has a track record of driving significant business results at a high bar. The work is fast paced and will demand strong communication and program management skills. The role will focus on leading a team of content developers and strategists who create and improve content (processes, blurbs and help) for the Books operations team. This person will set the improvement strategy and develop, drive the program roadmap. They will help the team navigate a highly ambiguous, fast-paced environment and drive towards high quality outputs timely. The role will work closely with other Content Managers, Operations Teams, Risk Management, and Program Managers. You will play a significant role in the development of a successful and effective operations team.

Key job responsibilities

Lead, coach and develop a team of content writers and strategists
Set and lead the team in driving improvement initiatives through content initiatives.
Write and present strategy and recommendation documents to align with stakeholders and multiple levels of leadership.
Leverage data to evaluate business impact, track the usage, and define effectiveness of the content.
Navigate ambiguous situations, identify, and solve for blockers with minimal guidance.
Effectively influence and build strong cross-organizational partnerships.
Present and lead conversations about projects, issues, solutions, and strategy to leadership and stakeholders.
Develop mechanisms for content writers to reliably produce high quality, verified knowledge.
Build, prioritize and continuously iterate on team roadmap initiatives.
Team capacity and planning.
Prioritize effectively and communicate clearly across all levels of the organization.
Own and contribute to multiple concurrent improvement initiatives.
Proven ability to bring clarity to ambiguous situation.
High level of integrity and discretion to handle confidential information.
Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.
Experience developing operational processes and process improvement.
Advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, SQL and Tableau.
Experience writing and presenting documents to narrate proposals and secure alignment with multiple levels of leadership.
Experience with Lean and/or Six Sigma tools and methodologies.
Familiarity with basics of HTML. Formatting text, creating tables, setting links.
Aptitude to quickly learn new systems and software.

Product
We are looking for a creative and passionate (Associate) Product Manager to join the Music Vertical Platform organization, Spotify’s division dedicated to helping artists thrive! Our mission is to create tools that help artists and their teams build an audience, monetize their fans, and live off their work. A new team focused on Product Marketing has spun up to help find innovative ways to drive adoption, deepen engagement, educate and further support artists and their teams to advance their careers.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Full Time Contractor
In this role, you will work with a cross-functional team from Product, Design, Engineering, Product Insights, Comms, and Music Partnerships, as well as the rest of Marketing to bring industry-leading marketing tools, systems, and microsites to market — from concept, all the way through testing, launch, and adoption stages. From working with our internal teams to understand and build for creator needs, to working closely with Marketing to establish powerful campaigns to inspire creators and their teams to use our tools in new ways, you’ll be instrumental in creating the future of how music and the Spotify creator ecosystem is experienced by our users.

You will help set the roadmap for the Martech development team, coordinating with your counterparts across the company to align on the highest impact work the team can deliver. You’ll help the team lead intake and prioritization processes, gaining an in-depth understanding of and contributing to strategy at the Mission and company level. You’ll work with key Marketing stakeholders to set goals and milestones for projects. As this is a new team, you will have the existing opportunity to bring fresh ideas to space and help evolve the mission, vision, and direction of the team to ensure maximum impact.
What you'll do
Partner with Product Area Lead and Agile support team members to mold a new team from the ground up by running workshops to establish and align on mission, vision, ways of working, user journey and product development roadmap.
Engage with the development team as the Product Owner to contribute to and lead aspects of our agile scrum practices (ie. participation with standup, backlog grooming, sprint planning, quarterly planning, and retrospectives).
Help to define and own team goals and OKRs with focus on Mission level impact.
Thoughtfully collaborate to brainstorm new tools, product ideas and strategies to drive growth and engagement in partnership with the wider Creator Marketing team.
Support the go-to-market strategy and ongoing release cadence for key marketing product initiatives for artists and their teams from ideation to launch and adoption.
Create and drive a holistic internal strategy around marketing tools in coordination with the rest of the Creator Product Marketing team.
Advocate on the behalf of creators, partnering with design and product insights on identifying and understanding user needs, behaviors and problems.
Coordinate across all cross-functional partners — including artist & label partnerships, licensing, legal, and support — ensuring feedback is prioritized and ultimately leads to a better product for creators.
Learn to partner with data scientists and user researchers to understand the performance of your tools, features and systems and identify new opportunities of focus for the future.
Continue to grow your Product Management skills through group instruction and individual learning.
Who you are
You have a passion for marketing and the creator space.
You’re a compelling storyteller who can communicate in succinct and inspiring ways to a variety of audience types.
You have strong personal organization and project management abilities.
You’re very familiar with the product development life cycle and have hands-on experience helping to launch new products or services.
You’re collaborative by nature and get energy from building cross-functional teams and bringing people together.
You’re passionate about the opportunity to better serve artists & their teams. You love music.
You’re excited to learn how to create product development strategies using both quantitative and qualitative insights.
Experience with managing and engaging external agency relationships is a plus.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration, and you will be expected to work EST hours, no matter where you are located in the Americas region.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

The Data Entry Coordinator will be responsible for data entry and providing some administrative support to the Chief Information Officer, Information Technology Support Manager, and the IT Department overall. The candidate will have a strong presence, with excellent interpersonal and social skills and an exhaustive attention to detail. The candidate must adapt to changing priorities and remain comfortable holding others accountable throughout the company while helping to enforce department policies.

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Assist in the management of the company document management systems, including adhering to and enforcing all current conventions
Assist with the asset management process
Assist with invoice gathering, credit card statement reconciliation and related data entry
Assist with IT and company product ordering
Provide assistance to the Chief Information Officer and Information Technology Support Manager on any other specially assigned projects
Create and keep guides and other documentation up to date
Maintain and increase knowledge and skills through professional development
Other administrative tasks as needed

Skills:
Must have an exhaustive attention to detail
Ability to work independently on assigned tasks as part of a team
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task with strong organizational and documentation skills
Excellent interpersonal skills with polished communication both verbally and in written form
Ability to maintain a professional demeanor under pressure and operate with keen sense of urgency and commitment to quality
Ability to handle confidential information and sensitive issues with diplomacy and discretion

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1 year of previous relevant experience in Data Entry; OR High School Diploma and a minimum of 3 year's previous relevant experience in Data Entry
Previous administrative experience
Desire to learn corporate technology
Ability to learn new concepts, processes and software applications quickly and thoroughly
Advanced computer literacy expected
Comfortable with training others in either a group or one-on-one setting
Knowledge of Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Must have an iOS or Android smartphone to be able to access ORC's systems
English language proficient

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with accounting (invoice tracking, etc.) or asset management a plus

ORC is one of America’s most respected right-of-way acquisition firms. Our services not only include providing outsourced right-of-way services to public agencies, but also electric transmission, oil and gas pipelines, fiber optic, and sewer and water infrastructure. We are excited to be part of the renewable energy forefront for wind and solar projects.

Physical Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to clearly communicate and exchange information in person, via phone and email. Substantial repetitive movements of the wrists, hands and/or fingers due to high computer usage and typing. Expected to spend long spans of time in front of a computer screen. Able to read, understand and interpret department related documents and data. The employee is required to move about inside the office to access files, office equipment and to interact with other members of the staff. While meeting with clients and vendors, will need to be outdoors traversing different types of landscapes. May be exposed to the elements (heat, rain, snow, cold).

job_title: Product Manager, Product Data Tools (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
job_description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to social media, digital marketing and the retail store experience, our teams at NIKE Digital are reimagining how design and technology meet to serve consumers more directly and personally. We invest in cutting-edge technologies and work with the most creative people in the world. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.
Omni-Channel Product Platform (OCPP) is the source of truth for product data needed for consumers to conduct commerce activities where they want and how they want. The Omni-Channel Product Platform is the natural evolution and response to the digital growth we are experiencing today and have the goal to grow in the next 5 years. The Product Data Tools team will be critical in moving Nike’s Operations teams into an Omni-Channel ecosystem, with connected tools, systems and re-envisioned Operations processes.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to help move our Product Data tools into a world where consumers can find our products where they want and how they want! Our team is looking for a candidate with a solid understanding of Nike’s tool ecosystem, Operational business processes and has the creativity to work across functions to move Nike into the Omni-Channel future. This person is passionate about delivering solutions for Nike’s world-wide Operations teams and has a track record of conceiving, building, and improving digital experiences that change the way users work well with their tools every day so that Nike can re-envision the commerce landscape for consumers. The selected candidate will obsess building trust with our Operations, Engineering and Program partners to recognise the real problems that need to be solved, develop a strategy for migrating users to a new platform and implement perfectly on that strategy. Our best Product Managers are detail oriented, data driven, consumer focused and outstanding communicators who work well across a diverse set of cross functional partner teams to deliver outstanding solutions.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
This will be working with the Omni-Channel Product Platform and Product Data Tools team as the owner for Product Readiness and Activations! As Product Manager you will help to define and implement the product strategy, lead the end-to-end lifecycle of a product and help identify key dependencies, handle risks and measure success.
A typical day/week looks like leading cross-functional meetings, working with key team members to identify requirements, coordinating with other Product Managers to ensure a seamless transition from the legacy tools to the new outstanding tools. This person will also be facilitating the Scrum/Agile ceremonies with engineering teams and developing and maintaining key artifacts to communicate plans and progress.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
In this role, this person will work across a set of cross functional teams including experience design, global technology & engineering, Nike Digital Direct Commerce Global and Geography Operations and nearly every other commerce digital product teams. You will lead through influence by using data and risk analysis to make informed decisions and will be a team member who effectively prioritizes resources appropriately to achieve business goals while delighting Nike’s customers.
Management of Feature Development for Product Readiness and Activations.
Pro-active Definition of Feature Specifications: Partner with other Product Managers and Experience Design to develop wire-frames while defining mutually exclusive and collectively comprehensive user requirements and stories in collaboration with multiple engineering teams.
Bring to bear Consumer Compassion: Live your customer’s reality – both your Operations consumers of the legacy and new tools AND the Nike consumer looking to make purchasing decisions in an Omni-Channel commerce environment, deconstruct the sophisticated Operations tools landscape at Nike and deliver a transition from old to new for both sets of consumers.
Exhibit a Bias for Delivery: Participate in Agile ceremonies and keep the cross functional team passionate about near term results in a constantly evolving environment.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor's Degree or higher or combination of relevant education, experience and Training.
3+ years of relevant work experience, working as a Product Manager on Agile development teams passionate about global digital products, preferably within the domain of digital commerce.
Strong analytical background and/or relevant data driven job experience.
Outstanding problem solving, with emphasis on useful data driven decision making.
High attention to detail including a consistent track record to document requirements.
Outstanding communication and decision making skills.

Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.
For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $117,000 per year. Information about benefits can be found here

Nike requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire, unless otherwise required by law. As an equal opportunity employer, Nike will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

job_title: Data Manager - Cancer Moonshot Program - HCC Clinical Trials Office - Hollings Cancer Center
job_description:
Job no: 541268
Entity: MUSC University
Department: ACADEMIC AFFAIRS - Hollings Cancer Center
Sub Department: UNIV-2101020-HCC Clinical Trials Office
Work type: Full-Time
Employee Type: UNIV - Classified
Location: Charleston, SC-Downtown, Hollings Cancer Center
Categories: Administrative & Non-Clinical Professionals
Pay scale: UNIV-Band 4: $28,216.00 - $40,210.00 - $52,204.00 (min - mid - max)
FLSA: Hourly


Job Summary: Under general supervision of the Clinical Trials Office (CTO), Manager of Clinical Operations, coordinates and supervises complex data management activities involving protocol management including data management, and specimen submission. Patient follow-up, patient caseload and data management. Provides core support for oncology research studies at the Hollings Cancer Center.


Job Duties:

35% - Maintains current, long-term follow-up and survival data on assigned patient caseload. Data submission is timely and accurate per the protocol, patient calendar, and source documents. Patient management will include all disease programs and multiple protocols. - (Essential)
20% - Coordinates the reporting of adverse events based on the NCI Common Toxicity Criteria, (CTC). Adverse events are submitted for multiple disease programs on multiple studies. Data is submitted to various sponsors, research bases, FDA, & the local IRB as per institutional policies - (Essential)
15% - Prepares, transports, and handles blood borne pathogens and other biologic specimens following OSHA and IATA guidelines. Collection of pathology specimens and radiology images at designated time points are submitted to study sponsor - (Essential)
15% - Utilizes EPIC electronic medical record system and is competent and efficient in abstracting the required source documents for patient research charts. Utilizes data collection method instruments and computer data programs for all studies. Data Entry and query resolution on multiple NCI sponsored Cooperative Group websites and sponsor websites. Utilizes office tools including SharePoint, CTMS, Clinical Data Center (CDC) and Inteliquet - (Essential)
15% - Process protocols and patient related documents and data forms. Compiles lists, maintains patient/study calendars, and creates and maintains necessary documents. Resolves sponsor queries correctly, completely and in a timely fashion. Process request for pathology slides and shipping slides to sponsor. Supports the Study Coordinator as needed with patient protocol visits including QOL surveys, escorting patients to various locations on campus and picking up IDS oral study medication - (Essential)


Preferred Experience & Additional Skills:

Harris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes.
Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease.
Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s Hospitals & Health Networks magazine.
Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to Excellence™ designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.
Skills / Requirements
Job Summary
This position reports to the Director Payroll & Time/Attendance and should require only minimal oversight. Responsible for functional aspects of the organizational Kronos Time and Labor (T&L) module(s) to ensure timely and accurate time collection and labor reporting in accordance with both regulatory standards/laws and organizational policies and procedures.


Oversees the bi-weekly Kronos close process. Maintains a controlled environment through the establishment of best practices and ensures continuous monitoring of the transactional data to prevent upstream T&L errors. Approves out-of-period historical edits and is able to compute complex hours calculations where needed. Performs research and analysis to correct errors and root cause process/system failures within span of control. Oversee maintenance and support of these systems and data quality assurance for the benefit of Harris Health System. Assure system optimization and data integration between multiple software applications. In concert with the Director of Payroll and Corporate Compliance, safeguard the system against fraud and abuse.


Ensures T&L processes are documented, periodically reviewed, and published in the respective repositories for appropriate access. Governing policies must be reviewed at least every (5) five years, or as regulations change, to ensure mandatory requirements are met. Possesses a solid understanding of federal and state wage and hour laws (e.g. Department of Labor (DOL) or other wage and hour mandatory standards is compulsory). Support the VP-Controller in establishing and enforcing accountability, cohesiveness and consistency in applying the policies and procedures across Harris Health.


Manages the T&L staff and coordinates the activities of a first-touch resolution like call center to minimize escalations and reduce lag delays in response times. Creates transparency for those involved in resolution efforts.

Continually identifies areas of automation, process improvement and optimization. Unafraid to fail, learn and adapt as needed to find better ways to achieve the mission of Harris Health. Remain current with the latest DOL or other wage and hourly standards, trends, processes, policies and challenges affecting payroll. Lead or participate in other special projects as assigned by the Director of Payroll while working with various cross functional teams such as Information Systems, Human Resources, Accounting, and Pavilions. Examples may include various process improvement initiatives, systems projects and reporting developments.


The successful candidate will have the ability to work both independently and in a team environment. The communication efforts by the T&L Manager are constant so proficiency in both oral and written communications are a must.

Minimum Qualifications

Degrees:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or related field

Work Experience:
Seven (7) years of work experience in high volume processing area required; System-wide time collection experience required; Experience preparing formalized documentation required

Management Experience: Two (2) years of Supervisory experience

Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal Communication (Heavy Public Contact), Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking); Writing /Correspondence, Writing /Reports

Proficiencies: P.C., MS Word, MS Excel

Job Attributes

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Analytical, Mathematics, Research, Statistical

Work Schedule: Flexible

Equipment Operated: Standard office equipment including multi-function printers, scanners, copiers, calculators.

Remote Work: At this time the position will work remotely from a Texas based home office. Candidate must be able to meet the requirements of Harris Health Systems Telecommuting Policies. The arrangement is subject to change at the level up leaders discretion. The position will report on premise as business needs dictate or as otherwise requested and with minimal notice (i.e. the next day).

Other Requirements: Prior system conversion a plus. Knowledge of federal & state wage and hour laws a strong plus. SharePoint and Kronos

Social & Scientific Systems (SSS), a division of DLH Corp works to improve public health worldwide by providing technical, research, and program management services to government, nonprofit, and commercial clients. The SSS team offers a synergy of expertise in clinical research services, epidemiology and public health studies, health data management and analysis, and program evaluation and policy analysis. Please join our dedicated staff in an environment that values diversity and supports health, well-being, and professional growth.SSS is currently seeking an entry-level data manager and statistical programmer to serve on a team that conducts analyses and reports on findings from clinical- and population-based epidemiological studies. These studies focus on the impact of the physical and social environment on human health and well-being, as well as genetic, occupational, and lifestyle risk factors. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team that includes data managers, analysts, and operations staff. Primary duties include provision of data management support for studies by developing programs to build study datasets, and generation of reports to inform the progress of the studies and to summarize the study. This position offers opportunities for professional development, innovation, and collaboration across disciplines.ResponsibilitiesDevelop, revise, test, and perform quality control of programs for a variety of analytic and operational projects. These projects include the creation of analytical datasets and reports, and fulfillment of data requests from both internal and external sources.Develop, test, and validate data collection procedures and data management systems, such as REDCap and Clinical Trials Database (CTDB).Produce codebooks, format files, descriptive tabular analyses including variable frequencies, cross-tabulations, and summary statistics, and graphical analyses including scatter plots, bar charts, and histograms.Assist with the development, maintenance, and implementation of data management plans, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and other forms of documentation.Perform additional duties as required.QualificationsBachelor’s or higher-level degree in computer sciences, mathematics, health sciences, or another related field.At least 1 years’ experience using SAS or R for data management, including writing programs to manipulate and process data to join data sets, derive new variables, edit existing variables, and reshape data files to suit specific analytic needs.Highly qualified applicants will demonstrate one or more of the following attributes:Experience with other software (e.g., STATA, REDCap, Qualtrics, ArcGIS) or other programming languages (e.g., Python).Master’s or higher-level degree in computer sciences, mathematics, health sciences, or another related field.Familiarity with relational databases and/or electronic capture systems.Excellent verbal and written communication skills as demonstrated by prior publications, presentations, or in other venues.Ability to develop creative solutions with minimal direction from leadership.DLH is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. Location: Town of Summerville, Summerville, SC 29483

Department: Court

Job Status: Full-Time

Shift: 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

Days: Mon., Tue., Wed., Thu., Fri.

Rate of Pay: $31,505 - $35,105

Position Type: Full Time
Job Description
Under general supervision, performs various clerical and related court support functions as required to maintain Municipal Court processes. Work involves performing duties as typing documents and other information, receipting monies, answering the telephone, assisting the public, preparing records, bookkeeping, coordinating schedules, etc.; and performing specialized tasks in the area of responsibility as assigned. Some weekends are required.

Job Responsibilities
Performs data entry and clerical activities by entering tickets, processing setoff debt payments, etc.
Performs scheduling activities (such as preparing dockets for court; scheduling jury trials and preliminary hearings and motion or rule to show cause hearings; rescheduling court cases; and coordinating with officers and attorneys for court dates, etc.).
Notifies victims of upcoming cases.
Prepares bond paperwork.
Transmits documents to appropriate courts.
Types warrants and courtesy summons; issues and sends bench warrants.
Completes expungement process according to established procedures.
Recalls tickets from the State.
Sends letters stating a bench warrant will be issued for unpaid fines and documents to suspend driver’s license for unpaid fines.
Prepares and maintains payment plan contracts.
Answers incoming calls performing various related duties (such as providing guidance and assistance, taking messages, providing information, placing calls, etc.); explains court procedures and assists the public with related processes as necessary.
Maintains court program files and commit to jail files.
Assists the public with completing court related forms and with questions and concerns; assists officers in processing tickets.
Responsible for accuracy in calculating, collecting, recording and tracking of all funds entering Municipal Court.
Searches State Internet site for incarcerated inmates.
Assists the judge as needed.
Receives, reviews, and/or distributes a variety of records and reports (such as mail, motion requests, payments, officer continuance requests, tickets, jury trial and preliminary hearing requests, program requests, expungement requests, warrants, courtesy summons, etc.).
Prepares and/or processes a variety of documents (such as dockets, transmittal forms, warrants, juror summons, preliminary dates, expungement orders, traffic tickets, continuances, bond paperwork, payment plans, etc.).
Refers to computer records, court dockets, South Carolina Code of Laws, MASC handbook, ticket log, telephone list, Dorchester County website, desk calendar, case files, policy and procedure manuals, computer manuals, codes/laws/regulations, publications and reference texts, etc.
Operates a variety of office equipment and machinery (such as file cabinets, telephone, computer, printer, recording devices, fax machine, copy machine, postage machine, etc.).
Uses a variety of tools (such as calculator, writing instruments, credit card machine, standard office tools, etc.); a variety of supplies (such as paper, boxes, ink cartridges/toner, general office supplies, etc.); and a variety of computer software (such as CMS, INCODE, Microsoft Office, Internet, setoff debt software, etc.).
Interacts and communicates with various groups and individuals (such as Court Administrator, coworkers, judges, other Town employees, Police Department, attorneys, defendants, and the general public).
Provides assistance to co-workers and/or performs those responsibilities as necessary to maintain standards of operations.
Subpoena victims and/or witnesses for trials.
Coordinates with program managers to update cases.
Ensures others have correct dockets and officers sign all necessary paperwork.
Performs general administrative/office duties as required, including typing reports and correspondence, entering and retrieving computer data, copying and filing documents, sending and receiving faxes, establishing and maintaining filing systems, etc.
Performs other related duties as required.

Minimum Education and Experience
Requires a high school diploma or equivalent supplemented by six months’ experience performing clerical and bookkeeping activities, preferably in a court system or with similar public contact, or any equivalent combination of training and experience, which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Knowledge of the methods, policies, and procedures of the Municipal Court as they pertain to the performance of duties of the Court Clerk.
Knowledge of the functions and interrelationships of the Town and other governmental agencies.
Knowledge of the laws, ordinances, standards and regulations pertaining to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position.
Knowledge of the practices, procedures, rules and regulations of the Municipal Court.
Knowledge of the general office and court operations, functions and procedures.
Knowledge of the reports, records, files and letters, which must be prepared, processed and maintained in order to meet the requirements of the Municipal Court.
Knowledge of the terminology used within the Court.
Knowledge of how to estimate time, materials and supplies required to complete various routine activities.
Knowledge of how to operate a variety of equipment and machines (such as a calculator, copier, etc.).
Knowledge of the basic principles of bookkeeping.
Skill in organization and human relations.
Ability to use independent judgment in routine situations, which occur.
Ability to communicate effectively with others both in person and over the telephone in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to compile, organize, prepare and maintain an assortment of records, reports, and related information.
Ability to comprehend, interpret and apply regulations, procedures and court operations.
Ability to read, understand and complete written requests and work assignments in a timely fashion.
Ability to learn and apply new skills needed in order to promote efficient completion of duties.
Ability to offer assistance to co-workers as necessary.
Ability to complete mathematical calculations as needed.
Ability to maintain an effective filing system.
Ability to type at the required corrected rate.
Ability to prepare clear and concise letters of correspondence as required.

Physical Requirements
Must be physically able to operate a variety of machines and equipment including computer, calculator, copier, etc. Must be able to exert up to twenty pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects. May involve reaching, stooping, and balancing.

Additional Information
Benefits


Health insurance

Dental insurance

Life insurance

SC Retirement System

401k deferred compensation

457 deferred compensation

Vacation Leave

Sick Leave

Holiday Leave (12 holidays)

Flexible Spending Accounts

Longevity Program

Other Voluntary Insurance.

Join us as Manager of Data Operations! Be a part of our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and be an integral part of creating innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. Become a part of our rich heritage that has grown from a small family business to a global organization with a presence in over 180 countries.
At the heart of the Kellogg Company is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe. Our team works to ensure that all Kellogg data assets are credible and available. We are the data experts for the Kellogg Company!
HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
Design and Implement – Maintain, create, and improve systems associated with a Customer Re-org process, Customer and Hierarchy Validation, and Pricing Validation. You will help drive consistency and accuracy through strong documentation and identifying process improvements. Understanding WinShuttle and other technical capabilities will enable the team to drive fast, accurate setup. This position is heavily relied on to standardize, simplify and automate processes while meeting all aspects of SOX 404 requirements.
Cross-Functional Partnerships – You will collaborate with teams, including Sales, Supply Chain, GBS and more! You will work cross functionally to improve data quality for their respective domain. You will ensure data completeness in all areas of metadata, data registry and data catalogues. This includes large scale data integration projects within these teams.
Data Expertise – We are looking for someone who has a passion for data accuracy! Using strong analytical skills and attention to detail, you will be responsible for managing and analyzing complex Data in SAP. Through accurate and timely setup and maintenance and rapidly changing priorities, you will enable and maximize business effectiveness across the company.
Creating and Maintaining Systems Consistency and Accuracy – You will work to ensure that all Kellogg data assets are credible and available by developing policy and process, measuring compliance, and enforcing standards. We provide a registry of data that is acquired, created, and maintained to Kellogg standards. You will play a leadership role supporting the mission to ensure that data is certified, reliable, and easily accessible creating a strong foundation for agile analytics to harvest insights which drive sustainable growth and profit.
YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS
Required:
Must have 5 years minimum working experience
Strong analytical skills & understanding of data analysis
To be successful, you will want to be able to effectively break down, summarize and communicate research and measurement information effectively to a variety of audiences
Extensive related Business or Systems experience
Advanced skills in MS Office, Excel, and Macro’s
Bonus Points:
Bachelor’s Degree
Expertise in WinShuttle
Sales Business understanding
SAP/BW Reporting experience
Systems conversion experience
Data integrity experience

Workers’ Compensation Manager

Responsible for managing and monitoring Amazon’s Workers’ Compensation program at designated fulfillment center sites. Responsible for developing and collaborating successful partnerships between associates, third party administrators (TPAs), internal business partners and external service providers.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities
Ensures business is compliant with state specific Workers’ Compensation regulations and Amazon policies and guidelines. Acts as the point of notification and contact for associates regarding any incident or injury that could or has resulted in a Workers’ Compensation claim. Serve as an associate advocate.

Point of contact for all documentation regarding incident. This includes internal safety notify and investigation details as well as any health information relevant to the claim from outside medical providers and treatment notes. Health information is limited to medical related to the injury.
Assess the medical, vocational, behavioral, etc. needs of an injured associate via a combination of face to face, telephonic and written correspondence as needed.
Provide all relevant documentation regarding work related incidents to Safety, onsite healthcare providers, Leave of Absence (LOA) team and TPA to assist in the determination of compensability, recordability and recording keeping requirements. This includes determining mechanism of injury, work restrictions, and managing the information related to work related injury/illness.
Initial and ongoing point of contact to internal and external business partners for the duration of the claim.
Point of contact for all written and telephonic correspondence regarding the claim.
Communicate with providers, both internal and external to review treatment notes, ask for clarification when necessary, follow-up after initial appointments as well as scheduling appointments in conjunction with TPA if a referral to a specialist is required.
Ensures confidentiality of Workers’ Compensation claims records; including relevant health information related to the claim.
Ensures that the TPA manages the claims diligently, partners with Risk Management and Legal (internal and external) to manage relevant claim details, implement plan for timely resolution of claims.
Review medical notes as they relate to the claim and treatment to verify appropriateness.
Review claims together with TPA for causation and possible subrogation opportunities.
Partner with multiple departments to coordinate and manage Return to Work programs for employees to ensure that work restriction and transitional work guidelines are being adhered to. - - Provide transitional work letter to associates.
Maintain consistent uniform records for each claim.
Maintain and update the transitional work tracker form for the designated sites on a weekly basis.
Review all open claims every 30 days for opportunities for claims management and partner with all relevant stakeholders on a plan of action.
Partner cross functionally to proactively address any re occurring root causes.
Schedule, develop agenda and host all conference calls and claim reviews with TPA.
Review all medical providers and/or panels annually and ensure Amazon is in compliance with state guidelines regarding panels. Where applicable, ensure all appropriate authorization and forms are signed and processed.
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Associates in Risk Management or other insurance/claim related designations
History of process improvement exposure, as a leader or participant
High comfort with managing and communicating claim trends and information by using various data sources
Excellent verbal communication skills and a positive approach to customer interactions
Successful history of working in a fast paced, high volume environment
Ability to think critically to solve problems.

We are keenly aware of the challenges that that emerging growth private and public companies face to garner investment community visibility and shareholder sponsorship as well as the valuable unstructured data that investors, partners, suitors and customers are seeking in today’s digital world.Corporate Culture We encourage open and frequent communication and free flowing ideas with no one being a filter to another member of the team. Seer Interactive is a digital marketing consultancy that harnesses compassion, data, and technology to make a mark on our communities - our coworkers, our clients, our industry, and our neighbors. We believe in relentlessly pursuing (and sharing) the truth – bringing together millions of data points from quantitative and qualitative sources to base our decisions on. Our purpose is to unlock potential for our communities mentioned above. Our vision is a world where it’s easy to do the right thing throughout those communities. If you’re ready to uplift others, challenge your ego, commit to the truth, and be better than yesterday – keep reading.
What about you? You will lead the way for Seer’s community impact goals on a national scale, and help us make honest and strategic decisions about what organizations align with our values. You are action oriented, and instead of just discussing community needs, you put a plan in place and guide our organization to execution, tracking the data that shows if we’re having impact. Essentially, you will be a facilitator to help make it easier for employees at Seer to put good into the world. We believe that our past approach of "raise your hand and volunteer" for a committee is more passive and now that we’ve set a BIG goal of 15 Million impact in 10 years we need more focus and accountability to hit that goal. That’s where you come in.
Your Compensation
$70K - $85k/ year
Evaluation of comp at least once a year
Benefits that support your whole self
Here are some highlights of what you'll be doing…
You will act as the leader for Seer’s community impact goal of contributing $15 million in ten years, and create and implement a strategy for us to meet that goal
You will develop a decision matrix that helps us strategically determine which organizations could benefit most from our efforts.
You will create a methodology for tracking and analyzing community impact and report monthly on pacing to goal.
You will help focus Seer on where we can have the greatest impact to hit goals
You will work closely with our executive team to create the best path forward to our service goal, and vet and qualify organizations to work with
You will build and maintain strong relationships with organizations we partner with
You will be service oriented, and motivate others at Seer to give back
Collaborate with marketing to help leverage social, email, and other channels to highlight our work and the missions of the organizations we’re working with
Spearhead identifying volunteer opportunities for both at HQ and remote
The skills you'll bring to the table…
Knowledge of human service issues and community relations
Being results oriented and goal driven while building strong partnerships with organizations with experience quantifying the impact of your efforts
Hands on experience growing and pacing a philanthropy/program from the ground up with a sizeable goal
Experience building a program with a national impact
Number cruncher with a strong financial acumen
Lead with a data driven approach and be able to draw conclusions based on what the stats present
Strong organizational and project management skills while leveraging systems like Asana, Slack, Monday.com or other Project Management softwares
Technically savvy while working with data analytics, Microsoft Office and Google Docs like a champ
Willingness to be vulnerable regarding both wins & losses. An advocate for transparency who shares how they've learned from their past mistakes
Bonus Points
Nonprofit experience is a huge plus!
Ability to distill data into stories and measure impact using Tableau, Power Bi, or other data manipulation tools.
Not ready to apply but want to keep in touch? Stay connected via our monthly Career Update newsletter! We'll share curated content on Seer, open roles, industry insights, career advice, events you don't want to miss, and more (so you never miss a beat).
Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description with a belly full of excitement, we’re just as excited about you. You have to apply though :)
