job_title: Product Manager, Data & Analytics (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
job_description:
Become part of the Converse Team
Converse is a place to explore potential, break barriers and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Converse, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving world to make things better as a team.
We Need Someone Who Speaks Computer
Computers have their own language. Which most of us don’t speak. But you do. And we need your fluency. Let’s face it. The modern world is shackled to computers so we need experts like yourself to keep us running. So come join our crew. You don’t have to call yourself The Computer Whisperer but we might.
ABOUT CONVERSE TECH
By joining the Converse team, you will be a strategic partner that collaboratively delivers enterprise value and innovation. We define leadership as growing yourself, growing together and growing the business: Be authentic, courageous and inspired about possibilities. Create an environment of inclusion and trust. Deliver results with clarity and accountability. We will rely on you to bring your whole self to work and you can expect in return an environment that cultivates growth by challenging and inspiring you to lead in your space.
As the demand for technology continues to evolve, we seek individuals who bring a unique perspective and new ways of thinking to elevate the brand’s potential. The team uses a diverse set of backgrounds and skills to create and iterate on technical solutions that drive growth for our business. We work multi-functionally within the enterprise to solve problems and bring creative solutions to life. Always connected by a bigger purpose, we keep the consumer at the center of everything we do.

WHAT YOU BRING TO CONVERSE
On the Converse Tech team, we seek individuals that have:
A solid grasp of our business; an understanding of how we create and move product, and how we serve customers
An agile approach; familiarity with delivery within an agile framework
People leadership; managing with courage and acting with integrity and honesty, and creating an environment of involvement and trust while holding yourself and others accountable.
Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical business partners
Technical literacy; a foundational understanding of critical technology concepts
An analytical approach; the ability to acquire, visualize and analyze data to inform decisions; the ability to formulate and test hypotheses

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Technical Product Manager on the Converse Technology team, you will be a crucial member on the Enterprise Data & Analytics team. You will help lead the creation, improvement and adoption of Converse’s data products, setting the product vision and managing the data engineering roadmap to support the growing analytics subject area at Converse. You will work closely with multi-functional partners, data engineers and architects, and product management to deliver scalable solutions that drive business value.
Effectively define priorities with partners, set clear and measurable objectives and deploy team resources appropriately to achieve business goals through adoption of data products
Lead scope from idea through delivery, analysis, testing and support
Define and communicate product vision and roadmap; ensure alignment to company strategies
Work with partners to understand current and future needs, define features and epics, determine success criteria, validate solutions, and evaluate customer satisfaction
Maintain documentation
Keep team accountable to adhere to change management and release process
Analyze and communicate customer adoption, performance, say/do, quality and other metrics to partners
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working with large data sets and complex data models; intermediate SQL skills
Experience leading a team of data engineers
Good understanding of key topics in data science or advanced analytics
Understanding Agile principles and methodologies and how they’re applied
Able to solve complex problems and take a new point of view on existing solutions
Effective collaboration and relationship management with partners
Clear, concise, confident and persuasive communication style that compels to action

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree or higher, or equivalent combination of education and experience and training
Minimum 6 years relevant work experience
Experience working with Agile teams and methodologies in an analytics setting
Experience working with analytic tools such as Tableau, Alteryx, SQL, R, VBA, Python, etc.
Experience working with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools, Jira preferred
Experience as a team lead
Passion for adding to a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging
Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate. For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $172,500 per year. Information about benefits can be found here.

Converse requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire, unless otherwise required by law. As an equal opportunity employer, Converse will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law.
Converse is more than a company; it’s a worldwide advocate for self-expression. This belief motivates our employees, permeates our working environment and inspires our products. No two of us look or think exactly alike. We are each one-of-a-kind. Individually and as a culture, we have the freedom to create and grow professionally. Generous benefits packages only sweeten the experience. From Boston to Shanghai, from Brand Design to Finance, Converse is a brand that celebrates the unique and creative people of the world. Together, we’re different.

job_title: Data Analytics Manager, Royalty Analytics & Data
job_description:
Content
Data
We are looking for a Data Analytics Manager for the Royalty Analytics & Data (RAD) team. You will focus on royalty data operations, business enablement, and improving efficiency across Finance through process improvement and automation.
Location
New York
Job type
Permanent
What you'll do
Work with large data sets, solving complex problems in a dynamic environment
Work with a multi-functional team of data analysts, engineers, and accountants to define and test requirements for enhancing royalty calculation systems to serve the needs of Spotify’s growing business
Work with teams across Accounting and Finance to design and implement process improvements/automation to enable scalable growth
Work with accounting team members to define requirements for ad-hoc data analysis and reporting, being able to work independently to propose solutions
Manage data analyst/scientists to ensure their success and development
Work with a group of highly motivated individuals who are passionate about Spotify’s success
Who you are
You have a minimum 5 years of experience using databases and analytics tools to solve business problems
You have experience managing and developing a team of data analysts / scientists
You have a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information systems, or another quantitative discipline
You have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills and the ability to prioritize and deliver results in a fast moving company with a wide variety of strategic initiatives
You have previous experience working in the music industry
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it is within New York City in which we have a work location.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

North Naples e-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Marketing Data Project Manager to manage the process of our complex and ever-changing prospect database.Qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. It will be your job to ensure that all marketing prospects are captured and accurately added to our database. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of the revenue for our company.If you love tracking multiple data sources, coordinating with multiple department and staff, auditing work to ensure accuracy, meeting deadlines, resolving hiccups and regularly achieving goals this job is perfect for you.Key Responsibilities: Coordinate multiple data sources and ensure all information is captured accuratelyWork closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and resultsManage outside vendors to supplement internal staff workCoordinate between departments to optimize processing newly acquired prospectsPrioritize data to ensure highest quality prospects are processed firstMeet weekly volume and accuracy goals and deadlinesManage data categorization and validation team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loadingJump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are metSolve problems as they arise to keep prospects movingMake recommendations to streamline current processes to improve speed and accuracyRequirements: Values:  Lives and breathes by the company values of Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results.Experience: More than 2 years of experience as project manager preferably supporting marketing functionsComputer:  EXCELLENT MS Office skills – including Excel, Word, Outlook, etc. MS Dynamics and SQL a massive plus, but not required.Details:  Manage multiple data sources to avoid lost marketing prospects and to ensure they are loaded into our systems accurately and on time.Change:  Ability to shift directions quickly and enjoy the associated challenges. Strong multitasking and prioritization skills very necessary.Location:  It is preferred that this person work in our North Naples office, but we are willing to consider remote for the right person.Deadlines:  Vigilant about drawing the correct conclusions and meeting deadlinesResearch:  Ability to research topics online, analyze results and take action. Naturally inquisitive to anticipate and ask that next question “Why”Communications:  Strong verbal and written communication skills that allow you to convey complex processes and findings in logical, easy-to-understand and actionable language.Auditing:  Ability to review data based on key indicators, identify problems, and train to improve outcomes.Problem Solving:  Identify problems in the data management process and make recommendations to solve the problem, and avoid it in the future.Strategy & Planning:  Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve processing speed and accuracy.Benefits:  Paid time off after 6 months (although you earn from day one). Workplace flexibility for proven staff. (home/business-life balance). Health insurance with company contribution. 8-9 paid days off per year.Healthcare Training Leader Values: Healthcare Training Leader is a small, customer-centric and entrepreneurial minded team producing the most current, relevant and actionable content focused on solutions for small practices within the healthcare industry.The culture at Healthcare Training Leader is built on our shared core values – People First, Own It, Tenacious Optimism, and Results. It is important that we all hold each other accountable to these values with every decision we make. These values should demonstrate who we are, not who we hope to be. They are defined as follows:PEOPLE FIRST: Every decision we make should have some level of positive impact on our customers and/or team. We work hard and strive for balance between our lives in and out of the company.OWN IT: When things are good, we celebrate. When mistakes are made, we stand up and are accountable for them, we work together to ferret out the issue and tackle it head on. We never hide from the truth.TENACIOUS OPTIMISM: We do the best we can every time, and when that isn’t enough, we work harder & never give up on a project or mission if we believe in it. However, this doesn’t mean we wear blindersRESULTS: The outcomes we achieve allow us to grow, identify opportunities, help our customers, and ensure a strong, supportive where we want to be.We hire, fire, review, reward, and recognize our teammates based on these characteristics, so it’s essential that you share these values in order to be part of our team. We work hard to live and breathe these values, so if you don’t embody them, it will seriously stand out. Better to know now.Job Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offTuition reimbursementSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:Common surfaces sanitized regularly, masks available, & air purifier in conference roomWork Location: Remote

Remote, United States
Creative Production
The mission of the Partner Success team in Product & Partner Operations is to develop meaningful vendor strategy and relationships that will optimize the greater operational supply chain and protect for resources and flexibility to fulfill tasks seamlessly and cost-effectively.

As a Vendor Engagement Manager, you will be pivotal in Netflix achieving our goal of driving more business to our vendor network. You will own decisions on how Operations can scale significant spend in annual vendor costs to find win-win solutions for Netflix and the vendors we partner with.
In this role, you will:
Navigate complex business and technology relationships and work to establish standards and set engagement strategy.
Be a collaborative informed captain who excels in peer-to-peer and executive level communication, both internally at Netflix and with your partners.
Inform business decisions based on data and metrics.
Set strategy with our vendor network. You will have a knack for identifying and prioritizing items for Operations and/or shortcomings in the vendor sourcing workflow and propose solutions.
Collect, analyze, and implement data to find solutions. In this role you will be expected to identify and communicate the ROI of current deals, coupled with information from vendors on issues Netflix faces (i.e. vendor consolidation/exclusivity), and evolve our current deal portfolio to increase its impact.
Foster strong partnerships with various teams across the business. You will be highly effective individually and cross functionally, with an ability to thought-partner at all levels to find solutions and have courage to put forth new and/or different ideas.
Personify Netflix culture. Embracing the values of our company can be challenging, but you will rise to the occasion by participating in giving/receiving feedback, prioritizing candor and transparency in your communications, using data and technology to optimize your time, and using your natural curiosity to push yourself out of your comfort zone.
The ideal candidate has:
Experience building & managing long-term strategic relationships with leading operational and fulfillment vendors.
A passion for metrics and a track record for using data to drive decision-making.
Strong knowledge of complex deal structures. You know when to tap in partners from Legal, Finance, Planning, etc. when it comes to the areas that are new to you. You have navigated challenging situations before, and bring that growth-oriented approach to each project you tackle.
World class negotiating skills with the ability to challenge the status quo.
APPLY NOW

When you join Verizon
Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
We are looking for a talented Customer Success Manager who is passionate about next generation technologies to manage both external customers and internal business units such as consumer, business, and technology divisions of Verizon.
Developing and driving both strategic and operational plans with VP level and other leaders across customers.
Renewing existing customer base & growing existing customer relationships with upsell/cross-sell.
Partnering with internal product and sales teams on integration, launch, maintenance, and other related activities, which have direct impact on customer/partner metrics.
Preparing and presenting proposed directions to management for buy-in and/or project and milestone reporting.
Cultivating strong relationships with equal level counterparts within customer groups and manage and project/program manage day-to-day activities to drive key initiatives agreed by both parties.
Acting as subject matter expert for Location Technology teams for customers as well as to innovate in new areas we can work together or how Location can help them drive new revenue.
Working with peers in Customer Success and Product to develop a partnership management pipeline and plan that reflects the larger strategy and ladders into company KPIs.
Effectively managing communication with customers to seamlessly execute programs and meet deliverables and deadlines.
Working with the Product, Communications, Peers in Customer Success and other team members to develop decks, presentations, and pitch materials for both internal and client-facing needs.
Where you'll be working:
In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.
What we’re looking for...
You have leadership skills, are a self-starter with experience managing successful customer relationships and driving adoption and integration of our capabilities or subject matter expertise in Location. You are motivated by the opportunity and the excitement to pursue win-win opportunities that expand to Verizon’s customers, often, top-tier brands and talent. You are comfortable with change and understand how to strategically pivot, be excellent at balancing priorities and meeting deadlines, and enjoy working in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment while operating with a “no task is too small” attitude.
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of relevant work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Four or more years of combined experience in customer success, account management, and upsell/cross-sell experience.
Three or more years of experience driving strategy development or substantially similar innovation roles.
Even better if you have:
Prospect experience.
Project management experience
Experience analyzing customer data.
Experience with Jira.
Compensation
Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401 (k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives,we've got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the compensation range for this position is between $106,000 and $197,000 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Verizon requires new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Verizon provides reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical or religious reasons).

Numerator is a data and tech company bringing speed and scale to market research. Headquartered in Chicago, IL, Numerator has more than 2,000 employees worldwide. The company blends proprietary data with advanced technology to create unique insights for the market research industry that has been slow to change. The majority of Fortune 100 companies are Numerator clients.

Here at Numerator, we've made all corporate roles have maximum flexibility between office and remote work, except for rare situations when the role requires coming into an office regularly. In those situations, the recruiter of that role will clarify at the beginning of the process if that is the case. In fully remote situations, the company will provide technical equipment necessary to be successful in the role. In addition to maximum flexibility of return-to-office, the company also provides generous PTO, Internally Quiet Focus Time, and other recharge efforts to give time back to employees.
Job Description
The role of Manager, Customer Success - CPG is to oversee a team of Customer Success Managers, who serve as a trusted advisor to our customers. Customer Success Managers ensure our clients achieve success with our platform-based solutions and maximize their return on investment - leading to strong renewal rates and growth across our portfolio of products. Your team manages our tier 1 CPG client relationships after onboarding is complete to drive on-going realized value against measurable long-term strategic goals to ensure long-term success.

You will partner cross functionally with other CS managers, along with onboarding, education, support, sales, operations, & product teams to ensure clients get the most from our game-changing insights and products. In addition, they will work in partnership with Sales colleagues to help expand our customer footprint. This individual is a great collaborator, strategic thinker and creative problem solver.

Responsibilities:
Hiring, coaching and development of individual contributors on your team
Build and maintain relationships with cross functional teams such as Recruiting, Product, Support, Services, Onboarding, Implementation, Education and Sales
Work in partnership with your team to establish and execute against a Customer Success Plan for your clients that ensures value delivered for the customer over time and the adoption of contracted Numerator solutions across key user groups based on confirmed Use Case
Be an advocate and advisor for all assigned clients by understanding their business deeply and helping them leverage Numerator’s solutions to help them grow through outreach, training, and overall ongoing connectivity with key stakeholders and user groups
Provide feedback to cross functional teams to inform process improvement and platform offerings
Understand and actively participate in strategic customer team initiatives that align with company MBO’s

Skills & Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree (preferred) with 7+ years relevant experience, including 3+ years experience in leading and managing teams
Desired experience in Customer Success or related role with a focus on account planning and management
Relevant software industry, Nielsen or IRI experience, promotional data and/or shopper data (consulting, product, sales support and/or service delivery function), is ideal
Proven analytic skills: conceptualizing, analyzing, deriving insights from data, and designing an execution plan to achieve success on our platform
Proficient with multi-tasking, prioritizing, and working with colleagues across a wide portfolio of accounts
Skilled at developing relationships with clients to become a trusted and value-added business partner, along with building and leading quarterly business reviews
Able to easily walk people through an entire process, step by step, and create a story to increase understanding of the data
Excellent oral and written communication skills, strong project management
Strong presentation skills, with the ability to adapt based on audience
Travel required
If this sounds like something you would like to be part of, we'd love for you to apply! Don't worry if you think that you don't meet all the qualifications here. The tools, technology and methodologies we use are constantly changing and we value talent and interest over specific experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law.

While this position can be remote, Numerator is only able to hire in many, but not all, states and provinces. In certain cases, if you are not located in a specific area where Numerator is able to hire, you may not be eligible for employment.

Travel Required: None
Public Trust: NACI (T1)
Requisition Type: Regular
The Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR) aims to conduct biomedical research that is responsive to Department of Defense (DOD) and US Army requirements and delivers life-saving products including knowledge, technology and medical material that sustain the combat effectiveness of the Warfighter. Our team is seeking technical expertise to provide support to WRAIR’s Center for Military Psychiatry and Neuroscience Research (CMPN) CMPN is a translational and expeditionary effort to identify and eliminate brain health threats to Soldiers. CMPN investigates and manipulates the relationship between sleep and performance, performs behavioral health assessments to inform unit Commanders on Soldier behavioral health needs, and develops and implements resilience trainings. On a parallel track are efforts to identify and treat traumatic brain injury as well as understand the impact of repeated blast exposure.
Specifically, our team is seeking a Data Manager to support the Behavioral Biology branch’s Performance Assessment and Chemical Evaluation (PACE) laboratory. The PACE laboratory identifies neurobiological targets and pharmacological compounds that effectively promote behavioral, physiological, and emotional recovery from traumatic stress exposure
Responsibilities:
Generate, organize, copy, store, and archive day-to-day data files and summary files for the studies.
Prepare summary data files and data tables from study results as requested by COR or lead investigator.
Perform standard descriptive and inferential statistical analyses, such as advanced mixed-model ANOVA, using computerized tools such as SAS.
Produce graphical representations of collected data and summary results using PC-based computerized tools such as SigmaPlot, etc.
Assist in the preparation of scientific and technical manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed academic journals.
Assist in the preparation of any progress reports and/or final reports submitted to the entities who are serving as the research sponsors.
Collect and analyze data and present preliminary findings at military, national, and international scientific conferences. The Contractor shall be skilled in presentation techniques including design, construction and public speaking skills.
Collect, process and prepare data for computer entry as well as create computer database files for the purpose of analyses and archiving.
Advise on the use of appropriate statistical and other analyses on collected data, perform standard and advanced statistics, using computer-based programs such as SPSS, SAS, etc.
Be able to work independently and with minimal supervision. The Contractor shall also be able to function effectively as a leader of an interdisciplinary team composed of researchers from a variety of backgrounds/institutions including WRAIR, MRMC, NIH, various universities, etc.
Help secure intellectual property through the timely submission of invention disclosures.
Train, mentor, and lead other junior research staff under this contract.
Comply with occupational health and safety standards and other applicable regulations and guidelines, which may include medical surveillance.
Provide scientific and technical support for the development, validation, and application of animal models (i.e. rodent, ferret, swine, non-human primate).
Weigh and feed rodents daily during workdays, maintaining weights at prescribed levels and maintaining associated recording procedures to include any noted health problems.
Qualifications
Possess a minimal proficiency in common productivity software programs including Word, Excel, SigmaPlot and others, and have an understanding of basic descriptive statistics.
Shall be familiar with standard Microsoft programs such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Shall be familiar with statistics and statistical packages for the purpose of data analyses and database management.
Understanding of relevant databases and accompanying analyses.
COVID-19 Vaccination: GDIT does not have a vaccination mandate applicable to all employees. To protect the health and safety of its employees and to comply with customer requirements, however, GDIT may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.

We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.

GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

As a clinical data manager (CDM), you will support key activities, ensuring the highest quality subject data for our clinical trials. You will work within our EDC systems, Medrio and Veeva, to generate, track, and resolve data clarifications and queries. This position will ideally be located in Indianapolis, IN, but we are open to exploring remote work as well.Responsibilities:Responsible for ensuring the completeness, quality, and integrity of the clinical trial data.Ensure data quality and consistency according to applicable regulatory requirements, standard operating procedures (SOPs), processes, and data standards.Data management responsibilities include but are not limited to:Medrio and Veeva eCRF design and database buildeCRF collection, maintenance, and trackingUser acceptance testing (UAT) for databaseCreate custom edit checks within the Medrio and Veeva EDC environmentsDevelop and maintain study-specific Data Cleaning/Reconciliation reports and validation plansPerform data cleaning activities including discrepancy management (review of errors from electronic checks) and manual review (review of data listings to verify quality and completeness of data).Create relevant documentations/files as assigned (e.g., Data Management Plan (DMP), User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Plan, eCRF completion guidelines, updates or additions to SOPs, etc.).Participation in any internal/external clinical operations meetings as required.Qualifications:BA/BS degree in a relevant field (e.g., Medicine, Pharmacy, Life Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, etc.)2+ years in clinical research or a related fieldExperience in assisting other Data ManagersAbility to plan, multitask, and work in a dynamic team environment.Communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.Job Type: Full-timePay: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Medrio: 1 year (Preferred)EDC Database Build: 2 years (Preferred)UAT: 1 year (Preferred)Veeva: 1 year (Preferred)Clinical research: 2 years (Preferred)Language:English (Required)Work Location: Remote

job_location: Remote in New York, NY+2 locations
job_description:
Product
We are looking for a creative and passionate (Associate) Product Manager to join the Music Vertical Platform organization, Spotify’s division dedicated to helping artists thrive! Our mission is to create tools that help artists and their teams build an audience, monetize their fans, and live off their work. A new team focused on Product Marketing has spun up to help find innovative ways to drive adoption, deepen engagement, educate and further support artists and their teams to advance their careers.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Full Time Contractor
In this role, you will work with a cross-functional team from Product, Design, Engineering, Product Insights, Comms, and Music Partnerships, as well as the rest of Marketing to bring industry-leading marketing tools, systems, and microsites to market — from concept, all the way through testing, launch, and adoption stages. From working with our internal teams to understand and build for creator needs, to working closely with Marketing to establish powerful campaigns to inspire creators and their teams to use our tools in new ways, you’ll be instrumental in creating the future of how music and the Spotify creator ecosystem is experienced by our users.

You will help set the roadmap for the Martech development team, coordinating with your counterparts across the company to align on the highest impact work the team can deliver. You’ll help the team lead intake and prioritization processes, gaining an in-depth understanding of and contributing to strategy at the Mission and company level. You’ll work with key Marketing stakeholders to set goals and milestones for projects. As this is a new team, you will have the existing opportunity to bring fresh ideas to space and help evolve the mission, vision, and direction of the team to ensure maximum impact.
What you'll do
Partner with Product Area Lead and Agile support team members to mold a new team from the ground up by running workshops to establish and align on mission, vision, ways of working, user journey and product development roadmap.
Engage with the development team as the Product Owner to contribute to and lead aspects of our agile scrum practices (ie. participation with standup, backlog grooming, sprint planning, quarterly planning, and retrospectives).
Help to define and own team goals and OKRs with focus on Mission level impact.
Thoughtfully collaborate to brainstorm new tools, product ideas and strategies to drive growth and engagement in partnership with the wider Creator Marketing team.
Support the go-to-market strategy and ongoing release cadence for key marketing product initiatives for artists and their teams from ideation to launch and adoption.
Create and drive a holistic internal strategy around marketing tools in coordination with the rest of the Creator Product Marketing team.
Advocate on the behalf of creators, partnering with design and product insights on identifying and understanding user needs, behaviors and problems.
Coordinate across all cross-functional partners — including artist & label partnerships, licensing, legal, and support — ensuring feedback is prioritized and ultimately leads to a better product for creators.
Learn to partner with data scientists and user researchers to understand the performance of your tools, features and systems and identify new opportunities of focus for the future.
Continue to grow your Product Management skills through group instruction and individual learning.
Who you are
You have a passion for marketing and the creator space.
You’re a compelling storyteller who can communicate in succinct and inspiring ways to a variety of audience types.
You have strong personal organization and project management abilities.
You’re very familiar with the product development life cycle and have hands-on experience helping to launch new products or services.
You’re collaborative by nature and get energy from building cross-functional teams and bringing people together.
You’re passionate about the opportunity to better serve artists & their teams. You love music.
You’re excited to learn how to create product development strategies using both quantitative and qualitative insights.
Experience with managing and engaging external agency relationships is a plus.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration, and you will be expected to work EST hours, no matter where you are located in the Americas region.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

The same properties that make the Facebook platform an ideal place for marketing also make the platform an ideal place to conduct measurement. The Marketing Analytics Manager is charged with leveraging these capabilities on behalf of Global Business Marketing to measure and optimize marketing investments. We are seeking experienced leader who can partner effectively with the business leadership on driving the measurement practice supporting the GBM.You will work cross-functionally with several teams at Facebook (including marketing, operations, software engineering, and data engineering), with the objective of driving Global Business Marketing’s effective, analytically driven, and strategic growth and innovation. In this people management role you will require a combination of exceptional analytical skills, a background in data-driven decision-making, and strong partner and communication skills and the ability to continuously inspire and develop a team of individual contributors across multiple locations. Ideally you are passionate about Facebook and its products and mission, view the world through an analytical lens, are intellectually curious, learn quickly, and able to move fast while maintaining focus on high-impact projects.


Data Science Manager Responsibilities:

Hire, lead, and develop team of individual contributors across multiple locations
Define goals, success & identify key KPIs for the Global Business Marketing team
Oversee development and execution of measurement methodologies, products, and approaches in support of the GBM “learning agenda”
Design research & analytics initiatives helping the GBM understand the contribution of the marketing vehicles on revenue and other key growth metrics
Drive consistency in execution to maintain and improve reporting and analytical quality
Effectively communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways to leaders across the globe
Help drive continuous process improvement of core projects through automation and workflow enhancement
Project manage improvements to drive higher efficiencies in day-to-day operations using a data-driven approach


Minimum Qualifications:

BA/BS in Engineering, Statistics/Math, Economics or related field
8+ years of work experience in consulting, measurement technology, research or analytics
4+ years of experience in managing people and building client engagement models
Experience problem solving and providing business insights and recommendations from data
Experience in presenting technical content across different stakeholder audiences and influencing decisions


Preferred Qualifications:

MBA or graduate degree in a quantitative field
Experience with multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Experience with Brand and Direct Response measurement solutions such as Brand Lift, Conversion Lift, Multi-Touch Attribution etc.
Experience working with tools such as SQL, Hive, SPSS, SAS, R, MATLAB, Tableau
Experience operating within globally distributed teams
Experience-based aptitude using data and numbers to formulate insights
Facebook Blueprint Certified




Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.
Description of the project and work required (including references)
The candidate will be responsible for managing and developing applications and tools in support of data visualization and reporting, including the use of R/Shiny for statistical and interactive reporting, Web programming in JavaScript/CSS for customized UI, and R and/or SAS for any pre-processing/data manipulation.
Candidate will be heavily involved in onboarding Studies onto the Data Visualization platform by interfacing with the Study team and mapping Study data (ETL scripts) to the Visualization standard data specifications.
Candidate will be assisting in building and architecting the enterprise R/Shiny, Web development framework where enterprise users/statistical programmers will be able to create and share interactive reports and outputs.
Candidate will assist managing the R development enterprise framework (R Studio tools) and the infrastructure it runs on; be able to interface with IT team for deployment and maintenance.
In addition, the candidate will be expected to self-manage the delivery of Visual Analytical outputs required by Study Engagements and Use-cases.
Remote by Design
This position is Remote Only
Skills/Knowledge Required (technical and soft skills)
Technical:
Knowledge of R and Shiny with standard packages for data visualization and analysis in aid of clinical data review
Strong R and RShiny/web development knowledge with package and code repository knowledge or management experience
Experience with R Studio Enterprise solutions (ex: RS Connect)
Versed in SDLC and Agile development methodologies
Knowledge of Object Oriented designs, MVC pattern for application design and custom UI
Programming languages and syntax: R, RShiny, Python, JavaScript/CSS/jQuery, bash
Working knowledge of Linux/Windows operating systems
Familiarity with SAS and SAS Macros and data standards, e.g. CDISC
Soft Skills:
Must be capable of developing collaborative relationships with colleagues and stakeholders
Must be able to self-lead an initiative with other resources supporting this position
Must be self-motivated and have strong analytical, interpersonal, and project management skills
Must demonstrate the ability to present ideas, issues, and observations in a clear manner
Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture.
To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation. Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment. This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S.
Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Visit careers.bms.com/eeo-accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? As an experienced Data Insights & Analytics Manager , you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. If so, consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model that is tailored specifically for long-term, onsite client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing extensive travel, and provides you with a full career path within the firm.


The Team

The Strategy & Analytics offering addresses our clients' needs for on-going operations of their technology and business process investments through multi-year contracts. We deliver continuous modernization, upgrades, and address incremental business changes as part of our engagements through our 5 key offerings: SAP Operations, Oracle Operations, IT Operations, Supply Chain Operations, Finance Operations.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities

You will analyze customer support processes and conduct data analysis to identify pain points and opportunities for operational improvements
You will create data reporting processes and support the development of executive reports, turning data into insights that can be easily understood and actioned
You will develop a process control plan, including identifying and benchmarking key metrics used to guide operational activities
You will analyze unstructured customer issue data and provide recommendations on opportunities to systematize and improve issue classification
You will conduct market analysis to compare markets along multiple dimensions such as consumer preferences and technology usage to inform operational strategy in new markets

Qualifications Required

Bachelor's Degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience. Minimum of 5 years' experience in management consulting or equivalent professional capacity
Proficiency in data analytics, querying, dashboarding, and extensive experience working in data-rich environments
Excellent data visualization skills and strength in storytelling through data
Ability to extract and develop executive-level qualitative insights from unstructured data
Strong written, oral, and visual communications
Experience leading client meetings and presenting analytical insights to executive level clients
Experience managing individuals and small teams, including delegation and coordination of tasks; comfort leading, giving direction, and providing feedback to others
Ability to drive projects independently and coordinate with both internal and client stakeholder teams to define requirements, obtain data, and deliver results
Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, SQL, and dashboarding tools
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 10% annually

Preferred Qualifications

MBA degree
Familiarity with customer support solutions including contact center operations and technologies
Familiarity with Google Workspace applications (Google Docs, Slides, Sheets, Chat, Meet)
Experience with Python

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
Pinterest’s Recruiting Operations & Enablement team is responsible for empowering the Recruiting team to hire the very best talent on the market today. We do this through elevating our talent brand, developing effective processes, and creating a world class candidate experience that will set us apart from the competition.

We're looking for a Program Manager to help scale our global interviewing processes. You will need to be collaborative while balancing the ability to independently make decisions and recommendations. This role will involve working with and supporting our core Recruiting teams and various cross-functional partners throughout the business to build out a large scale interviewing program. This role is fast-paced, highly visible, and has an opportunity to impact complex projects and initiatives to help make our hiring processes efficient and inclusive.

What you'll do:

This person will assess the current state of our interviewing programs, develop processes, communications, and training to drive the change management of our new interview processes and initiatives
Build out a capacity model for our interviewing programs to mitigate interviewer burnout and create load balance across interviewing teams
Collect, reconcile, and analyze data to properly load balance interviewing volume across a large interviewing pool
Own relationships with cross functional stakeholders within Recruiting, I&D, and hiring teams
Ensure our processes are optimized within our scheduling tool (GoodTime) to increase automation within scheduling

What we’re looking for:

Demonstrated success with complex project planning and project management with an ability to manage cross-functional stakeholders at an array of levels
A highly collaborative individual, who can also balance working independently to execute on their work
A metrics-driven approach to conducting work, capable of pulling and positioning data to make objective decisions
Agility to context switch from strategy/planning to execution and complex project planning
Effective written and verbal communication to influence team members and cross-functional stakeholders, including giving feedback to partners and colleagues
Previous experience in recruiting coordination as a manager or IC capacity in a fast-paced, high-volume environment is a plus
Previous experience working within an Engineering organization also a plus

#LI-REMOTE
Our Commitment to Diversity:

At Pinterest, our mission is to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love—and that includes our employees. We're taking on the most exciting challenges of our working lives, and we succeed with a team that represents an inclusive and diverse set of identities and backgrounds.

job_title: PROJECT MANAGER, CLINICAL DATA MANAGEMENT - REMOTE NORTH AMERICA
job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Remote US/Canada
Full-time Regular with Benefits
Sign-on bonus available!

We are vital links between an idea for a new medicine and the people who need it. We are the people of PPD — thousands of employees in locations worldwide connected by tenacity and passion for our purpose: to improve health. You will be joining a truly collaborative and winning culture as we strive to bend the time and cost curve of delivering life-saving therapies to patients.

Are you a data and a people person? Here’s your team. We manage and clean the data collected in a clinical trial — from the design and build of the database and edit checks, through the entry and cleaning of data to the final delivery of clinical trial data. We work closely with the project teams and clients to identify best practices and processes, meet and exceed our clients’ needs, and do the right thing to earn their trust.

As a Clinical Data Management Project Manager, you will help ensure the highest quality of data and effectiveness of CDM Projects. You will work directly with management to manage CDM projects including ownership of financials of projects. This position works closely with clients and other team members at PPD.

At PPD we hire the best, develop ourselves and each other, and recognize the power of being one team. We offer continued career advancement opportunities, award winning training and benefits focused on the health and wellbeing of our employees.

Summarized Purpose:
Acts as a study manager for multiple studies individually or as a program of several studies. May perform the Project Manager role for standalone studies. Responsible for functional, administrative and financial oversight of assigned projects.

Essential Functions:

Provides support and coaching to the DM team to ensure that all tasks are completed accurately, on time and within budget to meet or exceed client expectations.
Acts as a primary liaison for project team and client.
May develop and implement study specific training for DM project staff and performs independent reviews of DM deliverables following CDM guidelines.
Monitors, evaluates and proposes mitigation strategies surrounding risk to deliverables and finances. Participates in business development activities by assisting with bid preparation and representing data management at bid defense meetings, where required. Additionally, promotes repeat business by developing relationships with new and existing clients.
Performs project forecasting of hours and identification of resource requirements and manages project budgets including identification of out of scope work and participate in the Contract Modification process.
Participates in the development and implementation of processes, procedures and training for the data management function as directed.
Mentors junior level staff and peers on all associated tasks within a study or program.
Independently leads and delegates tasks to ensure timely completion of project activities to project timelines, quality and budget.
Job Qualification

Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent and relevant formal academic / vocational qualification

Previous experience that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job (comparable to 8 + years). Addtional experience required for Sr CDM PM.
Candidates with a CDM background are preferred, however strong relatable clinical project management backgrounds can be considered.

In some cases an equivalency, consisting of a combination of appropriate education, training and/or directly related experience, will be considered sufficient for an individual to meet the requirements of the role.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Ability to effectively apply knowledge and skills in a highly organized fashion while adhering to regulatory guidelines, global SOPs and client expectations

Ability to use interactive computer programs

Excellent written/ verbal communication skills with a strong command of English language and grammar; strong organizational and analytical/problem solving skills; strong customer focus and excellent interpersonal skills

Ability to identify project risks and to effectively evaluate and develop plans to mitigate those risks

Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality with clinical data and client's proprietary data

Ability to act as a study or department expert for DM processes.

Ability to train and direct a study team, providing leadership and direction to both subordinates and peers

Ability to forecast project resourcing, project timeline planning and adherence to timelines.

Ability to supervise and delegate tasks.

Ability to successfully apply above skills, knowledge and abilities across a portfolio of studies"

Working Environment:
PPD values the health and wellbeing of our employees. We support and encourage individuals to create a healthy and balanced environment where they can thrive. Below is listed the working environment/requirements for this role:

Able to communicate, receive, and understand information and ideas with diverse groups of people in a comprehensible and reasonable manner.

Able to work upright and stationary for typical working hours.

Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology with proficiency.

Able to perform successfully under pressure while prioritizing and handling multiple projects or activities.

May require travel. 10-20% annual possible.

PPD Defining Principles:
- We have a strong will to win - We earn our customer’s trust - We are gamechangers - We do the right thing - We are one PPD -

If you resonate with our five principles above, and ultimately wish to accelerate the delivery of safe and effective therapeutics for some of the world’s most urgent health needs, then please submit your application – we’d love to hear from you

Diversity Statement
PPD is proud to be an affirmative action employer that values diversity as a strength and fosters an environment of mutual respect. PPD is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, pregnancy, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status or status within any other protected group.

We nurture the next generation of purposeful changemakers by helping children ages 3-12 develop resilience, inquisitiveness, and empathy through our STEM education programs.NORY offers one of the largest STEM camps in NYC. Our team is an ambitious and kind group of entrepreneurs who care deeply about the next generation of education. If our mission and the open-ended potential to grow with the company excite you, please read on.We are looking for a rock-star Customer Happiness Manager: Our 5000 families are passionate about the future of education. Nurturing this community of passionate families is an important and meaningful task. The keyword for this position is “relationship.” Beyond providing the support our families need, we want to build a long-term relationship with each of them so their parenting journey grows with us. Additionally, this position will help the team improve the quality of our program through the input we collect from families. This is an entrepreneurial and proactive role that can create a massive impact on our families and team.Please find the specific job responsibilities below, but first, here’s a checklist for you: I am an empathetic problem solver.I have a clear definition of “good communication” which is my key strength.I am good at building long-term friendships with people.I am proactive and entrepreneurial.I am purposeful. I ask “why” to generate inner motivation and define the success of my responsibilities.I am positive. I ask “how to make it work?” before asking “will it be possible?”I make decisions based on data and logic..I am accountable and disciplined. I take agreements seriously.I seek feedback, and I welcome others to show different perspectives and more effective ways to help me grow.I unify the team. I help nurture a loving and caring environment that upholds the values of empathy and compassion.Responsibilities: Communicate with customers via phone, email and chat to provide support and build lasting relationshipsHandle customer-related administrative duties: data entry and reporting, assisting with programming and schedulingNurture the community of the NORY families through your creative initiatives beyond regular communications such as newslettersAssist with special projects, such as partnership development, and process improvementsIf you welcome the opportunity to achieve our mission of nurturing purposeful changemakers with a talented team of kind hearts who have a meaningful vision for education, please email us your cover letter and resume at: peter(at)nory.coNORY, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $50,000.00 - $70,000.00 per yearBenefits:Health insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: Remote

job_title: Manager of Data Science and Analytics
job_description:
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
With $82.6 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 260 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 135,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Provides data science and analytics project/program development, leadership, and delivery using advanced analytics and innovative visualization techniques
Understands business needs via voice of customer analyses with stakeholders and customers, translates key findings to viable analytical projects that can be scaled and deployed worldwide, develops solution strategies that can be followed to meet customer needs
Derives valuable strategic insights by mining and integrating internal and external data sources, exploring data relationships, solving problems and resolving data anomalies, building and deploying rules-based and statistical models
Collaborates with and leads internal data, reporting and analytics colleagues as well as external suppliers and consultants in the delivery of strategic analytics projects
Deploys business intelligence tools for business customers through training and end user validation, enabling them to intuitively derive insights and actions from complex underlying information and models
Supplies to the overall improvement of the data science and analytics service offering by sharing skills and techniques with colleagues, learning from colleagues and taking steps to reduce inefficiencies. Builds connections between services and solutions, and generally improve our brand in the eyes of our customers
Provides onboarding and training to new team members whenever needed
Partners with procurement and business leaders in the regions to develop analyses enabling strategic decisions

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree is required with majors in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or similar fields preferred
A minimum of 5 years of related experience
Experience as a Data Solutions Architect, crafting automated dataflow, building data pipelines using programming (Python, R, Scala) or ETL software (Alteryx, KNIME or similar)
Experience in data integration and quality evaluation activities
Strong analytical skills and hands-on professional experience with quantitative analytics is required
Experience in the use of visualization tools, open-source or commercial (Shiny, Dash, Streamlit, Tableau, Qlik, Cognos)

Starbucks - Legal
From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. Starbucks’ Global Security & Resilience is seeking an accomplished intelligence and analysis professional to join the Business Resilience & Intelligence team, providing Intelligence and Analysis to our International, Supply Chain, Compliance and Operational business units.

This position has a significant impact by leading efforts to anticipate challenges to Starbucks business model, brand, and the safety of its partners. A Global Intelligence manager is expected to lead risk and opportunity intelligence efforts that reduce Starbucks’ exposure to disruptions and identifies opportunities for growth and efficiency. You will identify knowledge gaps and requirements, build a methodology, collect information, analyze, and deliver insights in innovative ways that tell a story and make our leaders smarter. More than assessing geo-political events, the intelligence team contextualize changes in the political, economic, business and security spheres according to the impact they have on Starbucks and its partners. This role will provide subject matter expertise for intelligence matters supporting business units across the enterprise and oversee the delivery of a wide variety of intelligence products by working with stakeholders to identify and prioritize intelligence requirements and delivering on them. This partner will manage contract and professional services personnel in completing intelligence-related projects and models and act in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.

As part of the Business Resilience & Intelligence team, this partner will develop and organize cross-functional analytical capabilities in support of multiple business units, to include priority support to international markets. This partner will combine intelligence collection experience, analytical methodology, data analytics, and risk management skills to meet the dynamic and evolving requirements of multiple business units that support Starbucks retail operations and support partner communities in our offices around the globe. Working with cross-functional colleagues, this partner will identify intelligence gaps and requirements related to partner safety, market trends, retail operations, and business resilience to develop analytical frameworks, manage data collection, and produce final products that inform leadership decision making.

Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

Assessing global geo-political events for potential impact on partner safety, business risks, and strategic opportunities;
Monitoring the coffee, retail and Quick Service Retail market landscape abroad to identify risks and opportunities;
Completing and leading others in the production of expert analysis on the implications of events that could disrupt Starbucks growth and success and delivering these products to the appropriate client groups, including senior leaders;
Developing individual and cadenced products that meet the requirements of leaders;
Completing special projects to support key initiatives across the enterprise
Directing contract workers and professional service providers both in the completion of intelligence-related projects, including identifying the appropriate provider, scoping and budgeting for the project, monitoring and developing performance, ensuring the final product meets our client groups’ needs, and managing vendor invoicing and payment
Consulting with appropriate business partners up to and including senior leadership team members in all areas of the enterprise to inform business decisions and provide decision confidence; and,
Cross-functional collaboration with Business Resilience and Intelligence teams (Travel safety, Crisis Management and Business Continuity) and partnership with GS&R’s Physical Security, Compliance, and Strategy teams.

Summary of Experience:

Progressive experience (5 plus years) in intelligence collection, risk analysis, data analytics and/or production with an intelligence agency or global private enterprise;
Experience (8 plus years) in cross-functional roles, working with collectors, data scientists, data analysts, and policy/program/business subject matter experts;
Familiarity with visual data storytelling;
Demonstrated success with written analytical products, visual presentations, and leadership briefings;
Cross-functional capability building – minimum 2 years in leadership roles, managing cross-functional skill sets to meet requirements
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Ability to communicate analysis, data, and security-related concepts and conclusions to a broad range of technical and non-technical partners
Ability to solve complex problems and follow through to solution
Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing environment
Ability to lead cross-functional teams
Ability to manage vendor performance
Ability to influence at the highest levels of the organization
Possess a working knowledge of geo-political analysis with a thorough understanding of intelligence cycle and architecture, to include planning, collection, assessing and execution
Ability to identify and implement system and process improvements within budget guidelines
