Company Description
BlueOptima’s vision is to become the global reference for the optimisation of the performance of Software Engineers across all industries.
We provide industry-leading objective metrics in software development. We enable large organisations to deliver better software, faster and at lower cost, with technology that pushes the limits of what has been done before.
We are a global company which has consistently doubled in headcount and revenue YoY, with no external investment. We currently are located in 4 countries: London, Mexico, India and the US. A total number of 200+ employees (and increasing every day) from 34 different nationalities and with over 25 languages spoken.
We promote an open minded environment and encourage our employees to create their own success story in this high performance environment.

Job Description
We are looking for an Implementation Manager to lead our pilot delivery process ensuring the successful onboarding of new clients and their value realisation.
Based in Phoenix, the Implementation Manager will support the sales team by working directly with clients to understand their success criteria and demonstrate return on investment through detailed analysis.
Reporting to the Global Head of Customer Success & Delivery, you will drive new initiatives and process improvements to achieve KPIs. You will be passionate about providing exceptional experience to clients, directly helping them through the onboarding process.
Key Responsibilities:
Support pilot owners throughout the client onboarding process, monitoring the progress of the implementation checklist and achieving key milestones in a structured way.
Consult with clients on their business problems and pilot success criteria, translating them into analysis which showcases the value of BlueOptima.
Bespoke analysis using data visualisation tools.
Ensure consistency in delivery, reducing the onboarding time and average duration.
Act as a point of escalation internally and to clients during the onboarding, bringing a mature approach to resolve issues.
Participate in presentations to C-Level executives.

Qualifications

Degree in a technology-related discipline.
Experience working directly with clients.
Detail-oriented and proactive problem-solver.
Drive and motivation to succeed.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Goal-driven attitude and desire to deliver client solutions in an enterprise setting.
Good self-management and organisation to balance time across multiple clients.
Experience with data visualisation tools is preferred, but not essential.
Additional Information
Why join our team?
Culture and Growth:
Global team with a creative, innovative and welcoming mindset
We offer the opportunity to work with a range of innovative software products with a strong value proposition in a major growth industry
Rapid career growth
The chance to be a visible contributor to the company's success
Freedom to create your own success story in a high performance environment.
Training and Personal Development Plans for each employee
Benefits:
32 days paid annual vacation time (including public holidays)
Medical Benefits
Flexible Work from Home policy - 2 days home per week
Free drinks and snacks in the office
International travel opportunities
Global annual meet up (most recent meetups have been held in Cancun and Goa!)
Salary: $92,000-$102,000 (OTE)
Stay connected with us on LinkedIn or keep an eye on our career page for future opportunities!

What is BoomTown?
BoomTown is a software platform designed to help real estate professionals generate leads, manage contacts, and run their business better. Over 40,000 of the industry’s best use our products to close more deals. Our success is trademarked with growth. It’s why the Real Trends Thousand is dominated by BoomTown clients. We bring the technology and experts to turn opportunities into closings. With our product suite, our clients get access to world-class lead generation, consumer-websites, CRM technology, and a powerful mobile app. Together, they create a seamless experience so our customers can attract, convert, and win new clients easily.
Our Benefits
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a 401k retirement plan, comprehensive healthcare, discretionary PTO, and a quarterly wellness reimbursement towards health and fitness.
In this role, you’ll be part of a cross functional team that serves as a virtual center of data excellence for the company. As a Data Analyst you will be supporting Product Managers, Developers and Business Leaders to enable maximum utilization of BoomTown’s data resources across many domains within the company. You will be collaborating with Engineers, Data Scientists and other Analysts to deliver high impact, advanced analytics based solutions. Additionally, you’ll need to bring a multidimensional skill set and mindset to ensure that insights are happening for BoomTown stakeholders.


Responsibilities:
Translate stakeholder requests into project plans with best time and resource to insight ratios
Deliver high value insights to stakeholders across multiple domains
Develop datasets and visualizations optimized for end users via Tableau
Support and maintain data team assets like the Data Warehouse and Tableau Servers
Promote and educate valuable analytical opportunities to stakeholders
Collaborate with Data Engineering and Data Science resources to develop advanced and scalable analytics solutions
Manage data requests from stakeholders within the Data Team’s Agile development processes
Take initiative on assigned day-to-day tasks and keep pace with the team to get the job done while knowing when to ask for help.
Stays abreast of advancements, trends and future directions of the industry in the area of responsibility.
Required Qualifications:
Minimum Bachelor’s degree At least 2 years of relevant work experience
A deep understanding and experience working with sql to query and model data
Strong capabilities for data mining, cleaning and munging disparate data sources
Working knowledge of at least one language used for analytical programming (Python, R or equivalent)
A deep knowledge of at least one modern data visualization/reporting application (Tableau or equivalent) and viz best practices
Working knowledge of advanced modeling and analytical tools in spreadsheet applications
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with semi-structured data generated from web and mobile applications
Knowledge of ETL and Data Pipeline frameworks
Knowledge of dimensional data modeling techniques
Knowledge of Data Warehousing concepts
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and problems they are best suited to solve
Working knowledge of web activity tracking tools like Google Analytics
Ability to apply inferential statistics and probability to real world scenarios
BoomTown Offers You:
Growth potential and ability to lead change
Company leadership that believes in flexibility, freedom, and innovation
Challenging, motivating, fun and dog-friendly work environment
Company culture that is guided by our core values that thrives on passion and innovation

job_description:
Your Opportunity
We are looking for a curious, optimistic, and innovative data scientist who takes the initiative to solve problems that help our clients and one another succeed. Our large client base and multi-channel transaction volume offers a fertile data environment to build models, discover new insights, and guide decision-making at Schwab.
Data Science is an enterprise team within the Data, Analytics, and Insight (DAI) organization that builds models and provides sophisticated analytical support across all business units including retail, institutional, marketing, digital, and operations. Our data scientists directly work with business, product, technology, and other analytical teams in DAI to solve complex business problems by building powerful models and tools to grow the business, streamline costs, and improve customer experiences.
Workplace Flexibility Program: We're proud to support our employees in a working approach that allows you to bring your best self to work – whether that’s in the office or remote.
Most Schwabbies have the opportunity to voluntarily work in the office or at home based on their preference, through the remainder of 2021.*
When the firm is ready to fully return to the office, employees will have the flexibility of a hybrid work environment, spending some time working remote and some time in the office.
Employees and managers can discuss and decide what works best for them, with additional flexibility available based on their role, business needs, and individual circumstances.Subject to change as Schwab is continually evaluating the current environment in order to best care for the safety and well-being of our employees.
What you are good at
Apply critical thinking skills and sophisticated analytics to solve complex business problems
Translate business partner’s needs into data science projects and help prioritize opportunities based on expected business impact and execution complexity
Drive projects, individually or collaboratively, through the data science lifecycle including data collection, exploration/analysis, model development, validation, and deployment
Seek, build, and consolidate data inputs proactively to create and improve models
Validate, document, and review models with governance and risk partners to ensure they do not cause excessive risk to the company
Develop presentations to communicate key messages to senior sponsors, non-technical partners, and other collaborators
Collaborate with peers and colleagues to continuously improve the team’s capabilities
What you have
Technical Skills
Quantitative Foundation: B.S. degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering).
Programming: compose clean, understandable, and reproducible code in Python and/or R.
Machine Learning / Modeling: understand what types of algorithms to use, their benefits and drawbacks, and how to implement them.
Data Wrangling: write efficient SQL queries from scratch that blend data from dozens of sources in the right form for modeling, analysis, and scoring.
Statistical Analysis: design research approaches to investigate trends, patterns, and relationships using statistical methods and tests to reach actionable conclusions and understand causal relationships.
Data visualization: grasp data-ink ratios and bring data-driven stories to life through visuals.
Soft Skills
Curious: bring intellectual curiosity, an inquisitive nature, and a desire to deepen your knowledge and continue learning.
Business acumen: understand the bigger picture for customers and the business and how to connect your work to key objectives for the organization.
Storytelling: write and present messages and insights clearly to persuade non-technical partners that they can confidently use our models and solutions.
Ownership: take responsibility to proactively advance projects, contribute to the organization, and develop the best solutions.
Bonus Points If You Have:
5+ years of progressive data science experience
A graduate degree (Masters or PhD) in a quantitative field
Experience deploying models into production
Proficiency using git for version control, collaboration, and releases
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Dataiku
Working knowledge of Spark, PySpark
Financial services experience or passion to understand the industry
Colorado Compensation
Target Total Compensation – 122,700 – 200,300
Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience - talk with your recruiter to learn more.
Why work for us?
Own Your Tomorrow embodies everything we do! We are committed to helping our employees ignite their potential and achieve their dreams. Our employees get to play a central role in reinventing a multi-trillion-dollar industry, creating a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth.
Benefits: A competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future. Explore further.

job_title: Product Marketing Manager, Data and Analytics, Google Maps
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in B2B Product Marketing strategy and execution.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in marketing data and analytics products to technical audiences and team members.
Experience driving measurably successful product launches and campaigns.
Ability to build collaborative partnerships with products and other cross-functional teams.
Ability to work in a multicultural and global environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
About the job
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

Product Marketing plays a critical role in Google Maps Platform’s strategy to provide the best location based services for developers and businesses. As the Product Marketing Manager for Data and Analytics, you will be responsible for building out and communicating our data and analytics value to internal and external audiences. This means elevating our overall value propositions through the creation of narratives, marketing experiences, and working to scale our messages and technical content through a range of different channels.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Uncover user insights, define key segments, drive customer acquisition and growth programs across owned and paid channels in collaboration with other growth organizations.
Develop requirements for UX and features while partnering with other teams to execute and set up measurement plans and track impact of initiatives and experiments.
Drive experience optimizations throughout the customer journey using A/B and multivariate testing tools.
Oversee the website acquisition growth road-map informed by qualitative and quantitative insights.
Forecast, measure, and analyze the impact of programs in terms of conversions, activation, and growth, while improving, iterating, and expanding the programs over time.

job_title: Data Manager - Cancer Moonshot Program - HCC Clinical Trials Office - Hollings Cancer Center
job_description:
Job no: 541268
Entity: MUSC University
Department: ACADEMIC AFFAIRS - Hollings Cancer Center
Sub Department: UNIV-2101020-HCC Clinical Trials Office
Work type: Full-Time
Employee Type: UNIV - Classified
Location: Charleston, SC-Downtown, Hollings Cancer Center
Categories: Administrative & Non-Clinical Professionals
Pay scale: UNIV-Band 4: $28,216.00 - $40,210.00 - $52,204.00 (min - mid - max)
FLSA: Hourly


Job Summary: Under general supervision of the Clinical Trials Office (CTO), Manager of Clinical Operations, coordinates and supervises complex data management activities involving protocol management including data management, and specimen submission. Patient follow-up, patient caseload and data management. Provides core support for oncology research studies at the Hollings Cancer Center.


Job Duties:

35% - Maintains current, long-term follow-up and survival data on assigned patient caseload. Data submission is timely and accurate per the protocol, patient calendar, and source documents. Patient management will include all disease programs and multiple protocols. - (Essential)
20% - Coordinates the reporting of adverse events based on the NCI Common Toxicity Criteria, (CTC). Adverse events are submitted for multiple disease programs on multiple studies. Data is submitted to various sponsors, research bases, FDA, & the local IRB as per institutional policies - (Essential)
15% - Prepares, transports, and handles blood borne pathogens and other biologic specimens following OSHA and IATA guidelines. Collection of pathology specimens and radiology images at designated time points are submitted to study sponsor - (Essential)
15% - Utilizes EPIC electronic medical record system and is competent and efficient in abstracting the required source documents for patient research charts. Utilizes data collection method instruments and computer data programs for all studies. Data Entry and query resolution on multiple NCI sponsored Cooperative Group websites and sponsor websites. Utilizes office tools including SharePoint, CTMS, Clinical Data Center (CDC) and Inteliquet - (Essential)
15% - Process protocols and patient related documents and data forms. Compiles lists, maintains patient/study calendars, and creates and maintains necessary documents. Resolves sponsor queries correctly, completely and in a timely fashion. Process request for pathology slides and shipping slides to sponsor. Supports the Study Coordinator as needed with patient protocol visits including QOL surveys, escorting patients to various locations on campus and picking up IDS oral study medication - (Essential)


Preferred Experience & Additional Skills:

Editorial Manager
Summary
As our Editorial Manager, you’ll ensure the quality of the Content Experience team’s core deliverables (Help articles, release notes, developer documentation, video scripts, and more), and you’ll lead the way in defining and implementing an impactful, customer-focused editorial strategy in a highly matrixed environment.
You’ll manage editorial capacity, quantify editorial impact, advocate for the importance of quality, user-centric content, and make the case to stakeholders to ensure your team continues to grow. You are a passionate advocate for the importance of editorial, can quantify its impact, and can educate others on its value. You know what makes content inclusive and accessible to customers and users of varying skills and abilities.
Notes: work with editorial staff to demonstrate the value of editorial and advocate for additional resources Duties
Oversee editorial team in multiple locations; define, implement, and measure editorial strategy across a large organization of content developers

Help maintain a clear and consistent voice across content that includes help articles, release notes, developer documentation, video scripts, infographics, etc.
Manage a team of editors in the US and work with and align with editorial manager in India
Define ways to maintain quality while achieving scale
Lead our Acrolinx strategy across the company, making sure we’re getting the most out of the tool in support of our quality goals and compliance to standards.
Provide direct feedback, coaching and workshops to other editors and new or struggling writers
Grow the team’s influence and expertise
Edit content as needed
Stay current with industry terminology, best practices, and new technologies
Define and update accessibility requirements for content according to industry standards

 3+ years of experience managing an editorial team

 Experience successfully implementing new strategies and process changes across a large content team
 5+ years of editing experience, preferably for tech or products

 Knowledge and experience editing end-user, administrator, and developer content

About the Role:
CrowdStrike is looking for a seasoned Sr. Events Manager to join our fast growing team and company. The primary focus of this role is to plan, manage, recommend, collaborate, and coordinate between stakeholders to deliver experiential events whether virtual, physical, or hybrid. You will interface with the broader marketing, product, and internal support teams to ensure both our external and internal events reflect our company’s strategy and vision. This role will also build relationships and collaborate with marketing managers, product managers, solutions architects, and business developers to help create unique content showcases for events. The Sr. Events Manager plays a critical role in bringing our brand and messaging to life through engaging and memorable events that ultimately drive demand and sales pipeline. The ideal candidate brings a proven track record of flawless event planning and execution, effective communication, and project management.

Ability to assertively project manage teams and hold team members accountable for deliverables.
Extensive knowledge in managing events from conception to completion, including digital event platforms, complex logistics, venue liaison, production, speaker sourcing, budget management and onsite execution
Demonstrates strong critical thinking skills and ability to problem solve and come up with solutions and recommendations.
Collaborate, consult and influence leaders and stakeholders within the function, across functions and outside of the organization.
Analyzes data and provides insights as a result for future executions to ensure we are optimizing our event marketing investments and aligning our event strategy to our campaigns and business objectives.
Effective budget management and budget reconciliation.
Exceptional project management, and time management skills – highly organized, detail focused, results-driven, and accountable with the ability to handle high pressure last-minute, urgent requests
Demonstrate strong understanding of various digital and virtual event technologies and applicability to different programs.

Exceptional communication skills, including strong verbal and Powerpoint skills, ability to present at all levels of the organization
Define and execute internal and external event awareness and communication plans and associated deliverables. Including but not limited to email invitations, web pages, direct mail, social media, PR, and webinars.
Strong attention to detail, excellent customer service and creativity in problem-solving
Evaluate event performance, including post event analysis, de-briefs and wrap-up reports

Why Housecall Pro?

Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company - we champion the Service Pro to success.
We are tackling a large market ($700b+) generally underserved by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor.
Competitive compensation and benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employee assistance program, 401K) that start on day 1.
Our passionate employees bring their authentic selves to work. Housecall Pro employees are encouraged to create employee resource groups to make the world better (think volunteering and philanthropy).
Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs.
Paid holidays and self-managed take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off.
Opportunity to come onboard with a team that is experiencing high growth with ability to explore different career paths.

Housecall Pro

At Housecall Pro, we're focused on making the everyday lives of home services professionals better by helping them to incorporate mobile software into their workflow...freeing them to focus on what they do best. The home services industry remains vast ($700b+) but untouched by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor. The 3M+ mobile businesses in home services are facing dramatic change as the world shifts from offline to online. Along this journey, we are quickly becoming the backbone operating system for service labor across the US and Canada.

Our vision is to revolutionize the home services experience.

Our mission is to unlock the potential of every Pro.

The Role:
Our Analytics team enables Housecall Pro and it's Pros to make analytics driven decisions, through culture, trust, accessibility and literacy. We are force-multiplier, egoless individuals with an ability to create extraordinary results. We deliver the what and ask for the why; we are builders, enabling measurability and working with discipline and rigor. We also know the journey is about working with smart people, that you can have fun with.

In this role, you are embedded in a team of data analysts, data engineers and data scientists and you'll work closely with cross-departmental teams, aimed at increasing acquisition, retention and revenue within the product. You'll support building the foundational data and process infrastructure, and delivering data products to support the business' objectives. You will work along the entire analytics value chain; starting with raw data sources to final data products. You will foster a culture of data-driveness through experimentation and data governance.

The Role:
Defining product data instrumentation and data products
Being a data leader for the organization
Understanding the user and business context around data
Managing 1-2 analysts on the team and building the team roadmap with technical stakeholders
Data Stack: AWS, Snowflake, Tableau, Segment, Amplitude, Salesforce
The Project Areas:
Building functional & self-serve reporting for everyone in the organization
Defining key metrics with Execs
Driving a data culture within the function along with leadership
Defining team roadmap towards building data products to drive organization's decisions
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Economics, or related field
4-6 years experience in data analytics at a growth tech company
1+ year in management
Strong in SQL
Conversant in our tech stack (Snowflake, Segment, Amplitude, Tableau)
Strong communication, prioritization, and project management skills
Analytical, techy, social, curious, confident
Being a team player
Strong integrity and empathy for what home service professionals do
Eager to own, build, drive, lead, have an impact and have lots of fun!

Think Different. Do Different. Be Different.

Alcami is a world-class contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO). We are a team of dynamic individuals committed to developing life-saving drugs around the world. A mindset of innovation, accountability and customer focus inspires us to be the most efficient, safe and reliable choice for our customers and the patients they serve. In return, we offer challenging careers, accelerated professional growth and the opportunity to be part of something different.

Shift

2nd Shift; Monday - Friday 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm

Position Summary

The Manager, Manufacturing is accountable for driving results in a fast-paced environment by providing leadership to the site’s manufacturing function. Focus areas for the role include operational leadership, parenteral (fill/finish, inspection) manufacturing process, project management, continuous improvement, change management, manufacturing investigations/corrective actions, participation in business reviews, and support of regulatory and client audits. The position requires superior leadership behaviors of the Alcami core competencies and non-negotiables, as well as expertise in functional competencies included in this position profile.

Essential Functions

Develops information and produces reports concerning scheduling, production goals, equipment and maintenance problems and other studies or reports as requested.
Provides manufacturing information by compiling, initiating, sorting, and analyzing production related records and data to key stakeholders within Alcami.
Ensures all manufacturing discrepancies are captured with appropriate documentation and works collaboratively with appropriate personnel to facilitate client communication per quality agreements.
Accountable for accurate and timely completion of all department investigation reports and the effective and timely corrective/preventative action (CAPA) implementations and follow-up.
Accountable for the accurate and timely completion of all manufacturing processes and documentation (batch records) and "first time right" performance goals.
Responsible for administration of department budget to include forecasting resources for future periods.
Ensures timely completion and compliance with cGMP and all other relevant company training requirements.
Attracts, develops, and retains a high performing team to meet the current and evolving needs of the business through effective selection, training and development, coaching and mentoring and performance management.

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of related experience required.
A minimum of 4 years of supervisory experience is required.
Prior pharmaceutical experience, CMO or CDMO experience required.
Aseptic filling experience required.

Alcami Non-Negotiables

Consistently demonstrates honesty and integrity through personal example.
Follows all safety policies and leads by example a safety first culture.
Produces high quality work product with a focus on first time right.
Complies with the company code of conduct and policies and regulatory standards.

Alcami Core Leadership Competencies

Thinks strategically. Quickly identifies and acts on opportunities. Considers the downstream impact. Seeks to understand the why. Focuses on work that matters.
Develops organization and others. Takes ownership to develop self and others. Seeks out new opportunities and experiences for continuous learning.
Acts decisively. Makes and acts on decisions quickly. Makes decisions with the customer and their patients in mind. Meets commitments with a sense of urgency. Seeks ways to be more efficient.
Drives performance. Holds self and others accountable. Delivers results first time right. Never settles for status quo. Willing to have tough conversations. Asks for feedback and takes action to improve.
Passion for customers. Listens to understand. Asks the right questions. Gets to the heart of the matter and uses that insight to provide value.
Works collaboratively. Seeks out the experience of others with the aim for better results. Open minded regardless where ideas originate. Flexible and easy to work with.

Functional Competencies

Expert knowledge of review/approving manufacturing investigations ensuring they are completed in a timely manner with appropriate root cause analysis and effective corrective/preventive action identified required.
Expert Knowledge of supporting the development of new or revised manufacturing instructions preferred.
Knowledge of operational procedures for equipment preparation, formulation, filing, capping and lyophilization activities within their respective cGMP guidance/procedures required.
Knowledge of leading manufacturing teams to maintain adherence to a demanding production schedule required.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Directly leads team of 7-8 direct reports.
Participates in the hiring process of other employees.
Makes hiring decisions of other employees.
Schedules and reviews the work of other employees.
Ensures accuracy and relevance of assigned training curriculum.
Drives timely completion of training for employees to meet regulatory requirements.
Coaches, mentors and develops other employees.
Prepares and delivers performance evaluations of other employees.
Makes recommendation of disciplinary actions of other employees.

Travel Requirements

Up to 5% domestic travel

What We Offer You:
Competitive salary with career advancement opportunitiesBonus planMedical, dental and vision coverage from day one401(k) with company matchCompany paid vacation, holiday and sick-leaveVoluntary benefits including short & long-term disability, life, accident, critical illness insurances

Diversity and Inclusion:

Alcami values diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, past or present military service, marital status, gender identification or expression, medical condition (including genetic characteristics) or any other protected characteristic as established by law.

Individuals are considered fully vaccinated 2 weeks after their second dose of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine, or 2 weeks after a single-dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine. Individuals seeking an exemption from this requirement for medical or religious reasons should contact HR to complete a request for accommodation form.

Meta is seeking a highly-motivated individual to lead projects and initiatives. This role will sit on the Admin Programs Team, within the Operations pillar. The role will partner closely with the Admin community to design, pilot and roll out new processes. This is a unique opportunity to build and shape the evolution of administrative support at Meta on a global level.The scope of this role involves interacting with a multitude of client groups, including HR, Legal, Workplace Planning/Facilities, Supplier Management teams, among others. This individual requires the ability to advise and influence various internal teams across the business. This person will need to be comfortable executing in a fast-paced environment, be highly organized, have strong communication skills, and be able to structure and run concurrent projects.Success in this position requires strategic thinking, leadership, communication, a high comfort level with ambiguity, as well as the ability to effectively work with cross-functional groups. Success in this role and team also requires a willingness and eagerness to pitch in where needed, with the ability to go high level but also get into the details, in addition to a strong work ethic. This may mean supporting another team within the Admin Programs Team on their priority projects and initiatives.This role is full-time.


Project Manager, Admin Programs Team Responsibilities:

Manage projects end-to-end, which includes scoping, planning, execution, risk/issue mitigation and stakeholder management

Compose and distribute company wide communications that outlines and explains various changes, programs, guidelines and policies, and specifically how it impacts the Global Admin Community
Craft and present proposals for projects to Leadership teams
Manage and facilitate project team meetings, with the intent to drive towards specific milestones
Update, manage, and oversee Admin-related policies in partnership with HR, Legal and other partners
Work with the rest of the Admin Programs Team to generate metrics/analytics to track efficiency, consistency, and errors
Support other project objectives
support collecting, analyzing and integrating feedback into project work-streams
Serve as subject-matter expert to field questions from partners and employees
Exercise independent judgment and discretion while utilizing Company policies and practices to determine appropriate action
Monitor shared mailboxes and inboxes and serve as the first responder for inquiries related to operations and process


Minimum Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in an operational or project management role
Experience executing on high priority projects
Experience executing projects under time constraints
Experience working with global partners
Experience working independently with little direction
Experience managing and driving concurrent projects
Aptitude for driving projects from idea to completion in a timely manner
Experience with Microsoft Office, including Excel (V-lookups, pivot tables), Outlook (distribution lists, shared inboxes)

BA/BS
Management Consulting, project/program management, Administrative Services, Recruiting Services, or People Operations experience

Proven communications experience, including drafting communications to a global client group

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. Starbucks’ Global Security & Resilience is seeking an accomplished intelligence and analysis professional to join the Business Resilience & Intelligence team, providing Intelligence and Analysis to our International, Supply Chain, Compliance and Operational business units.

This position has a significant impact by leading efforts to anticipate challenges to Starbucks business model, brand, and the safety of its partners. A Global Intelligence manager is expected to lead risk and opportunity intelligence efforts that reduce Starbucks’ exposure to disruptions and identifies opportunities for growth and efficiency. You will identify knowledge gaps and requirements, build a methodology, collect information, analyze, and deliver insights in innovative ways that tell a story and make our leaders smarter. More than assessing geo-political events, the intelligence team contextualize changes in the political, economic, business and security spheres according to the impact they have on Starbucks and its partners. This role will provide subject matter expertise for intelligence matters supporting business units across the enterprise and oversee the delivery of a wide variety of intelligence products by working with stakeholders to identify and prioritize intelligence requirements and delivering on them. This partner will manage contract and professional services personnel in completing intelligence-related projects and models and act in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.

As part of the Business Resilience & Intelligence team, this partner will develop and organize cross-functional analytical capabilities in support of multiple business units, to include priority support to international markets. This partner will combine intelligence collection experience, analytical methodology, data analytics, and risk management skills to meet the dynamic and evolving requirements of multiple business units that support Starbucks retail operations and support partner communities in our offices around the globe. Working with cross-functional colleagues, this partner will identify intelligence gaps and requirements related to partner safety, market trends, retail operations, and business resilience to develop analytical frameworks, manage data collection, and produce final products that inform leadership decision making.

Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

Assessing global geo-political events for potential impact on partner safety, business risks, and strategic opportunities;
Monitoring the coffee, retail and Quick Service Retail market landscape abroad to identify risks and opportunities;
Completing and leading others in the production of expert analysis on the implications of events that could disrupt Starbucks growth and success and delivering these products to the appropriate client groups, including senior leaders;
Developing individual and cadenced products that meet the requirements of leaders;
Completing special projects to support key initiatives across the enterprise
Directing contract workers and professional service providers both in the completion of intelligence-related projects, including identifying the appropriate provider, scoping and budgeting for the project, monitoring and developing performance, ensuring the final product meets our client groups’ needs, and managing vendor invoicing and payment
Consulting with appropriate business partners up to and including senior leadership team members in all areas of the enterprise to inform business decisions and provide decision confidence; and,
Cross-functional collaboration with Business Resilience and Intelligence teams (Travel safety, Crisis Management and Business Continuity) and partnership with GS&R’s Physical Security, Compliance, and Strategy teams.

Summary of Experience:

Progressive experience (5 plus years) in intelligence collection, risk analysis, data analytics and/or production with an intelligence agency or global private enterprise;
Experience (8 plus years) in cross-functional roles, working with collectors, data scientists, data analysts, and policy/program/business subject matter experts;
Familiarity with visual data storytelling;
Demonstrated success with written analytical products, visual presentations, and leadership briefings;
Cross-functional capability building – minimum 2 years in leadership roles, managing cross-functional skill sets to meet requirements
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Ability to communicate analysis, data, and security-related concepts and conclusions to a broad range of technical and non-technical partners
Ability to solve complex problems and follow through to solution
Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing environment
Ability to lead cross-functional teams
Ability to manage vendor performance
Ability to influence at the highest levels of the organization
Possess a working knowledge of geo-political analysis with a thorough understanding of intelligence cycle and architecture, to include planning, collection, assessing and execution
Ability to identify and implement system and process improvements within budget guidelines

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others.
This unique role contributes to Starbucks success by supporting and working cross-functionally with professionals to manage Ethics & Compliance (E&C) business operations. The role will advance the E&C program through continuous process improvement and increased efficiencies related to business systems, metrics, data analytics and reporting. This position will lead a diverse range of projects and initiatives that contribute to E&C strategic priorities and company goals, including oversight of Starbucks Enterprise Policy Office.
As the Ethics & Compliance operations manager, you will…
Develops and manages the execution of strategic and operational plans for work group in support of Starbucks goals, objectives, mission, and values.
Plans and manages department processes and practices to ensure operational excellence. This includes monitoring service level agreements and key performance indicators, providing metrics and analysis, and identifying and addressing opportunities for improvement.
Fosters partnerships, cross-functionally, with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to deliver complex, multifaceted projects
Leads continuous improvement projects and initiatives using a variety of inputs, including data analytics.
Leads change management efforts to support the implementation and adoption of strategic compliance solutions.
Provides leadership the global policy office.
Manages and assesses third party vendor relationships.
Leads team of direct reports, creating an environment that enables partners to thrive.
Promotes ethical integrity, facilitates proper decision-making, and provides partners with the tools and resources to do what is right in any context.
We’d love to hear from people with:
3+ years experience managing complex and large-scale projects
Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to successfully achieve strategic outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities
Experience building, implementing, and maintaining technical systems to support workflows and meet business needs (experience with case management systems is preferred)
Proactive approach to anticipating issues, recognizing needs and solving problems
Demonstrated experience analyzing workflows, and designing and implementing process improvements
Ability to simplify and structure complex and ambiguous problems
Strong analytical skills; understanding of quantitative and qualitative data analysis, metrics, and reporting
Extensive vendor management experience
Ability to manage others and lead through influence
Strong collaboration and communication skills

Your RoleAs a sourcing manager at Voomi Supply, you’ll drive the lifeblood of the business by identifying, approaching and managing potential partner suppliers. You are a self-starter, show hustle and figure out creative ways to find companies that match well with our mission and our customer’s needs. You will own the process of contacting, educating, negotiating, onboarding and managing ongoing relationships with suppliers for the business.You do not need to have prior experience as a sourcer to qualify. However, you must have clear drive, attention to detail and a passion to win. We are a team of entrepreneurs and are looking for someone that can work fast, fun and as part of a growing team.What’s Voomi Supply Like?100% Remote and Flexible Hours. Work on your terms however you prefer. Hard workers that produce results are what matters to us. Not where you live or if you work in your PJs.Be Yourself. Speak your mind. We are a team of entrepreneurs and a flat organization. We expect people to bring great ideas to the table and to actually share them. If we’re not doing something well enough - say it! We have 0% ego.Define your Career Growth. We’re growing fast and want people to help us grow even faster. What’s better than creating your own career opportunity? We give more responsibility quickly to those that show the desire and talent.Unlimited time off. Yes, that’s right - we don’t cap your paid time off. Of course, we know you’re going to be working really hard so we want you to recharge too!Participate in our Financial Success. We offer ways for our team members to receive equity rights in the company. Think like and actually become an owner!Self-funded So We Call the Shots. We answer to ourselves and are a well-capitalized business. We have the means to support our growth while focusing on making the right decisions for us, not those that may appease middle management or an investor.What Does Voomi Do?We’re a technology-focused e-commerce company helping to revolutionize the industrial distribution space. Say what? That means we help HVAC, plumbing, electrical and similar service companies find the products they need in a fast, modern way. The industry is still very old school…maybe you have experienced what happens when you call a technician to your home only to find they don’t have the part they need? That’s where Voomi comes in. We have a vast catalog of thousands of products located across the U.S. ready for quick shipment. We aim to change how technicians find the equipment they need while delighting their customers with faster service.What you’ll be doingYour mission: identify and onboard new suppliers/vendors for the business.Your responsibilitiesCultivate new supplier relationshipsMeet or exceed new supplier targets/goalsWork with the team to integrate supplier information into our systemsProvide feedback and manage supplier relationshipsEscalate issues or potential challenges to management and involve them to help close deals when necessaryExpand the depth of suppliers in our core product areasProvide reporting to leadership on progressMaintain detailed records within our CRM for all outreach activitiesCold call, email and data-mine as necessaryWhat we look for in youHungry, energetic, and passionate self-starter with a get-it-done attitudeDemonstrated ability in sales and fast-thinkingClear, articulate communication and ability to relay a clear messageAttention to detail and discipline in daily activity planning and time managementComfortable learning and adapting to new technology and applicationsAbility to cultivate and nurture relationships with your colleagues and customersHigh School degreeJob Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 - $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payApplication Question(s):Have you done 'cold' outreach before?Can you provide 1-2 examples of how you show hustle to achieve goals?Education:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Sales: 1 year (Required)Work Location: Remote

job_title: Product Marketing Manager, Data and Analytics, Google Maps
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in B2B Product Marketing strategy and execution.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in marketing data and analytics products to technical audiences and team members.
Experience driving measurably successful product launches and campaigns.
Ability to build collaborative partnerships with products and other cross-functional teams.
Ability to work in a multicultural and global environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
About the job
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

Product Marketing plays a critical role in Google Maps Platform’s strategy to provide the best location based services for developers and businesses. As the Product Marketing Manager for Data and Analytics, you will be responsible for building out and communicating our data and analytics value to internal and external audiences. This means elevating our overall value propositions through the creation of narratives, marketing experiences, and working to scale our messages and technical content through a range of different channels.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Uncover user insights, define key segments, drive customer acquisition and growth programs across owned and paid channels in collaboration with other growth organizations.
Develop requirements for UX and features while partnering with other teams to execute and set up measurement plans and track impact of initiatives and experiments.
Drive experience optimizations throughout the customer journey using A/B and multivariate testing tools.
Oversee the website acquisition growth road-map informed by qualitative and quantitative insights.
Forecast, measure, and analyze the impact of programs in terms of conversions, activation, and growth, while improving, iterating, and expanding the programs over time.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

job_location: Remote in New York, NY+5 locations
job_description:
Data, Research & Insights
Data Science
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join a team leading efforts to further expand our customer offering for Spotify.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
With a focus on innovation projects, you will be part of a small, agile, and constantly evolving team, working to identify and execute upon growth opportunities that meet our ambitious commercial and user experience goals.
In this role, you will empower the team with all things data - analyzing survey data to glean consumer insights and inform market sizing workstreams, dive into Spotify’s user-level streaming behavior, artist affinity to build new core datasets and dashboards - and more. We are looking for a Data Scientist capable of setting their own priorities and pushing ahead through any obstacle.
As a Data Scientist, your mission is to turn our 200 petabytes of data into insights and gain a deep understanding of music and listeners to impact the way users engage with Spotify.
What You'll Do
Work closely with a tight knit, cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, user researchers, designers, and product managers who are all passionate about creating new innovative products/experiences for our users
Perform segmentation analyses to understand how users currently engage with Spotify, what their key pain points are, and help shape the future of what the users experience or product suite could become.
Work closely with the team including data engineering to build lasting solutions to our data modeling projects and bring model ideas through the entire lifecycle (from ideation to automatic production).
Turn data into insights helping to ideate and define innovative “go-to-market” products and app features for our users.
Establish and maintain a culture of rigor and data curiosity to drive tangible business impact.
Post-covid, work from our office in New York with some travel to other Spotify office locations
Who You Are
You have at least 4+ years of experience, with a degree in statistics, mathematics, computers science or equivalent on-the-job experience
Coding skills (such as Python) and analytics tools experience (such as Pandas, SQL, or R), machine learning packages a plus.
Capacity and passion to translate business objectives into actionable insights, and analytics results into business and product recommendations.
Where You'll Be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

Job Description:
The Data Privacy Manager will lead a small team of data privacy associates responsible for executing on the day-to-day DSAR requests and driving optimal future state solutions for data privacy.
The Data Privacy Manager is accountable for directing the efforts/initiatives of the data privacy team and partnering with key stakeholders, including Marketing, Information Technology, Legal, and other business stakeholders to assess compliance risk and drive the development and setup of effective data privacy practices across all business functions of Ferguson in support of regulatory compliance.
Additionally, this role oversees and further develops strategy for ensuring practical compliance with the growing number of data privacy regulations, while furthering Ferguson’s mission. It is responsible for driving the team towards improving the end-to-end data privacy compliance process. The role also conducts extensive investigation to understand the root cause of noncompliance with privacy practices, which are frequently complex and typically involve consideration of multiple sites, products and/or stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Work cross-functionally with Legal and other stakeholders to ensure regulatory compliance.
Manage the execution of Ferguson’s Data Privacy Compliance Program including ongoing process improvement.
Execute day-to-day management and coordination of data privacy compliance, including managing DSAR process, conducting research, and timely response to privacy inquiries or complaints.
Participate as a member of Ferguson’s Information Assurance Council.
Identify data privacy compliance risks and drive solutions, while enabling business objectives.
Execute day-to-day management and coordination of data privacy compliance.
Classify personal information and perform data mapping/inventory of sensitive personal information.
Assist Legal in evolving Ferguson’s data privacy strategy and compliance program, including consent management and data retention, identifying data privacy compliance risks, and developing privacy awareness and training.
Work cross-functionally with Legal and other stakeholders to achieve regulatory compliance.
Work cross-functionally with Legal, Strategic Sourcing, and Information Security on overseeing third-party data privacy compliance.
Assess and document access rights and protocols.
Lead the ongoing development and implementation of data privacy compliance frameworks, operating models, and technologies.
Support the Legal and Information Security leads with responding to privacy incidents.
Lead a small team of individual contributors.
Qualifications:
Minimum of five years' experience in data privacy, corporate compliance, and governance.
Prior experience with GDPR, CCPA and other privacy regulations.
Demonstrated experience in delivering complex projects, aligning technology, business and legal requirements.
Experience working with data catalog / meta data management tools.
Data Privacy Certification (e.g. CIPP, CIPM, or CIPT).
Bachelor’s degree or higher in business administration, law, finance, accounting, computer science or related field.
Willingness to work outside of comfort zone, and challenge status quo, and hold the team and partner stakeholder groups accountable to compliance with privacy practices and established program milestones.
Strong communication and people management skills with ability to build relationships and influence key stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, business-friendly, and a team player, with an ability to think creatively and accommodate tight deadlines and business objectives.
Strong sense of urgency and problem-solving ability.
Ability to support and document evolution of ‘as is’ processes to ‘to be’ processes that will be necessary on a new platform.
Ability to organize and prioritize work.
Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc.).
Ferguson is dedicated to providing meaningful benefits programs and products to our associates and their families—geared toward benefits, wellness, financial protection, and retirement savings. Ferguson offers a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, retirement savings with company match, paid leave (vacation, sick, personal, holiday, and parental), employee assistance programs, associate discounts, community involvement opportunities, and much more!

MLB is hiring a Manager, Consumer Analytics to be a key contributor in support of some of the top initiatives being undertaken across the industry. This position will report directly to the Senior Manager, Consumer Analytics within the S&D organization, and will focus on leveraging data and analytics to help drive business impact and advise various verticals throughout the organization.

The ideal candidate will be a thought-leader on trends and dynamics impacting the Sports, Media, and Entertainment landscape, and will bring a strong, structured strategy toolkit and experience to a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Responsibilities:

Measure and recommend improvements on digital products such as MLB.TV, MLB & Club websites, applications such as the MLB App, Rally, and Ballpark, and video games like Home Run Derby and RBI 21.
Perform ad hoc and advanced analyses on user behaviors while feeding data to product owners and strategic leads to assist in guiding product and content strategy.
Retrieve data and provide insight into MLB.com portal traffic, industry trends, and the League's third-party presences.
Assist in the reporting and creation of media strategies on Owned and Operated platforms for media partners such as ESPN+ and YouTube TV.
Present thoughtful, cohesive evidence to support initiative and campaign proposals to various MLB stakeholders.
Develop dashboards, reports, and ad hoc analyses that provide insights into major projects, initiatives, and trends around the League.
Create and distribute traffic and usage reports to assist internal business owners, upper management, and all 30 MLB Clubs and MLB partners in project creation and prioritization.
Work with others to develop and facilitate best practices for data and analytics across the League.
Assist in analytical projects aiming to spot usage and traffic trends across digital platforms and determine causation.
Build presentations regarding project performance for dissemination internally.
Manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment.

Required Skills:

Advanced knowledge of Adobe Analytics is required.
College Graduate. B.A./B.S. degree with a relevant academic major (mathematics, statistics, computer science) is strongly preferred, though candidates with non-traditional schooling backgrounds and strong relevant experience will be considered.
Highly professional manner and excellent written and verbal communication skills required.
Strong proficiency in quantitative data collection and data analysis using SQL is required.
Experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, or other data visualization software is required.
Experience with data science and statistical concepts such as regression modeling in R or Python is preferred.
3-5 years related experience is preferred.
Ideal candidate will have a low-ego, team-oriented mindset and desire to deliver successful results.
Previous experience working within the sports industry is a plus.
Location: NYC office


Why MLB?

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of opportunity, collaboration, and professionalism. The professionals who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify and solve problems, put the team first, and work collaboratively. For those who are ready to join the "Major Leagues" of their careers, MLB takes the same approach as they do with their players: striving to empower their own "workforce athletes" to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are ready to step up to the plate and continue transforming America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!

343 Industries is looking for a Release Manager to help deliver exciting and creative experiences in the Halo Universe. The ideal candidate is able to gracefully balance schedule needs with creative imperatives and push for quality and innovation all while managing a compliant, sustainable release process.
Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Release Manager at 343 Industries, you will work directly with Lead Producers, Producers, Content Project Leads, Engineers to establish, execute, and improve the process for releasing content title updates and new releases.
Ensure teams and products comply with global requirements for game releases and updates.
Work with production and test to validate certification requirements during development to ensure timely and successful certification.
Document, execute, and improve content readiness, builds release, and game content publishing to the production environment.
Drive pre-release builds flighting and access management.
Manage day-to-day development issues and drive identification of potential release impact.
Facilitate collaboration and communication across teams leading to compliance and release.
Work with leads to update and maintain release information and schedules.
Configure storefront game products, store pages and products in platform publishing portals.
Identify and remove roadblocks that prevent production teams from performing to their highest potential.
Coordinate and lead efforts across the studio’s teams, Xbox, Microsoft such as: Content Production Teams, Quality Assurance, Marketing, User Research, Localization, Business Development, Licensing, Legal, and more.
Provide regular status on the state of releases, risks, and mitigations.
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS
You are detailed and organized. You never let anything fall through the cracks. You are clear, concise, and specific. You understand, track, and ensure that release data is 100% accurate.
You can talk to creatives (e.g. artists and game designers), technical people (e.g. programmers), and non-technical people (e.g. PR and Marketing) alike. When conflicts occur, you bring people together, you listen, you mitigate, and you resolve.
There is no instruction manual on how to be a great Release Manager. You use your instincts, experiences, and team to identify, assess, and solve problems quickly and frequently.
Both playing video games and a passion for understanding what makes them great.
You have experience shipping AAA current generation games through a minimum of two product cycles as a Release Manager or Producer.

job_description:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

Division Overview:
ViacomCBS is looking for a talented and highly motivated individual with strong Product Management skills to join our Data Technology Solutions (DTS) Group. Our Data technology Solutions team is an agile group and develops reliable data platforms to facilitate internal groups for processing data more efficiently.
The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing Data Products from the initial concept, to designing, developing as well as promoting, and adaption

Role Details:
The Product Manager will work with different groups across ViacomCBS and is responsible for maintaining product roadmaps, requirements, and moving the products forward in terms of features and functionality.

Your Day-to-Day:
You will be working with Ad Sales, Research, Marketing, and other teams to understand their business needs as well as maintaining close relations with the groups.
You will be documenting specifications and product requirements from your conversations with stakeholders.
You will work closely with the Data engineering and Infrastructure team, providing direction as to what products and enhancements are being sought by stakeholders
You will be responsible for the product road map and will work with the DTS management team and drive their strategy
You will help foresee and resolve issues that affect development timeline
Help drive adoption of products by introducing new products and features to our customers
Act as a liaison between business owners and the Data Product development team.

Qualifications:
What you bring to the team:
You have –
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferred
4 -6+ years of work experience in Product Management
Proven work experience in product management.
Proven ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to management.
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development, including Data Management and Web Apps.
Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to articulate high-level technical solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to comprehend and break down technical documentation provided by vendors and partners.
Knowledge of cloud and data warehouse technologies.

You might also have –
Agile experience and familiarity with JIRA and Confluence.
Experience creating training presentations

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
The Opportunity
As a Consulting Delivery Manager on the Data & Insights, Personalization, and Activation Consulting team within the Adobe Customer Solutions organization, you will be responsible for leading a team of delivery consultants and for ensuring quality professional services delivery in consulting engagements. You will drive continuous professional services process improvement and efficiency while establishing high standards for delivery quality. You will recruit and develop consultants and drive utilization goals to ensure target achievement. You will support client success through direct and indirect client engagement. You will also help develop a culture of innovation and serve as a strong champion for change.
What You’ll Do
Lead, recruit, and mentor, a team of Adobe Consultants and thus ensure customer success through quality in consulting delivery.
Drive continuous improvement of consulting delivery processes, standards, and practices, driving customer excellence.
Run client escalations by guiding and coaching the team to ensure proper communication, vitality, prioritization, and ownership throughout the experience.
Meet and exceed targets around: customer satisfaction, billable utilization, consulting revenue, and margin as well as driving operational excellence.
Proactively champion collaboration with Customer Success, Sales, Engineering, Product Management, Technical Operations, and other internal Adobe teams.
Organize and conduct enablement sessions to strengthen team with respect to both technical- and soft-skill proficiencies.
Lead and inspire a team with positivity and optimism, creating a culture of high expectations, innovation, and achievement.
What You Need to Succeed
Executive leadership skills including the ability to develop, influence, and empower a diverse team to maximize results.
Ability to communicate, coordinate, and drive optimal revenue, team productivity, and margin performance.
Experience leading and running a large team of office and remote-based consulting team members, within a software vendor is preferred.
Minimum of 3-4 years’ experience leading Consulting teams.
Ability to interact and communicate for impact and change within all levels of an organization both internally and externally, including business and technical stakeholders
Confident ability to lead, collaborate, triage, and make decisions in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Shown strength in EQ (emotional intelligence) as well as analytical and problem-solving skills.
Expert-level experience in negotiation and conflict resolution.
In-depth knowledge of digital marketing and customer experience management are required.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with meticulous attention to detail.
Preference given for experience with digital marketing tools and systems related to analytics, data analysis, testing & optimization, personalization, and activation
Bachelor’s Degree in information systems, computer science, or a related field of the technical industry.
Ability to travel up to 35%
Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado.
Colorado Starting Salary: $147,800 - $192,000
At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).
In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
