job_description:
Your Opportunity
We are looking for a curious, optimistic, and innovative data scientist who takes the initiative to solve problems that help our clients and one another succeed. Our large client base and multi-channel transaction volume offers a fertile data environment to build models, discover new insights, and guide decision-making at Schwab.
Data Science is an enterprise team within the Data, Analytics, and Insight (DAI) organization that builds models and provides sophisticated analytical support across all business units including retail, institutional, marketing, digital, and operations. Our data scientists directly work with business, product, technology, and other analytical teams in DAI to solve complex business problems by building powerful models and tools to grow the business, streamline costs, and improve customer experiences.
Workplace Flexibility Program: We're proud to support our employees in a working approach that allows you to bring your best self to work – whether that’s in the office or remote.
Most Schwabbies have the opportunity to voluntarily work in the office or at home based on their preference, through the remainder of 2021.*
When the firm is ready to fully return to the office, employees will have the flexibility of a hybrid work environment, spending some time working remote and some time in the office.
Employees and managers can discuss and decide what works best for them, with additional flexibility available based on their role, business needs, and individual circumstances.Subject to change as Schwab is continually evaluating the current environment in order to best care for the safety and well-being of our employees.
What you are good at
Apply critical thinking skills and sophisticated analytics to solve complex business problems
Translate business partner’s needs into data science projects and help prioritize opportunities based on expected business impact and execution complexity
Drive projects, individually or collaboratively, through the data science lifecycle including data collection, exploration/analysis, model development, validation, and deployment
Seek, build, and consolidate data inputs proactively to create and improve models
Validate, document, and review models with governance and risk partners to ensure they do not cause excessive risk to the company
Develop presentations to communicate key messages to senior sponsors, non-technical partners, and other collaborators
Collaborate with peers and colleagues to continuously improve the team’s capabilities
What you have
Technical Skills
Quantitative Foundation: B.S. degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering).
Programming: compose clean, understandable, and reproducible code in Python and/or R.
Machine Learning / Modeling: understand what types of algorithms to use, their benefits and drawbacks, and how to implement them.
Data Wrangling: write efficient SQL queries from scratch that blend data from dozens of sources in the right form for modeling, analysis, and scoring.
Statistical Analysis: design research approaches to investigate trends, patterns, and relationships using statistical methods and tests to reach actionable conclusions and understand causal relationships.
Data visualization: grasp data-ink ratios and bring data-driven stories to life through visuals.
Soft Skills
Curious: bring intellectual curiosity, an inquisitive nature, and a desire to deepen your knowledge and continue learning.
Business acumen: understand the bigger picture for customers and the business and how to connect your work to key objectives for the organization.
Storytelling: write and present messages and insights clearly to persuade non-technical partners that they can confidently use our models and solutions.
Ownership: take responsibility to proactively advance projects, contribute to the organization, and develop the best solutions.
Bonus Points If You Have:
5+ years of progressive data science experience
A graduate degree (Masters or PhD) in a quantitative field
Experience deploying models into production
Proficiency using git for version control, collaboration, and releases
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Dataiku
Working knowledge of Spark, PySpark
Financial services experience or passion to understand the industry
Colorado Compensation
Target Total Compensation – 122,700 – 200,300
Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience - talk with your recruiter to learn more.
Why work for us?
Own Your Tomorrow embodies everything we do! We are committed to helping our employees ignite their potential and achieve their dreams. Our employees get to play a central role in reinventing a multi-trillion-dollar industry, creating a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth.
Benefits: A competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future. Explore further.

Description
SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time
Be part of an extraordinary team
We are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?
Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting
The preferred location for this position is Connecticut but other locations may be considered
(eligible for a remote work schedule)
The Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting manages professional level associates engaged in various levels of data and statistical analysis that includes compiling, manipulating, analyzing, and reporting of data. Typically data is used for both internal and external purposes. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:
Direct management of Data Analytics & Reporting staff including: hiring, providing guidance and direction, determining workload and delegating assignments, training, monitoring and evaluating performance, and initiating corrective or disciplinary actions.
Formulates data management strategies and solutions, engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational strategy.
Understand and manage data lifecycle from data acquisition, evaluation of data integrity, day to day maintenance and synthesis of data to satisfy contractual reporting requirements.
Demonstrates a track record of making difficult and impactful decisions to drive the business forward. Leads the development of a system-wide plan to ensure data is governed, shared, standardized, and analyzed for the key purpose of driving action and decision-making that promotes clinical and operational excellence.

Department specific responsibilities:
Management of staff includes developing the Data Analytics & Reporting staff into a cohesive team capable of timely service and product delivery by providing leadership, professional development, and cross-training. Includes direct collaboration and communication with other departmental leaders.
Works with internal and external stakeholders to design and maintain data to support programs; tracks, prioritizes and manages analytics implementation initiatives across teams; serves as contact and decision maker for analytics and reporting requests.
Presents and communicates data analytic results and procedures performed in a coherent and effective manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.

THE POSITION
Are you seeking meaningful and rewarding work as a high level decision-making investment performance manager serving in a critical and independent control function for senior management? Do you have relevant experience and want to be the trusted advisor on an Investment Office team of over 60 professionals?
DESCRIPTION OF WORK
We are looking for someone with significant experience and a quantitative finance interest in support roles conducting Performance Measurements, Performance Attributions, and Performance Presentations. This includes the creation, modeling, maintenance, analysis, and delivery of benchmarks, performance, risk, and investment strategy metrics necessary for; achieving absolute and relative risk/return goals for a sophisticated and multidimensional leveraged portfolio. You will define, establish, and maintain performance evaluation processes and controls, be responsible for overseeing official performance calculations done by consultants, oversee consultants reports, establish processes to manage benchmarks and work with management for board requirements.

A successful candidate for this position will be able to demonstrate many of the listed preferences along with the following attributes: strong attention to detail/technical acumen; excellent interpersonal and communication skills both written and verbal; collaborative work ethic; strong problem solving skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment; ability to work within required deadlines; and ability to understand requisite performance-related mathematical and quantitative techniques; and the ability to comprehend complex financial concepts and analyze related data to form conclusions and provide recommendations.

The Pennsylvania Public School Employees’ Retirement System (PSERS, www.psers.pa.gov), is an agency in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania that administers the pension plan with diversified asset class portfolio for Pennsylvania’s public school employees. The mission of PSERS is to maintain a financially sound System that supports over a half million members with a current pension fund of approximately $72 billion. This position will play a contributing part in ensuring PSERS fulfills its mission and values.

PSERS is located in Harrisburg, PA, a mid-size city situated along the Susquehanna River. The Harrisburg area is affordable and near many attractions including Hershey, and it is only two hours from major cities and airports like Philadelphia, Baltimore, and Washington D.C.

Work Schedule:
Monday - Friday, 7:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. with a 1-hour lunch

Telework:
You will have the opportunity to work from home (telework) part-time. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY
Two years as a PSERS Senior Investment Professional; OR

A bachelor’s degree and five years performing relevant investment operations or investment risk work; OR

An equivalent combination of experience and training.

Successful completion of any of the following professional accreditations may be substituted for relevant work experience:
Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA): 1 year per level passed
Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA): 1 year
Financial Risk Manager (FRM): 1 year per level passed
Professional Risk Manager (PRM): 1 year
Certified Treasury Professional (CTP): 1 year
Additional Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree; AND
A cover letter with resume submitted in the application; AND
Six years of experience performing relevant investment management of performance and attribution work; OR
Four years performing relevant investment management of performance and attribution work with two years in equivalency (two years for either a CIPM or a master’s degree/doctorate degree in economics, finance, accounting, data science, or statistics; OR
A combination of two years with 1 year each for a CAIA, PRM, and CRT or 1 year per level passed for both a CFA and FRM); proficient experience with a BI tool (Qlik, PowerBI, Tableau, Crystal Reports, other similar tools).
Preferred Qualifications:
Eight years of experience performing relevant investment management of performance and attribution work;
A bachelor’s, master’s or doctorate degree in economics, finance, accounting, data science, or statistics;
Completion of certificates for CPA, CIPM, CAIA, PRM, CRT, or at least one level passed for CFA and FRM;
Experience with computation engines including programming in analytic software/tools (such as R, Python, MatLab, PowerBI, Tableau, or other related tools);
Proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint, and Word;
Experience implementing GIPS and GIPS reporting for asset owners;
Experience working with Excel VBA and SQL with emphasis on large sets of data;
Experience with investment performance and attribution management systems such as SimCorp Dimension;
Experience working with investment managers such as an asset management firm, a hedge fund, or a pension.

Position Purpose:
The Associate Data Scientist is responsible for supporting data science initiatives that drive business profitability, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. This role works closely with Data Scientists and/or Sr. Data Scientists in their team to develop solutions by applying advanced analytics methods and algorithms for identifying trends and providing business solutions. Based on the specific data science team, this role may need to develop skills in one or more data science specializations, such as optimization, computer vision, recommendation, search or NLP.

As an Associate Data Scientist, you will develop skills that effectively leverage data science methodologies to creatively solve business problems and provide strategic insights. This requires effective communication skills as well as continuous learning and development at both the technical and business level.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:
70% Solution Development - Design and develop algorithms and models to use against large datasets to create business insights; Supports data science projects by conducting effective analysis to solve business problems; Executes tasks with high levels of efficiency and quality; Consults with Data Scientist or Sr. Data Scientist on appropriate selection, utilization and interpretation of advanced analytical methodologies; Learn about the assigned business areas to provide better solutions by incorporating business-specific knowledge

20% Communicating Results - Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audience; Support preparation of reports, updates and/or presentations related to progress made on a project or solution; Highlights potential impacts of recommendations to drive alignment and appropriate implementation

10% Technical Learning - Keep up to date on industry trends, best practices and emerging methodologies; Continually develop skills and expertise in data analytics concepts and methodologies; Identify opportunities to apply learnings

Nature and Scope:
This position reports to manager or above
This position has 0 direct reports

For Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City residents: The pay range for this position is between $61,000 and $115,680. Starting salary may vary based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, the position being offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. The Home Depot offers additional competitive financial and non-financial benefits, which may include a performance-based bonus program or a profit sharing program depending on position.

Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

Basic knowledge or exposure to predictive modeling, data mining and data analysis

Master's degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, etc.) or equivalent work experience3+ years of experience in business intelligence and analyticsWorking knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power PointExperience in a modern scripting language (preferably Python)Experience running queries against data (preferably with Google BigQuery or SQL)Experience in predictive modeling, data mining and data analysisExperience with data visualization software (preferably Tableau)Experience utilizing statistical techniques to identify key insights that help solve business problemsBasic knowledge or exposure to Prescriptive Modeling like optimization, computer vision, recommendation, search or NLP

Role: Manager of Chat & Text Supervisors
Reports to: Director, Digital Supervision
Location: Remote
Hours: Full-time
About Trevor
The Trevor Project is the world’s largest suicide prevention and crisis intervention organization for LGBTQ young people. We are a non-profit that provides 24/7 life-saving support via phone, text, and chat. We also operate the world’s largest safe space social networking site for LGBTQ youth and run innovative research, education, and advocacy programs. We’ve been saving lives every day for over 20 years.
Overview of the role
The Manager of Crisis Shift Supervisors oversees the crisis shift supervisors on The Trevor Project’s 24/7 digital crisis services, including TrevorText, and TrevorChat. Crisis Shift Supervisors provide real-time support to our amazing counselors and ensure that they provide the best possible life-affirming support to our text and chat users. As Manager, this role will lead a team of over 15 supervisors and ensure that we provide LGBTQ youth with high-quality and effective support. Long-term responsibilities include working with leaders both within the crisis services department and across The Trevor Project to drive innovation so the organization can serve even more youth. The Manager will need to be a strong, tactical manager while also being an inspirational leader.
Who you are
People person. You love working with people and know how to excite them about our life-saving work. You understand the importance of both staff and volunteers and place a premium on customer service.
Not easily shaken. You can maintain compassion for our LGBTQ youth, but aren’t easily rattled by high-stress situations and can thrive in a crisis care setting.
Innovative. You look at the way things are and then imagine 20 ways they can be improved. You’re always thinking about best practices in training and trends in tech to figure out how we can leverage these tools.
Results- and data-oriented. You are driven by results and informed by data. You operate with urgency and efficiency. You know how to identify problems and create informed and comprehensive strategies to make progress and get results.
Clear communicator. You can communicate clearly and concisely. You’re great at getting and giving respectful and productive feedback to the people working with you.
Highly organized. You know how to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately. You create clear and logical systems and processes to support your work and that of the organization.
Collaborative. You understand that the best way to meet and exceed goals is through outstanding teamwork.
Passionate. You care about LGBTQ youth. You care about saving lives. You want to come to work and feel inspired every day. You want to change the world.
Fun. The work we do is serious but that doesn’t mean we don’t have fun. We know how to have a good time and you should too.
What you’ll do
Manage, coach and support a team of 15-20 of The Trevor Project’s Crisis Shift Supervisors
Oversee day-to-day operations of the crisis shift supervision team, including staffing, scheduling, evaluation, and ensuring effective and efficient provision of high-quality service to LGBTQ youth
Work with others on crisis services and across the organization to ensure cross-programmatic alignment enabling staff to incorporate best practices into their work
Lead professional development and continued engagement of the Crisis Shift Supervisors
Ensure the implementation of quality measures on the chat/text platform to include but not limited to, conversation evaluations and new counselor feedback
Oversee priority projects, providing clear input on some and leading on others
Analyze data to identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the team
As needed, cover responsibilities within crisis services, such as serving as the on-call consult, directly supervising shifts, supporting counselor trainings, and filing mandated reports
Benefits
Generous vacation and holidays (like a full day off to celebrate Harvey Milk Day!), including three half-day Fridays during the summer
Comprehensive health insurance (we pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental, and life), including gender affirmation surgery
Flexibility to work from anywhere in the U.S. (we provide the technology, a monthly internet reimbursement and reimbursement to outfit your work-from-home space!)
Fun virtual office environment and passionate team

About Us

Community Tech Alliance is a group of technologists and strategists formed to provide data infrastructure building blocks to the progressive ecosystem at a low cost. CTA seeks to uplevel program impact by unlocking the potential of data, using software and data engineering, and removing the barriers to entry. We are a small team of engineers, data practitioners, product managers, and strategists looking to create infrastructure for progressive change.

Job description

Community Tech Alliance is looking for an Operations Manager or Director to help us build a flexible and inclusive organization, joining us in solving some of the most critical technological challenges facing the progressive movement. Job title will be determined based on experience.

As the main operations professional at CTA, you will have many opportunities to shape the way we operate. You will report to the CEO and will drive and execute a variety of business operations responsibilities including day-to-day organization administration, contracting administration and people operations. You will keep an eye toward improving efficiency and impact but always keep an open mind to new approaches to problem solving.
We’re seeking someone who cares deeply about the pressing issues of our day. We strongly encourage BIPOC, people with disabilities, people with diverse sexual orientations, gender expressions and identities to apply.
This role is a fully remote, full-time staff position with competitive salary and benefits.

Community Tech Alliance believes strongly that:

Inclusive teams are strongest, and supportive work environments take investment, intentionality, and openness
Empathy is the cornerstone of building smart technology solutions
All team members should take ownership of the project and team’s development
Iteration is key, and smart solutions require action not perfection
Nothing great has been built without making mistakes and learning from them
As Operations Manager, you will:

...make significant contributions to CTA by driving the following People, Operations and Financial activities:

PEOPLE OPERATIONS

Manage the process of our hiring operations, including:
Communicating via email with candidates throughout the hiring process;
Scheduling interviews with candidates;
Ensuring timely application reviews by members of the hiring team;
Manage CTA personnel and contractor administration, including:
Facilitating the negotiation and execution of contracts, hiring letters, NDAs, etc.
Execute new employee onboarding employment operations (tax forms, direct deposit, retirement savings and other benefits enrollment, etc.),
Onboard and off-board employees and contractors to CTA’s technology and administrative tools and resources.
Manage the HR needs of the team, including:
Facilitating feedback and review processes
Working closely with managers to provide support, resources, and training
Coordinating with counsel and CTA’s PEO on HR compliance and best practices implementation.
ORG OPERATIONS

Manage the planning and coordination of meetings with CTA leads and team, and external stakeholders (CTA’s board and advisory council);
Track CTA’s progress toward its internal metrics for success;
Identify and make improvements to CTA’s operations that elevate and support meeting its goals more efficiently, while mitigating significant risks.
Maintain, refine, and update CTA’s operating protocols and procedures to increase efficiency, and maintain a significant level of transparency throughout the company;
Manage CTA’s contracting process with contractors (for services to CTA) and clients (for services provided by CTA to clients), in collaboration with CTA’s general counsel, when needed;
Manage the relationship and the services provided by CTAs professional employer organization for payroll and benefits administration.

FINANCIAL OPERATIONS

Maintain CTA’s budget and cashflow in consultation with the CEO and accounting professionals, including tracking expenses, projected liabilities, and account status.
Process invoices in accordance with fully executed agreements via CTA’s billing software.
Maintain systems that track contracts, tax documents, payables, and time-tracking in Google Drive and other systems.

The ideal candidate will:

Feel passionate about supporting a lean, fun, and compassionate team via fantastic management of business operations.
Be eager and use great judgment to assess what is needed and develop internal processes and procedures that are efficient, scaleable, and reliable.
Communicate and facilitate feedback, summaries of next steps, brainstorm, expectations, etc. efficiently and effectively over email, Slack, telephone, and video meetings with internal stakeholders (partners, personnel, and contractors) and external stakeholders (nonprofit grantees, for profit clients, and partner organizations).
Understand how to assess nonprofit and for profit finances, compliance, and risks and the ability to engage CTA’s general counsel to manage those risks.
Enjoy and evangelize transparent project and task management for yourself, internal stakeholders, and external stakeholders in a remote environment.
Find excitement in creating solutions with internal and external team members to meet the needs of CTA as it evolves and grows.
Be 100% willing to jump in on tasks large and small with no ego and a spirit of collaboration.

Other things we’re looking for:

A strong commitment to working on teams that prioritizes diversity, equity and inclusivity;
An excitement in helping build an organization and its practices, culture, and vision, from the ground up;
An adaptive and empathetic approach to ambiguity;
Great verbal and written communication skills.

Location
Remote position; anywhere in the US.

Physical Demands

The physical demands here represent those that an employee must meet to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions:

Ability to sit at a computer monitor for extended periods of time

Salary and Benefits

Salary $85k-$115k or commensurate with experience.
We are a remote-first organization, so we provide both equipment and coworking space reimbursement. We offer a competitive compensation salary and benefits package, including:

Generous healthcare, vision & dental insurance for employees
Matching 401K contributions
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Generous holiday schedule
Paid family leave

Role: Manager of Chat & Text Supervisors
Reports to: Director, Digital Supervision
Location: Remote
Hours: Full-time
About Trevor
The Trevor Project is the world’s largest suicide prevention and crisis intervention organization for LGBTQ young people. We are a non-profit that provides 24/7 life-saving support via phone, text, and chat. We also operate the world’s largest safe space social networking site for LGBTQ youth and run innovative research, education, and advocacy programs. We’ve been saving lives every day for over 20 years.
Overview of the role
The Manager of Crisis Shift Supervisors oversees the crisis shift supervisors on The Trevor Project’s 24/7 digital crisis services, including TrevorText, and TrevorChat. Crisis Shift Supervisors provide real-time support to our amazing counselors and ensure that they provide the best possible life-affirming support to our text and chat users. As Manager, this role will lead a team of over 15 supervisors and ensure that we provide LGBTQ youth with high-quality and effective support. Long-term responsibilities include working with leaders both within the crisis services department and across The Trevor Project to drive innovation so the organization can serve even more youth. The Manager will need to be a strong, tactical manager while also being an inspirational leader.
Who you are
People person. You love working with people and know how to excite them about our life-saving work. You understand the importance of both staff and volunteers and place a premium on customer service.
Not easily shaken. You can maintain compassion for our LGBTQ youth, but aren’t easily rattled by high-stress situations and can thrive in a crisis care setting.
Innovative. You look at the way things are and then imagine 20 ways they can be improved. You’re always thinking about best practices in training and trends in tech to figure out how we can leverage these tools.
Results- and data-oriented. You are driven by results and informed by data. You operate with urgency and efficiency. You know how to identify problems and create informed and comprehensive strategies to make progress and get results.
Clear communicator. You can communicate clearly and concisely. You’re great at getting and giving respectful and productive feedback to the people working with you.
Highly organized. You know how to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately. You create clear and logical systems and processes to support your work and that of the organization.
Collaborative. You understand that the best way to meet and exceed goals is through outstanding teamwork.
Passionate. You care about LGBTQ youth. You care about saving lives. You want to come to work and feel inspired every day. You want to change the world.
Fun. The work we do is serious but that doesn’t mean we don’t have fun. We know how to have a good time and you should too.
What you’ll do
Manage, coach and support a team of 15-20 of The Trevor Project’s Crisis Shift Supervisors
Oversee day-to-day operations of the crisis shift supervision team, including staffing, scheduling, evaluation, and ensuring effective and efficient provision of high-quality service to LGBTQ youth
Work with others on crisis services and across the organization to ensure cross-programmatic alignment enabling staff to incorporate best practices into their work
Lead professional development and continued engagement of the Crisis Shift Supervisors
Ensure the implementation of quality measures on the chat/text platform to include but not limited to, conversation evaluations and new counselor feedback
Oversee priority projects, providing clear input on some and leading on others
Analyze data to identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the team
As needed, cover responsibilities within crisis services, such as serving as the on-call consult, directly supervising shifts, supporting counselor trainings, and filing mandated reports
Benefits
Generous vacation and holidays (like a full day off to celebrate Harvey Milk Day!), including three half-day Fridays during the summer
Comprehensive health insurance (we pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental, and life), including gender affirmation surgery
Flexibility to work from anywhere in the U.S. (we provide the technology, a monthly internet reimbursement and reimbursement to outfit your work-from-home space!)
Fun virtual office environment and passionate team
Online Subscription to Headspace, a digital meditation platform
The Trevor Project is an equal opportunity employer
Meaningful work at an organization that is saving the lives of LGBTQ young people across America every day
Your application
We’re excited to hear from you! To join Team Trevor, please upload a resume and cover letter. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. Use this as an opportunity to convey why you want to be the next Manager of Crisis Shift Supervisors at The Trevor Project!

You will play a significant role in structuring the overall strategic approach that showcases the depth, breadth, and exclusivity of content Hulu has to offer. Responsible for managing human capital forecasting needs. Manages portfolios of projects held by the organization. Presents information regarding strategic plans and initiatives to senior and executive management.

Job Specific Information:
This position is a critical role supporting the CEO & COO of FedEx Dataworks. The successful candidate will service as the Project Management Office for the Dataworks executive team and may lead initiatives pertaining to all aspects of business. Initiatives include project managing Commercial strategies, coordinating M&A integrations, highly complex DSML initiatives with cross divisional teams, developing large business cases and P&C Backoffice projects. Overseas demand intake and prioritization as well as the respective councils that govern these.

Best-in-class process, project management, and organizational skills

Data analytical skills

The Opportunity
As a Consulting Delivery Manager on the Data & Insights, Personalization, and Activation Consulting team within the Adobe Customer Solutions organization, you will be responsible for leading a team of delivery consultants and for ensuring quality professional services delivery in consulting engagements. You will drive continuous professional services process improvement and efficiency while establishing high standards for delivery quality. Lead, recruit, and mentor, a team of Adobe Consultants and thus ensure customer success through quality in consulting delivery.

What is BoomTown?
BoomTown is a software platform designed to help real estate professionals generate leads, manage contacts, and run their business better. Over 40,000 of the industry’s best use our products to close more deals. Our success is trademarked with growth. It’s why the Real Trends Thousand is dominated by BoomTown clients. We bring the technology and experts to turn opportunities into closings. With our product suite, our clients get access to world-class lead generation, consumer-websites, CRM technology, and a powerful mobile app. Together, they create a seamless experience so our customers can attract, convert, and win new clients easily.
Our Benefits
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a 401k retirement plan, comprehensive healthcare, discretionary PTO, and a quarterly wellness reimbursement towards health and fitness.
In this role, you’ll be part of a cross functional team that serves as a virtual center of data excellence for the company. As a Data Analyst you will be supporting Product Managers, Developers and Business Leaders to enable maximum utilization of BoomTown’s data resources across many domains within the company. You will be collaborating with Engineers, Data Scientists and other Analysts to deliver high impact, advanced analytics based solutions. Additionally, you’ll need to bring a multidimensional skill set and mindset to ensure that insights are happening for BoomTown stakeholders.


Responsibilities:
Translate stakeholder requests into project plans with best time and resource to insight ratios
Deliver high value insights to stakeholders across multiple domains
Develop datasets and visualizations optimized for end users via Tableau
Support and maintain data team assets like the Data Warehouse and Tableau Servers
Promote and educate valuable analytical opportunities to stakeholders
Collaborate with Data Engineering and Data Science resources to develop advanced and scalable analytics solutions
Manage data requests from stakeholders within the Data Team’s Agile development processes
Take initiative on assigned day-to-day tasks and keep pace with the team to get the job done while knowing when to ask for help.
Stays abreast of advancements, trends and future directions of the industry in the area of responsibility.
Required Qualifications:
Minimum Bachelor’s degree At least 2 years of relevant work experience
A deep understanding and experience working with sql to query and model data
Strong capabilities for data mining, cleaning and munging disparate data sources
Working knowledge of at least one language used for analytical programming (Python, R or equivalent)
A deep knowledge of at least one modern data visualization/reporting application (Tableau or equivalent) and viz best practices
Working knowledge of advanced modeling and analytical tools in spreadsheet applications
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with semi-structured data generated from web and mobile applications
Knowledge of ETL and Data Pipeline frameworks
Knowledge of dimensional data modeling techniques
Knowledge of Data Warehousing concepts
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and problems they are best suited to solve
Working knowledge of web activity tracking tools like Google Analytics
Ability to apply inferential statistics and probability to real world scenarios
BoomTown Offers You:
Growth potential and ability to lead change
Company leadership that believes in flexibility, freedom, and innovation
Challenging, motivating, fun and dog-friendly work environment
Company culture that is guided by our core values that thrives on passion and innovation
BoomTown is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Business Management

The Business Management job is responsible for providing strategic support for the assigned business area. While focusing on high level projects, this job executes strategic business management consulting to leaders by analyzing metrics and presentations to support business strategies, driving business management policies and routines, and being the central point of contact for leaders in the execution of business management tasks. This job is considered a subject matter expert in the Business Management area.


Key Responsibilities and Duties
Acts as a day-to-day technical/functional expert in assigned area and makes decisions on tactical issues that impact the business.
Maintains and supports implementation of policies and procedures in support of the business area strategy.
Implements process improvements.
Analyzes and reports on area data (financial, headcount, etc.) and performance metrics.
Supports business management projects by monitoring and tracking risks, issues and action items.
Drives and oversees meeting planning in support of business projects and objectives.
Influences the development of new strategic initiatives through tracking budgets and milestones.
Educational Requirements
University (Degree) Preferred
Work Experience
5+ Years Required; 7+ Years Preferred
Physical Requirements
Physical Requirements: Sedentary Work

Career Level

8IC

Program Manager, Data Literacy Services
San Mateo, CA

The Data Strategy & Operations (DSO) team has grown rapidly over recent years in response to an increasing need for the business to use data to inform, and to identify new opportunities and to drive data driven decisions. Currently there are over 150 staff within the DSO team, split between London and California, made up of highly skilled training, business intelligence (BI) and data professionals covering BI architecture, platform support, data processing, insight reporting, predictive analytics, scrum masters and product management.

DSO is looking to recruit a skilled, highly driven individual for a global customer facing role driving the use of data as a strategic tool; enabling teams to create value and drive competitive advantage through leveraging data as an enterprise asset.

The Program Manager will join the Data Literacy Service team of skilled business intelligence (BI) analyst and L&D trainers to grow and evolve the game changing global data literacy program that educates colleagues on where to find data, what to do with it and how reliable and useful it is. The program will put data in the center of decision making, achieving faster and more accurate data-informed business decisions with better business outcomes, and a data-first culture that is dedicated to all things data.

Responsibilities:

Program Development:

Creating and leading roadmaps for implementing a data literacy / up-skills program
Collaborating with team members to lead planning, scope, dependencies, risks/issues
Developing and monitoring of objectives, key measures and outcomes and timelines for delivery
Implement industry standard methodologies to drive adoption of data driven culture, with the support of the Data Literacy Services Team, and assess and measure culture change across SIE.
Collaborate closely with the business on their data literacy initiatives in order to learn from their experiences and ensure a coordinated approach across SIE

Customer Engagement:

Collaborate cross departments to raise awareness of program goals and mission to influence a data driven culture.
Collaborate with cross functional teams to identify data comprehension gaps and take steps to fill them.
Grow a data community that cultivates knowledge share, self-serve, and data re-use
Facilitate data events, connect with internal or external speakers, grow internal data community

Customer Education:

Design sustainable, multi-faceted learning solutions across multiple customers, that will scale and evolve with the growth of the business, using various modern learning modalities
Deliver online and in-person data literacy training from course design to participant management and course evaluation
Own the development of content, resources and materials
Support our analyst community data needs and data fluency
Handle the data literacy content development lifecycle for various media types

Desired Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in program or project management
Experience working in data literacy, data governance and culture programs
Experience working with an abstract goal that needs to be turned into actionable bodies of work.
Experience leading and facilitate large scale change
Experience in influencing and collaborate with colleagues to achieve targeted outcomes and create business value
Ability to travel, including some international travel, for key collaborator meetings

Preferred Qualifications

Experience implementing adult learning design best practices
Experience with, Atlassian tools (Jira, Trello or Confluence), L&D, Articulate 360, MicroStrategy, Tableau or similar
Experience in a global gaming and media company
BA/BS degree in data and analytics or education-related field

We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable – and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications.

We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

Job Description
PepsiCo Data Governance Program Overview:
PepsiCo is establishing a Data Governance program that will be the custodian of the processes, policies, rules and standards by which the Company will define its most critical data.

Enabling this program will:
Define ownership and accountability of our critical data assets to ensure they are effectively managed and maintain integrity throughout
PepsiCo’s systems
Leverage data as a strategic enterprise asset enabling data-based decision analytics
Improve productivity and efficiency of daily business operations

Position Overview:

The Data Quality Manager role is responsible for working with PepsiCo sectors and functions to implement and manage platform-based support as the Data Quality platform (Informatica IDQ) gets rolled out across the PepsiCo enterprise. This role requires deep knowledge of Informatica technologies for Data Quality operationalization. This role will be deployed to work with various programs and sectors within PepsiCo to ensure data related requirements are in adherence to the global data governance policies & standards set by Global Data Governance. This role will lead the development of business and technical requirement documents, conduct user acceptance testing, and provide postproduction support. This role will act as a senior member of the global data quality function to operationalize and provide solutions for deployment of the data quality technology platform to manage and govern PepsiCo’s core data as per established global standards. The role will be responsible for providing detailed guidance on running data analysis, data profiling, data validation, data cleansing, data standardization, data quality scorecards, integrating sources for running quality checks as well as developing scripts to perform data analysis on the platform as required.

The Data Quality Manager will work closely with Data Domain Stewards, Data Governance and the broader Data + Analytics team to ensure any technical solution related best practices and guidance is available as programs with focus on data are being rolled out as per the established program charter. The Manager will also be expected to guide a team of data quality analysts and consultant resources to ensure project deliverables are completed and participate in the overall configuration of our global data quality platform.

Primary Accountabilities:
Manage data quality technical rollouts to program teams from a platform usage & functional coverage standpoint.
Lead DQ projects as a Lead SME to deliver core DQ objectives as per defined DQ framework.
Manage a team of internal and external data quality resources and ensure deliverables are met.
Lead informational training sessions to walkthrough core use cases covered by the applications.
Create functional use cases on the platform and develop standards of maintaining DQ rules in the platform.
Provide design guidance IDQ mapplets and rules for deploying data quality validation checks and bring up scorecards
Manage integrations between Axon and IDQ applications to display integrated rules/scores on Axon
Provide expertise in all aspects of data quality including profiling, validation, standardization, error handling and data cleansing using IDQ (v10.x)
Ensure data models, data architecture, data mapping and data dictionary are being used to develop IDQ rules as applicable
Assess and recommend IDQ design for individual project tracks
Perform Data Analysis using IDQ as applicable
Share Enterprise Logical (executable) DQ rules in the form of Mapplets and use CDO’s & LDO’s to run data analysis
Implement DQ Scorecards for data validation across chosen dimensions of DQ
Run validation checks and help in formulating dimensional comparisons
Work in collaboration with IT and Security teams standards & capabilities. Provide support on how data governance should address as part of platform maintenance.
Communicate regularly with program teams and stewards to make necessary design reviews on the platform as needed.
Share DQ technology best practices and performance optimization methods as applicable.
Provide best practice for designing DQ Dashboards using Power BI or Tableau.
Enterprise Data Quality Operations and Advisory:
Ensure alignment of the data quality project and standards with applicable enterprise, business segment, and local data support models.
Support the maintenance of enterprise-level data standards in the platform along with a repository of key elements pertaining to their in-scope data domain (e.g external data) and promoting their use throughout the PepsiCo organization.
Perform DQ design reviews on various projects to ensure that any data related changes are aligned to the platform as well as managed to ensure adherence with the Enterprise Data Quality & Governance established standards.
COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law
Qualifications/Requirements
10+ years of experience working with enterprise Data Quality solutions
7+ years of experience working with Informatica Products (Data Quality, Data Catalog, Axon, MDM)
10+ years of experience within Data Management, Data Governance or related field
Has been part of a full cycle implementation project using Informatica suite
Has hands on experience with APIs, developing LDOs/CDOs, Scripting Mapplets for DQ transformations and rules, error handling workflows in DQ.
Proficient with advanced SQL scripting and ETL transformation logic on the Informatica suite of applications
Good understanding of reporting applications and integrations between Data quality and reporting applications
Strong techno- functional background with ability to understand data quality management and its application to maintaining consistent quality of data across the enterprise for compliance and reporting requirements.
Knowledge of enterprise data architecture with modern applications (Informatica)
Ability to partner with a multi-tiered and matrixed organization model to support complex data programs.
Competencies:
Ability to understand and design platform rollouts for data quality operationalization
Strong grasp of DQ design and understanding of modern data architecture as it applies to data quality rollouts.
Strong Communication Skills/Able to Persuade/Influence Others at all organization Levels and the ability foster lasting partnerships
Ability to translate functional requirements into technical use cases and requirements.
Ability to think beyond the current state (processes, roles and tools) and work towards an unconstrained, optimized design
An ability to solicit followership from the functional teams to think beyond the ‘way the things work today’
Able to align various stakeholders to a common set of standards and the ability to sell the benefits of the EDG program
Self-starter who welcomes responsibility, along with the ability to thrive in an evolving organization and an ability to bring structure to unstructured situations
Matrix management skills and business acumen
Familiarity with enterprise system architecture and ability to provide guidance on design of enterprise data quality solutions.
Excellent communication skills and demonstrated experience in understanding and presenting complex quantitative analyses to business partners and senior management
Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation
Job Type: Regular

Job Description
Academic Success Manager
Role Overview:
Every student who joins one of Thinkful’s programs should graduate and find a job in their chosen field. Each student makes a serious commitment and life choice by joining this program. As Academic Success Manager, you’ll act as an advisor and motivator for your students. You’ll engage students to set expectations, evaluate their progress throughout the program, hold students accountable to their goals, and resolve any issues they may encounter on their way to graduation. Ultimately, your success is measured by your students’ progress, retention, and satisfaction while at Thinkful.
Responsibilities
Manage a caseload of students and guide them through their program from orientation through graduation
Drive student success by providing motivational support, resolving conflicts, enhancing interpersonal skills, and gauging overall satisfaction and needs
Use dashboards and student progress and retention data to strategically identify students requiring the most support from a large roster of active students
Evaluate and support student progress and resolve issues that impact their success
Recommend, build, and implement product innovations to improve the student experience and team efficiency
Work with technical and non-technical student-facing teams to ensure a smooth program experience for students
Requirements
Genuinely excited about supporting students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
Excellent written and verbal communication
Enthusiastic and driven self-starter
Developed sense of empathy and understanding
Experienced with listening, providing valuable feedback to others, and motivating others to action
Creativity and flexibility in day to day problem solving
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Understanding of pedagogy; teaching or counseling experience is a plus
Prior experience in, or a keen interest in learning about, what we teach
This position can be based anywhere in the United States. The pay range for this position is $57,200-$97,760. The actual pay will vary based on professional experience, job type, hiring location, course type and other factors.
In addition, Chegg offers medical, dental, vision, life and supplemental life insurance, short-and long-term disability, mental health support, parental leave, paid time off, volunteer time off, paid holidays, 401(k) with matching, Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, an Employee Referral Program, Tuition Reimbursement, and a variety of perks designed to meet employees where they are.
#LI-Remote

Why do we exist?
Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called State of the Student shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we’ve expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher educational learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, Chegg Writing, Chegg Internships, Thinkful Online Learning, and more to support students beyond their college experience. These offerings lower financial concerns for students by modernizing their learning experience. We exist so students everywhere have a smarter, faster, more affordable way to student.

Role: Manager of New Counselor Success
Reports to: Director of Volunteer Experience
Location: Remote
Hours: Full Time
About Trevor
The Trevor Project is the world’s largest suicide prevention and crisis intervention organization for LGBTQ young people. We are a non-profit that provides 24/7 life-saving support via phone, text, and chat. We also operate the world’s largest safe space social networking site for LGBTQ youth and run innovative research, education, and advocacy programs. We’ve been saving lives every day for over 20 years.
Overview of the role
The Manager of New Counselor Success is a key role ensuring our new digital volunteer counselors serving LGBTQ youth in crisis on our chat and text platform are able to be successful within and beyond their first 90 days. This role will oversee the first 90 days of the volunteer counselor journey to ensure that digital volunteer counselor retention remains high and that they are best set up to support LGBTQ youth in need. The goals of this role include implementing a smooth volunteer experience from training to direct service and developing skills in our volunteer counselors for things such as the ability to support more than one youth at a time. The Manager of New Counselor Success will use skills related to marketing, community management, training and volunteer support to assess and address the needs of our new volunteers so they can provide the highest quality of care to LGBTQ youth reaching out to The Trevor Project.
Who you are
Operations aficionado. You’re not fazed by complex operations with interdependent parts. You have demonstrated success running efficient and effective operations.Experience in call center operations a plus.
People person. You love working with people and know how to excite them about our life-saving work. You understand the importance of volunteers and place a premium on customer service.
Innovative. You look at the way things are and then imagine 20 ways they can be improved. You’re always thinking about best practices in training and trends in tech to figure out how we can leverage these tools.
Results- and data-oriented. You are driven by results and informed by data. You operate with urgency and efficiency. You know how to identify problems and create informed and comprehensive strategies to make progress and get results.
Tech savvy. You have significant experience working with technology and have an innovation-first mindset. You know how to work with both tech and product teams to achieve world-class results.
Role model and leader. You are a dedicated mentor and compassionate leader for your staff and colleagues alike. You have experience managing people and tasks (including remotely) and can inspire others to do their best work.
Clear communicator. You can communicate clearly and concisely. You’re great at getting and giving respectful and productive feedback to the people working with you.
Highly organized. You know how to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately. You create clear and logical systems and processes to support your work and that of the organization.
Collaborative. You understand that the best way to meet and exceed goals is through outstanding teamwork.
Passionate. You care about LGBTQ youth. You care about saving lives. You want to come to work and feel inspired every day. You want to change the world.
Fun. The work we do is serious but that doesn’t mean we don’t have fun. We know how to have a good time and you should too.
What you’ll do
Own the volunteer experience from the end of training, through graduation, to the first three months as a volunteer counselor; this includes developing and innovating on systems for onboarding and training and ensuring volunteer counselors have the resources they need to get the most out of their experience
Oversee and build a team that will work to develop and scale the training and onboarding processes for new counselors
Implement strategies to support our volunteer counselors in adopting best practices in multichat (taking more than one chat at a time)and in our support model, including leading group webinars and volunteer office hours to educate volunteer counselors on how to best use our platform
Provide data to volunteer counselors regarding trends at large and relating to our services (wait times, for example) in order to ensure that counselors are informed and are as effective as possible in counseling youth
Identify opportunities for process and product improvements
Leverage technology to proactively engage with volunteer counselors at scale (Salesforce, Humanity, etc)
Ensure that the user experience for LGBTQ youth is consistent, high-quality, effective, and efficient
As needed, cover responsibilities within crisis services, such as serving as the on-call consult, directly supervising shifts, supporting additional counselor training, etc.
Serve as a main point of contact with other teams, including serving as the primary partner with the technology team and working directly with the training team to discuss trends and implications for counselor training
Benefits
Generous vacation and holidays (like a full day off to celebrate Harvey Milk Day!), including three half-day Fridays during the summer
Comprehensive health insurance (we pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental, and life), including gender affirmation surgery
Flexibility to work from anywhere in the U.S. (we provide the technology, a monthly internet stipend and reimbursement to outfit your work-from-home space!)
Fun virtual office environment and passionate team
Online Subscription to Headspace, a digital meditation platform
Meaningful work at an organization that is saving the lives of LGBTQ young people across America every day
The Trevor Project is an equal opportunity employer
Your Application
We’re excited to hear from you! To join Team Trevor, please upload a resume and cover letter. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. Use this as an opportunity to convey why you want to be the next Manager of New Counselor Success at The Trevor Project!

POSITION SUMMARY

United Way of the Midlands serves as the lead administrative agency for the local homeless Continuum of Care (CoC) and operates the CoC’s electronic client management database called the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS). HMIS is an internet-based database to track housing and service usage of homeless and at-risk populations. UWM’s HMIS team provides service organizations, nonprofits, and government agencies with support and technical assistance through data collection, reporting, and analysis. The CoC’s HMIS utilizes WellSky’s ServicePoint and currently supports over 130 users from over 40 different agencies ending homelessness in the central Midlands of South Carolina. The Data Specialist position supports data analysis, data quality training and monitoring, and development of research reports in partnership with UWM’s Senior Director of Data and Research. Some daytime travel will be required to provide on-site assistance. The position is in-office based in Columbia, South Carolina. Remotely only is not a consideration due to the team working environment.
Responsibilities

Reporting Support

Produces canned and custom reporting, analysis of agency and client data, submission of federal reports including the Lingitudinal Systmes Analysis to Congress (LSA), Point-In-Time Count data extracts, and System Performance Measures.
Analyze data at the agency, local, and state level to improve qualifty and identify gaps and trends in service needs.

Homeless Continuum Support

Contributes to the annual HUD Continuum of Care application.
Attends statewide HMIS Committee representing Midlands CoC.
Responsible for managing statewide vendor contract and coordinating with other South Carolina CoCs.
Assist with federal grantee monitoring.
Operating HMIS in accordance with requirements related to privacy, security, and data standards.
Interface with software vendor on application issues and questions.
Test and implement new software features as released by vendor.

Training Support

Perform HMIS system administration tasks associated with program set up, user profile maintenance, and assessment maintenance.
Works closely with HMIS Manager to regularyly review system data quality and identifying training needs among system users.
Support of CoC committee volunteers by scheduling meetings, documenting meeting minutes, and developing agendas.
Research policies and procedures relating to HMIS reporting and analysis best practices.
Manages the HMIS database reporting functions and data analysis.

REQUIRED AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Required

Bachelor’s degree or relevant education and experience in related field.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication (oral and written) skills.
Background working with databases and large data sets.
Advanced skills in Excel and MS Office family of products and ability to quickly learn databases and build queries.
Candidates must consistently demonstrate the ability to work independently as a member of an impact team.
Ability to prioritize projects and manage time effectively.
Ability to develop positive interpersonal and working relationships with various publics, including, volunteer networks, UWM staff, human services organizations, schools, faith- based organizations, funders and supporters.
Database analysis skills including demonstrated ability to write reports and build queries.

Preferred

Research and data analysis experience.
Experience with application development
Experience with SQL, Visual C++ and/or Visual Basic, Crystal Reports and Business Objects or ability to learn over time.

Job Posting Title:
Call Center Agent (Remote Work / Flexible Hours)
Position Type:
Visitor
Department:
LSUAM MC - Operations (Michael A Climek (00008244))
Work Location:
LSU - Baton Rouge
Pay Grade:
Job Description:
This is a remote work job. You will perform this job entirely off-site at your home.
This job posting is for an out-bound call center. We do not receive any incoming calls.
We offer extremely flexible schedules, you tell us what hours work for you, and that is what you will work. We want to fit your life.
The position involves interviewing people via telephone and accurately entering responses into a computer-based data collection system. The questions typically involve a variety of business, health, political and economic issues. This job is relatively low stress, as it requires sitting, dialing phone numbers, data entry, and interacting with people on the phone.
Home Requirements for this job include:
A relatively up-to-date home computer
A strong Ethernet/broadband internet connection at home
A headset w/ microphone that connects to your home computer
A quiet homework environment with minimal interruptions
Personal Requirements for this job include:
Basic computer knowledge
Basic typing skills
Must have acceptable reading and pronunciation skills
Must be friendly, outgoing and have a conversational tone of voice
You must have a clear speaking voice and be able to communicate well over the phone
Must be able to follow set procedures including the ability to read scripts verbatim
Must have some previous retail or customer service experience
All applicants must include a resume.
The hours available are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday 4pm-9pm, Saturdays & Sundays 10am to 9pm.
You do not have to work every day listed above, or every hour listed above, but the minimum shift length is 3 hours. As a reminder, the job pays $10.00/hr. You can work as little as you want as long as your shift length is at least 3 hours.
The position requires a minimum commitment of at least 3 hours per week, with a maximum of no more than 25 hours per week.
Again, this job is performed offsite.
This job is NOT for LSU students.
We are looking to hire 15 strong applicants into this role.
The pay rate for this position is $10.00 an hour.

At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. Because of that we’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and talent. Our culture was purpose-built to be remote first, and we offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. If you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology with a team that makes a difference every day, let’s talk.
About the Role:
CrowdStrike is looking for a seasoned Sr. Events Manager to join our fast growing team and company. The primary focus of this role is to plan, manage, recommend, collaborate, and coordinate between stakeholders to deliver experiential events whether virtual, physical, or hybrid. You will interface with the broader marketing, product, and internal support teams to ensure both our external and internal events reflect our company’s strategy and vision. This role will also build relationships and collaborate with marketing managers, product managers, solutions architects, and business developers to help create unique content showcases for events. The Sr. Events Manager plays a critical role in bringing our brand and messaging to life through engaging and memorable events that ultimately drive demand and sales pipeline. The ideal candidate brings a proven track record of flawless event planning and execution, effective communication, and project management.
Additional Locations: REMOTE
What You’ll Need (5-7 maximum bullet points):
10+ years corporate event planning and tradeshow experience, preferably at a SaaS-based B2B technology company
Skilled negotiator and ability to foster consultative relationships to achieve results
Ability to assertively project manage teams and hold team members accountable for deliverables.
Extensive knowledge in managing events from conception to completion, including digital event platforms, complex logistics, venue liaison, production, speaker sourcing, budget management and onsite execution
Demonstrates strong critical thinking skills and ability to problem solve and come up with solutions and recommendations.
Collaborate, consult and influence leaders and stakeholders within the function, across functions and outside of the organization.
Analyzes data and provides insights as a result for future executions to ensure we are optimizing our event marketing investments and aligning our event strategy to our campaigns and business objectives.
Effective budget management and budget reconciliation.
Exceptional project management, and time management skills – highly organized, detail focused, results-driven, and accountable with the ability to handle high pressure last-minute, urgent requests
Demonstrate strong understanding of various digital and virtual event technologies and applicability to different programs.
Bonus Points (3-5 maximum bullet points):
Exceptional communication skills, including strong verbal and Powerpoint skills, ability to present at all levels of the organization
Define and execute internal and external event awareness and communication plans and associated deliverables. Including but not limited to email invitations, web pages, direct mail, social media, PR, and webinars.
Strong attention to detail, excellent customer service and creativity in problem-solving
Evaluate event performance, including post event analysis, de-briefs and wrap-up reports

Remote-friendly culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan

Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Job Function)

The manager, data services is responsible for database services and related middleware, including planning, installation, performance tuning, architecture design, testing, documentation, operations support/programming, and administration.

Typical Duties
Effectively manage and administer production database backup recovery and availability. Provide application support, ensure acceptable performance, availability, reliability, and prevent data loss. Maintain security compliance on databases and controls to for privacy and to prevent data misuse. Respond to alerts according to documented standard operating procedures. Ensure production service levels for online and batch processing are maintained by defining and adhering to operational metrics on systems, database and network performance. (20%)
Manages the operation of the mainframe data center on a 24 x 7 basis in a highly reliable manner. Administer DB2, Oracle and SQL Server databases for reliable, optimized performance. Administer Oracle Identity and Access Management, SQL Reporting, Oracle Web Center, Oracle E-Business Suites infrastructure services for reliable, optimized performance. Provide a method of recovering services after a disaster in the platform data centers and test the plan annually. (10%)
Build and maintain IT operations monitoring standard operating procedures to effectively manage and mitigate operational events. Ensure the use of the documented procedures. (5%)
Research and develop strategic plans for Information Technology. Focus on technology direction whose implementations are achievable in the next 18 to 60 months. (5%)
Manages the database systems and ensure conformance to performance optimization and interoperability standards and requirements. Ensure adherence to secure development lifecycle practices and policies. (5%)
Perform project planning, system analysis, database design and coding, testing, documentation, implementation and research activities as necessary in support of software engineering projects. (5%)
Manages staff in research and fact-finding to develop or modify application programs. Includes negotiating with vendors to review quality, adaptability and compatibility of their products and levels of service they provide to the company. (5%)
Communicates clearly with senior management and business units to assure that information systems and technologies; manages the systems and technology development priorities. (5%)
Develops and maintains ongoing relationships with hardware, software, consulting and employee resource vendors to ensure that the company’s systems support. (5%)
Performs administrative activities necessary for the effective management of the department, including employee safety, selection and development of employees, pay administration, budget administration, employee counseling and motivation, organization goals and objectives and planning, organizing, integrating, measuring and reporting the work performed within the department. (5%)
Manage and monitor the IT emergency action plan (ITEAP), including activation, call outs and documenting events in the IT incident management system. Maintain the documented ITEAP. (5%)
Perform any additional responsibilities as requested or assigned. (5%)

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in management information systems (MIS), computer science, related technical field, or equivalent work experience. (Typically, six years of related, progressive work experience required for candidates applying for this position who do not possess a bachelor's degree.)
A minimum of eight years of experience combined in database, recovery, availability, software application design, development, integration and/or installation and systems programming, including three years in supervisory/management responsibilities.
Expert knowledge of programming, integration and application security models, proficiency with a variety of software development tools. Experience in the industry, or in an environment whose scope, size and complexity are comparable.
Expert knowledge of Oracle’s data relationship management and Oracle Exadata technologies, Oracle Fusion Middleware server enterprise edition, database, network software, storage systems and disaster recovery practices.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, Reporting, and related software; extensive technical knowledge of complex of database, replication, management related software, and disaster recovery practices.
Experience in effectively managing cross-functional teams, influencing key stakeholders, across the organization and within complex contexts.
Demonstrated experience in establishing standard processes and managing performance to achieve key metrics Proven experience or demonstrated capability in leading IT operations teams in complex and dynamic environments requiring 24/7 support.
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently.
Business analysis aptitude including communications and interpersonal skills; enabling an understanding of client’s needs. Knowledge of information technology terms, equipment, systems, functions and major vendors.
Experience integrating large, disconnected enterprise-class systems in a robust, fault-tolerant manner consistent with industry standards.
Expert understanding of deployment topologies (i.e. ensuring secure, highly available systems).
Effective oral and written communication skills. Effective analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Availability for periodic on-call responsibilities.
Preferences
Experience integrating Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) solutions within an environment with strong change and release management processes and procedures.
Technical knowledge of Oracle Database and Oracle Fusion Middleware, and Microsoft SQL database administration technologies.
Technical knowledge of Oracle Identity and Access Management, Enterprise Manager, and Idera event and compliance administration technologies.
