Manager, Data & Analytics
Job Description
WaveMark is a scalable, enterprise-level, Software as a Service (SaaS) platform that provides healthcare customers with supply chain visibility and control using proprietary software technology, along with a portfolio of advanced data capture solutions to manage all supplies from low-cost commodity supplies to high-cost devices, implants, and tissue. This allows us to streamline workflows and deliver actionable insights that support the delivery of cost-effective care within the healthcare environment.

The Manager, Data & Analytics will be embedded within our customer’s Oklahoma City area supply chain team performing a variety of analyses in response to specific business questions. This person then communicates those findings, including methodology and outcomes back to key business leaders within the customer.

Primary Responsibilities
Support and develop relationships with key supply chain stakeholders: listen, understand, and articulate needs
Serve as a subject matter expert on data and analytics to support the customers supply chain team with data, business intelligence applications, and commercial analytics solutions
Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business
Partner with internal team members on cross functional data analysis to ensure a high level of key stakeholder satisfaction through successful execution of projects and use of applications and data
Predict emerging client analytics needs and participate in the development of innovative solutions to meet those needs
Prepare reports for customer executives, leaders, and managers that effectively communicate actionable trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Required Qualifications
A Covid-19 vaccination is required to be employed in this position. This includes either:
2 doses of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine
1 dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine
Bachelor's degree with 5+ years of analytics experience (or graduate degree with at least 3 years),
3+ years of experience supporting client engagements or large projects for internal/external customers, preferably in the healthcare industry.
Experience in data analysis and visualization with tools such as Power BI
Experience in data-driven predictive model development
Demonstrated ability to coordinate, integrate and deliver informatics and business intelligence projects
Ability to derive insight and infer business implications from data
Possess strong work ethic, self-motivated and able to operate independently with limited direct supervision, while also comfortable working with a multi-disciplinary team
Strong planning, analytical, collaboration and communication skills
Must be local to the Oklahoma City area; work time will be spent on-site in customer offices
Preferred Qualifications
Understanding issues related to data analysis in healthcare industry
Demonstrate knowledge of hospital supply chain processes and clinical workflows
Ability to complete project, with demonstrated commitment and ability to meeting deliverables
Ability to prioritize among multiple tasks and self-manage
Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

How you’ll make a difference:
In this Data Analyst role, you’ll partner with our Merchandising team to analyze product and segment trends, increasing the value of our product mix and offerings. You’ll also support ad-hoc analysis across multiple business areas, including site, marketing, sales, stores and fundraising.
This role will work with the rest of the Analytics team to help various parts of Custom Ink gain more insight from the data we have about our customers.
The projects we take on span across the whole company. Recent example projects include:
Reviewing and updating our pricing model, taking into account supply chain changes and competitor landscape
Analyzing product and segment trends across sales channels to optimize our value proposition for customers
Understanding product margins combined with customer potential future value to make recommendations on discounting
You will need to show an understanding of SQL databases and have completed some analytics projects in your current role. This role will report to our Manager of Data Analytics.
What you’ll do:
Develop a partnership with Merchandising to understand their needs and provide valuable reporting and insights to help them achieve success with our product offerings
Understand business objectives behind requests and make recommendations to improve their impact
Take learnings from other parts of the business back to the Merchandising team to help contextualize the team’s data
Share product and segment insights with other analysts and business areas to facilitate coordination and optimize impact
Stay connected to analysis for all business areas to provide support on a variety of projects as needed
Perform exploratory analysis that results in meaningful insights and recommendations for a broad range of subjects
Demonstrate strong collaboration and analytical business thinking
Bring consistency to metrics used throughout the organization
How you’ll be measured:
Quality of analysis, insights, recommendations & impact
Strength of relationships with other leaders and analysts
Elevation of related Analytics capabilities
What we’re looking for:
Academic success in an analytically challenging field, such as math, physics, computer science, or economics
3-5 years solving business problems through qualitative & quantitative research, statistical analysis & modeling and strategic planning
Experience performing analysis on large and often incomplete data sets and translating results for consumption by business partners
Expert in Excel
Strong skills in SQL
Previous skills with Tableau, SAS, SPSS or R desired
Demonstrated use of machine learning techniques for business problems
Excellence in statistics, data and analytics, predictive modeling & hypothesis testing
Experience with Salesforce or other CRM platforms a plus
Detail oriented - As you would expect, our work often relies on getting many details correct in order to build an accurate view of the bigger picture
Strong communication skills - Strong analysis is a great starting point, but we are also looking for someone who can help connect business partners with the summary and implications of that analysis work.
Empathy for how data can shape how Merchandising teams are working and the ability to determine technology and data needs from business requirements
Agility - ability to juggle multiple ongoing projects and work both collaboratively and autonomously at times
Please submit a letter of interest with your application.
CustomInk, LLC (""Custom Ink"") is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity in all forms and are committed to maintaining a discrimination-free workplace that treats applicants and employees with dignity and respect. Our employment process is conducted without regard to race, color, religion, nationality or ethnic background, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other attributes protected by state, federal, and local law.

Job summary
We are looking for a Professional Services Data & Analytics Senior Practice Manager for our Americas Data & Analytics Delivery Practice, to join as a leader on the East region team. Location flexible as long as you are able to travel to major metropolitan hubs in the East region of the US. Preference given to being located in the following locations: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Virginia, Florida, etc.

Are you interested in working with the largest organizations in the world as they navigate through some of the most dynamic and disruptive digital transformation projects in their organization's history? Does the prospect of helping these organizations go digital through the adoption of cloud-based Data Analytics and Machine Learning solutions excite you? Can you lead world-class teams of Data Engineers and Data Architects that drive breakthrough business outcomes?

We are seeking an action-oriented visionary who is craving to be part of a great company in a fast-growing industry. We need someone that will thrive in a fast-paced environment in our AWS Americas Data Analytics Professional Services Practice. You will lead a team of AWS Data Analytics consultants and collaborate with our Service teams and local Partners to deliver business value to our customers.

The role requires both a deep Customer Obsession and Deliver Results mentality. You will also work closely with your Professional Services colleagues in Data Science, High-Performance Computing, and Internet of Things (IoT) to provide more comprehensive data-enabled solutions. You will collaborate with our AWS Sales, Business Development, Solutions Architect, Training and Service teams to help customers deploy our current solutions and provide input into new features and functionality.
This is a customer facing, consulting leadership role. You will be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed. Estimated travel of 50%.

Key job responsibilities
They will lead a team of highly technical, customer facing consultants, and will act as a people manager, mentor, guide, counselor, advocate and more...Periodically, they will be involved in managing. customer escalations or opportunity/delivery quality reviews working closely with the ProServe sales team, collaborating with the D&A Global Specialty Practice (GSP) to create close loop feedback from the field (shared delivery team) and assisting GSP in enhancing / creating new service offerings. They will be running various initiatives to optimize operational efficiencies, hiring mechanisms, training programs for the practitioners, etc. We expect a DPM to manage 17-22 resources (Data Architects – Data Lakes, Data Architects – DW/MPP, Data/ML Engineers. At times, they will be facing the customers to guide the team and provide delivery quality oversight on a part-time basis.

This role is comprised of three main "pillars", namely "People and Practice Leadership", "Delivery Oversight", and "Customer Relationships". The candidate should have some experience with all three. This role requires managing a team of practitioners who are working on different customer engagements (programs) in parallel, so there are multiple stakeholders. This is different than managing a large program at a time with one key stakeholder.

About the team

Enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment fast paced environment.
Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge
Strong organizational and project management skills with an ability to manage numerous, competing demands from internal and external stakeholders and Customers.
Masters or PhD in Computer Science or Business Administration
Ability to lead enterprise data strategies including data lake delivery
Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of best practices, packaged offering, white papers, workshops, etc.
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner or AWS Certified Big Data Specialty is a plus
Leader of leader experience (2nd line manager)
Industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing, or data sciences.
Extensive hands-on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle data lake projects
Extensive hands-on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects.
Prior hands-on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development.
Experience with SQL and scripting (bash, perl or python) ability.
Implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments.
Knowledge of Cloud Computing, AWS services such as VPC, EC2, S3, EMR, and Redshift.
Previous Big-Four consulting experience in Data & Analytics as a Practice Manager is a plus

PROGRAM MANAGER, INNOVATION AND IMPACT at Energy FoundationAny EF office or Remote within United StatesABOUT ENERGY FOUNDATIONEnergy Foundation’s (EF) mission is to secure a clean and equitable energy future to tackle the climate crisis. We envision a healthy, safe, equitable economy powered by clean energy. We believe a thriving clean energy economy can create sustainable opportunities, spur innovation, and protect our climate—for today and future generations.EF supports education and analysis to promote non-partisan policy solutions that advance renewable energy and energy efficiency while opening doors to greater innovation and productivity—growing the economy with dramatically less pollution. For more than 25 years, Energy Foundation has supported grantees to help educate policymakers and the general public about the benefits of a clean energy economy. Our grantees include business, health, environmental, labor, equity, community, faith, and consumer groups, as well as policy experts, think tanks, universities, and more.EF is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, and our more than 70 staff members are based in locations throughout the Midwest, Northeast, Southeast, and Western regions where they can best serve our programs, partners, operations, and other functions.POSITION SUMMARYThe Program Manager, Innovation and Impact (“Manager”), supports EF’s Program team to drive innovation in our granting and to better assess the impact of our policy work. The Manager will help to lead EF’s Innovation Fund (“Fund”), which allows foundation staff to propose new strategies and projects to increase equity and reduce carbon pollution. The Manager will also lead efforts to develop ways to measure the impact of our policy work across the U.S. and in specific state and regional campaigns, and to better communicate that impact, with particular attention paid to assessing our work to drive equitable outcomes. Finally, the Manager will understand the analytic needs of our Program team and will manage a variety of consultant contracts to facilitate meeting these needs. We are looking for candidates with strong quantitative analysis skills who also are able to analyze qualitative impacts and effectively craft a narrative to communicate their findings.RESPONSIBILITIESThe Manager's responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:Manage Innovation FundDevelop and manage an annual calendar for the Fund, working with Program projects to ensure coordination.Coordinate a small-group steering committee to review and evaluate proposals and then participate with funders in the ultimate award choice.Manage project selection process and timely, transparent communication back to the EF team.Coordinate learning opportunities for both EF and funding partners about lessons learned through the Fund, to ensure continuous learning.Align work with EF’s Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion team to ensure consistency in approach and Fund alignment with EF’s mission, vision, values.Engage relevant Strategic Partnerships team members around key milestones and challenges as they relate to the core funder of the Fund, as well as potential engagement of other fundersMeasurement and ImpactLead efforts to assess, measure, and communicate the impact of our policy workLead effort to integrate equity metrics to EF’s policy blueprint that outlines the 2030 policy goals of the foundation.Lead efforts to represent the foundation’s policy work in strategic planning and annual planning inputs.Solicit regular updates from team on recent policy wins and develop plan to communicate.Develop analytical resources to measure impact of policy gains in terms of emissions, jobs, and market impact.Solicit regular updates on lessons learned and help to coordinate learning agenda for members of the Program teamDevelop assessment tools for the networks Energy Foundation convenes to measure and communicate the impact of this work.Manage Analytic ConsultantsAssess the analytic needs of the Program team and work with team members to identify consultants who can meet these needs.Manage consultant contracts and work with them to fill analytic needs of the team.Build the TeamGenerate and implement ideas for systems, program, and operational improvement.Maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues. Contribute to a positive working environment.With assistance from the supervisor and others, formulate your own learning and development plan. Identify and seek out professional development opportunities, including networking, informational interviews, training, projects, etc.Recognize that we are stronger when we are diverse and inclusive, and embody these values in internal and external EF work.QUALIFICATIONSFamiliarity with clean energy and climate policy issues.Superior analytical skills, including spreadsheet models and ability to synthesize data from multiple technical and modeling sources.Experience in supporting multiple priorities and juggling a variety of tasks for one or more individuals in a team environment.Strong writing and speaking skills. Able to present complex information in a meaningful way to a variety of audiences.Ability to develop and facilitate strategy across a network of internal and external partners.Demonstrated mid-level experience in project management, preferably in a complex, multi-site, and multicultural organization.Experience participating in or leading Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiatives. A demonstrated commitment to contributing meaningfully to a workplace where equity and inclusion are core values in our internal and external EF work.Ability to convene and steward funding partners.Solutions-oriented, collaborative problem-solver who is committed to working collaboratively in a diverse, dynamic, and complex environment with a combination of local, regional, and national staff and partners.Curious and inquisitive, with excellent relationship-building and trust-building skills working with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.SUPERVISIONReports to the Vice President, National Program, and is a member of the Program team.COMPENSATIONThis is a full-time position. Job summary
“What isn’t measured cannot be improved.” The Operations Technology IT Support’s Operational Excellence (OE) team is looking for an experienced IT Program Manager to ensure end-to-end management and completion of national or global technology operational excellence initiatives to the highest possible standards using data, metrics, process and continual improvement methodologies at large scales.

Operations Technology IT is a large and growing organization providing support to internal customers and IT infrastructure. This is all made possible through collaboration with a wide variety of technology teams from all over the world, and a complex, ever-changing set of platform technologies and IT support channels. If you are a strong communicator with wide array of technology, process improvement and service management experience, we look forward to talking with you!

Key job responsibilities
The OpsTechIT support Operational Excellence team is seeking a highly skilled program manager who will help drive the team toward our mission of being the best IT support organization in the world. The ideal candidate has experience in leading large scale projects/programs from initiation through delivery in a technology organization/role. As a program manager for OpsTechIT, you will lead projects focused on the delivery of operational excellence aimed at making us the best IT support organization in the world. The primary responsibilities of the successful candidate include, but are not limited to, the following:


Gathering business requirements
Document functional and design specifications
Identify appropriate resources needed
Assemble the right project team in a matrix environment
Assign individual responsibilities
Develop the milestones and launch schedule to ensure timely and successful delivery of the project.

A day in the life
Program Managers blend a mix of business and technical skills, assess and manage risks, measure and report on progress, anticipate and resolve bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make trade-offs, and balance the business needs with the technical constraints. The successful candidate will rely heavily on influence versus authority to drive project deliverables.


MBA or equivalent degree
Utilize knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma to lead cross-functional process improvement projects
Ability to direct, monitor and escalate work assignments towards goals and timelines.
Create and sustain new operational processes through designing and implementation of pilots or experiments.
Build financial models and analysis to assess operational impact of project(s).
This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, organization, and communication skills. Candidates should have experience defining projects, collecting requirements, writing detailed functional specifications, coordinating efforts to scope, schedule, and deploy new features sets; as well as analyzing cost/benefit of feature selection.
The successful candidate will have a customer focus, a diverse work experience, and a business curiosity/strategic viewpoint. The candidate will have an attention to detail, excellent analytical skills, good judgment, strong oral and written communication skills, and the ability to self-start and self-motivate.
The successful candidate will demonstrate an ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously whilst being comfortable with ambiguity and having an ability to be flexible in a rapidly changing environment.
It is critical that the candidate has a proven track record of earning trust, taking ownership, and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Job Summary:

Attending and participating in sponsor meetings
Managing all data management deliverables for assigned studies
Prepare tracking reports and metrics
Develops the Data Management Plan

Company Description

Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands - Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you'll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.

Job Description
 What’s the role?
The Research Operations team at Etsy is looking for a Research Coordinator to join our growing team and support several key areas to help us scale the impact of research.
What’s this team like at Etsy?
The Research team helps inspire product and business decisions, using data to improve the experiences of current and prospective Etsy customers. We advocate a user-centered approach to design in partnership with designers, product, and marketing teams across Etsy. Our research obsesses over understanding who we’re designing for, and how Etsy fits into their lives.
As our team grows, we’re looking for a Research Coordinator to join our small but mighty Research Operations team to further support our culture of continuous learning. In this role, you’ll own logistics for both our Product and Market research teams, and recruiting and maintaining a healthy pipeline of participants for a variety of research studies. Put simply, you’ll keep the train rolling, and we can’t imagine how we’d do it without you.
As a Research Coordinator, you’ll support the team throughout the research lifecycle from end-to-end recruiting, screening, and scheduling efforts to streamlining research operations and team communications. You’ll manage relationships with existing external partners and vendors, and stay up to date on new industry tools and trends to vet and onboard new vendors or processes when needed.
This is a full-time position reporting to the Research Manager. This role requires your presence in Etsy’s Brooklyn office in a flex capacity. Learn more about our Flex and Office-based work modes as well as vaccination policy here.
What does the day-to-day look like?
Coordinating the recruiting and screening of participants for research studies
Understanding recruit needs, and drafting and programming tailored screeners
Recruiting customers from our research participant database
Managing the A-Z of logistics to keep research projects on track, such as:
Owning schedules and communications with researchers and partner teams
Coordinating day-of logistics for testing days
Tracking and managing research operational items (e.g. NDAs, gift cards, facilities requests)
Managing external partners and vendors
Collaborating closely with recruitment vendors to recruit prospective buyers and sellers
Identifying and vetting outside research partners, vendors, and tools for the team
Owning the internal procurement and approval process (working closely with legal and finance)
Handling tool licensing and renewals
Creating and updating resources
Crafting team documentation for a variety of topics ranging from team values to the recruiting process
Auditing team operations and processes to identify areas of improvement
Developing instructions and/or training materials for various tools and tasks
Keeping resources up-to-date
Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at Etsy's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.

Qualifications
Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:
Your natural curiosity, empathy, and eagerness to learn drive everything you do
Some might say you’re hyper-organized, detail-obsessed, and take pride in efficiency.
You're interested in identifying workflow inefficiencies, and optimizing or improving processes and operations. We’d love to learn from you about how to better our workflows and tools.
Familiarity with screener design and survey writing
Experience with or interest in learning:
Spreadsheet / Database software, such as Excel / Google Sheets (vlookups, pivot tables), SQL, etc
Survey software, such as Qualtrics, TypeForm, or SurveyMonkey
The ins-and-outs of contracts, procurement, and vendor management
Bonus: Experience running ongoing recruitment and using research tools; experience working with legal/risk teams on data governance (PII, GDPR)
Additional Information

What's Next

If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a coverletter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you'vehopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality andvariety. We don't want you to be like everyone else - we want you to belike you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.

About Fetch:

Fetch is a company of people taking care of people that is changing the way that packages are delivered to apartment residents. As a last-mile logistics company that serves the multifamily industry, Fetch is an innovative way to solve apartment community(s) package problems and creates a delivery experience worthy of excitement. Packages are sent to our local facilities and we coordinate secure, direct-to-door delivery at the resident's convenience. As a venture-backed startup, we're already operating in cities from coast to coast with exciting growth on the horizon.

Our Opportunity:

The "Productivity, Assessment and Logistics Enhancement Team" (PALET) is the central operations team for Fetch. PALET is a team of logistics professionals with excitement for development with the ultimate goal of improving fulfillment and delivery metrics, along with decreasing cost of Operations all while keeping to the Fetch core value of cultivating fans.

Fetch is looking for an Operations Manager to join PALET in developing best practice and process improvement for all facilities servicing our East region.

The Fetch Operations Team is the driving force of our strategy to bring apartment residents secure and convenient package delivery. We are looking for an individual with a pragmatic and common sense approach to make proper business judgments and get things done.

As a leader responsible for continuous improvement for a large region, you will work alongside a Director of Operations and Regional Safety Manager to strategize key elements around facility, supply, growth, process and engagement. You will travel from site to site regularly to perform audits, identify risks, and work with Operations Managers to solve big picture logistical challenges. PALET Operations Managers are pragmatic, project-based managers with a strong ability to influence others with problem solving and providing solutions that improve the service Fetch provides.


What you'll deliver on the job:

Perform site audits to measure quality of operations of a Fetch facility, and set action plans for improvements.
Work on projects related to creating mechanisms, improving compliance in standard operating procedures and standardization of best practices.
Assist with launches within the region for new market expansion, existing market growth and building to building transitions.
Work alongside human resources, marketing, customer service, account management, sales and other stakeholders when building solutions.
Procure and monitor supply expenditures for consumable and process-related materials.
Strategize fulfillment, dispatch and delivery improvements using lean principles, 5S and six sigma.
Provide support for ground operations of a Fetch facility when needed. This includes filling the role of administrative or management positions.


Does your experience check these boxes?

The will and drive to achieve, maintain and increase high standards.
5+ years of experience in a management position.
3+ years of experience in a position based on learning, development, launch or continuous improvement.
3+ years of managing or executing cross-functional projects with tight deadlines.
Experience in Kaizen, Six Sigma, Lean, 5S and other continuous improvement methodologies.
Flexibility to travel 25% of the year.
Comfort with project based softwares and platforms.
Comfort with data extraction, and with complex data. Familiarity with spreadsheet based applications in terms of advanced functions and macros.
Clear and concise with electronic and verbal communication.
High-level of commitment towards prioritized decision making.
Ability to thrive under pressure.
Multi-tasking skills.
Comfort within a fast-paced environment.


What we'll deliver on:

We understand life can get hectic, for that we offer flexible work schedules with the option to work remotely
Just like we value hard work, we also value a great work-life balance with unlimited PTO
We've got you covered with health and dental benefits
We want to keep time on your side, so we offer a 401k plan for employees


At Fetch, we are always looking for awesome people to join our growing team. If you think you're the right fit for this position, apply today. We'd love to hear from you!

Fetch is an equal opportunity employer, all applicants will be considered without discrimination on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, disabilities, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting
The preferred location for this position is Connecticut but other locations may be considered
(eligible for a remote work schedule)
The Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting manages professional level associates engaged in various levels of data and statistical analysis that includes compiling, manipulating, analyzing, and reporting of data. Typically data is used for both internal and external purposes. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:
Direct management of Data Analytics & Reporting staff including: hiring, providing guidance and direction, determining workload and delegating assignments, training, monitoring and evaluating performance, and initiating corrective or disciplinary actions.
Formulates data management strategies and solutions, engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational strategy.
Understand and manage data lifecycle from data acquisition, evaluation of data integrity, day to day maintenance and synthesis of data to satisfy contractual reporting requirements.
Demonstrates a track record of making difficult and impactful decisions to drive the business forward. Leads the development of a system-wide plan to ensure data is governed, shared, standardized, and analyzed for the key purpose of driving action and decision-making that promotes clinical and operational excellence.

Department specific responsibilities:
Management of staff includes developing the Data Analytics & Reporting staff into a cohesive team capable of timely service and product delivery by providing leadership, professional development, and cross-training. Includes direct collaboration and communication with other departmental leaders.
Works with internal and external stakeholders to design and maintain data to support programs; tracks, prioritizes and manages analytics implementation initiatives across teams; serves as contact and decision maker for analytics and reporting requests.
Presents and communicates data analytic results and procedures performed in a coherent and effective manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Knowledge of clinical documentation and language related to Medical and/or Behavioral Healthcare data elements; Including claims and pharmacy (NDC, ICD-10, HCPCS, CPT, RCC).
Demonstrated project management ability and experience (managing stakeholders, develop data or work flows, task prioritization, and resource allocation).
Ability to thrive and adapt in a fast-paced and rapidly growing environment managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Oversees and directs data collection and validation procedures, including the extraction, retrieval, analysis and transformation of data to facilitate reporting to address organizational data needs. This includes directing and/or providing guidance for team members during analysis, trouble shooting, data collection, and root cause analysis, so that the team can identify analytics solutions.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements
Requires BA/BS
5-7 years related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experience
Knowledge of programming languages, including SQL, required.
Experience with relational databases is required.
Healthcare data experience is required (claims, EHR, pharmacy).
Experience managing direct-report staff is required.
External client facing experience is required.
Decision making skills and experience leading projects required.
Excellent analytical skills and strong oral and written communication and organizational skills strongly preferred.
Experience with Crystal Reports, Power BI and Tableau is strongly preferred.
HEDIS/CMS reporting knowledge and experience is strongly preferred.

Disney Worldwide Shared Services’ Accounts Payable provides global support and services to DWSS partners, ensuring timely, accurate and compliant payments in accordance with corporate guidelines and various federal, state and local regulations. Accounts Payable works closely with Procure-to-Pay partners, Finance and Accounting partners, IT partners, and partners from various business units or functions to continually improve service and processes, decrease processing costs, ensure compliance, and achieve improved economies of scale with regard to payment procedures and processes.

The Accounts Payable Manager is the product owner for technologies related to Invoice Processing, OCR, and smart data validation, ensuring liaison with the third party vendor(s) as well as the Disney Enterprise Technology group regarding tool enhancements and upgrades, as well as troubleshooting, testing, and access.

The Accounts Payable Manager is directly responsible for managing a team of Invoice Processors responsible for processing approximately 1 million PO and Non-PO invoices annually for North America, for invoices across The Walt Disney Company. The Accounts Payable Manager is directly responsible for managing a team of Invoice Processors responsible for processing invoices in support of the Orlando Food & Beverage warehouse to support The Walt Disney World Parks.

The Accounts Payable Manager maintains the relationship with our Third Party Imaging vendor, responsible for receipt and initial scanning/indexing of paper invoices received for processing.

The Accounts Payable Manager is responsible for standardization and optimization of global invoice processing tools, processes and procedures for Disney Worldwide Shared Services, taking into account corporate, regulatory and statutory requirements at a local and regional level. Manager is responsible for monitoring global adherence to compliance policies as well as service standards through Key Performance Indicators related to cycle times and processing accuracy.

The Accounts Payable Manager is responsible for leading projects related to continuous process improvement, technology upgrades, and process changes and/or integration for the areas related to global invoice processing, and acts as a project team member on a variety of other Procure to Pay initiatives involving global invoice processing functions.

Responsibilities :

Transactional Management
Direct oversight of Domestic (US) Invoice Processing for both PO and Non-PO invoices, with an annual invoice volume of approximately 900K invoices per year, with ~$16B in spend.
Direct oversight of Food & Beverage invoice processing to support The Walt Disney World parks Orlando F&B Distribution warehouse.
Direct oversight of domestic contracts and down payment invoice processing
Direct oversight of PO Invoice processing workflows, requiring liaison with other PTP departments regarding aging workflow and general workflow management
Product owner for DWSS’ Invoice Processing Smart OCR and data validation technology, requiring frequent liaison with TWDC Enterprise Technology group(s) to manage configuration, access, and overall performance specifications.
Primary TWDC contact for third party vendors providing tools and systems within the global invoice processing space.
Ensures timely and accurate invoice processing, adhering to local regulatory requirements and corporate compliance requirements.
Ensures compliance to DWSS SLAs regarding invoice processing and monitors team members’ individual performance, providing correction, guidance, and mentorship as appropriate
Indirect oversight of all international ‘spokes’ and their invoice processing performance, coordinating with international PTP leads when appropriate to bring processes within performance standards
Global Strategy and Standardization
Directly responsible for all Processing documentation, SOPs, and Reference Guides related to Domestic (US) invoice processing, including documentation available to both internal and external customers and DWSS personnel.
Indirectly responsible for global processing documentation, SOPs, and Reference Guides related to all invoice processing supported by DWSS Procure to Pay Organization.
Makes recommendations to senior leadership, including DWSS Executive leadership, regarding changes required to DWSS PTP processing guidelines and rules to ensure optimal compliance and efficiency
Monitors invoice processing standards and regulatory requirements for all markets serviced by DWSS to ensure proactive response to changing global markets and environments
Project Management/Continuous Improvement
Serves as a primary project manager on projects impacting invoice processing procedures, tools, systems, and standards for projects in a variety of markets, both internationally and domestically.
Serves as part of a project team on projects with scopes extending beyond that of invoice processing, ensuring invoice processing requirements are met and opportunities for process or performance improvement are exploited to realize gains in efficiency and compliance and/or reductions in processing cost per invoice

Basic Qualifications :

2+ years management experience
2+ years experience in Accounts Payable, Banking, Accounting or Finance
Experience in a global, high volume transactional environment
Experience with OCR and/or artificial intelligence technologies
Project Management experience
Expert knowledge of SAP Finance modules and transaction code executions
Demonstrated computer expertise within Excel
Demonstrated experience partnering with global stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle multiple priorities, and perform job responsibilities accurately with minimal supervision
Demonstrated strong analytical skills
High level energy, self-direction and motivation

4+ years management experience
4+ years experience in Accounts Payable, Banking, Accounting or Finance
2+ years Project Management experience
Experience as a technology product owner
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Higher
PMP
CPA
4+ years prior management experience
Demonstrated ability to communicate with all levels of the organization both verbally and in writing

Accounting, Business Administration, Finance, or associated coursework or experience in these fields

Job summary
“What isn’t measured cannot be improved.” The Operations Technology IT Support’s Operational Excellence (OE) team is looking for an experienced IT Program Manager to ensure end-to-end management and completion of national or global technology operational excellence initiatives to the highest possible standards using data, metrics, process and continual improvement methodologies at large scales.

Operations Technology IT is a large and growing organization providing support to internal customers and IT infrastructure. This is all made possible through collaboration with a wide variety of technology teams from all over the world, and a complex, ever-changing set of platform technologies and IT support channels. If you are a strong communicator with wide array of technology, process improvement and service management experience, we look forward to talking with you!

Key job responsibilities
The OpsTechIT support Operational Excellence team is seeking a highly skilled program manager who will help drive the team toward our mission of being the best IT support organization in the world. The ideal candidate has experience in leading large scale projects/programs from initiation through delivery in a technology organization/role. As a program manager for OpsTechIT, you will lead projects focused on the delivery of operational excellence aimed at making us the best IT support organization in the world. The primary responsibilities of the successful candidate include, but are not limited to, the following:


Gathering business requirements
Document functional and design specifications
Identify appropriate resources needed
Assemble the right project team in a matrix environment
Assign individual responsibilities
Develop the milestones and launch schedule to ensure timely and successful delivery of the project.

A day in the life
Program Managers blend a mix of business and technical skills, assess and manage risks, measure and report on progress, anticipate and resolve bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make trade-offs, and balance the business needs with the technical constraints. The successful candidate will rely heavily on influence versus authority to drive project deliverables.


MBA or equivalent degree
Utilize knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma to lead cross-functional process improvement projects
Ability to direct, monitor and escalate work assignments towards goals and timelines.
Create and sustain new operational processes through designing and implementation of pilots or experiments.
Build financial models and analysis to assess operational impact of project(s).
This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, organization, and communication skills. Candidates should have experience defining projects, collecting requirements, writing detailed functional specifications, coordinating efforts to scope, schedule, and deploy new features sets; as well as analyzing cost/benefit of feature selection.
The successful candidate will have a customer focus, a diverse work experience, and a business curiosity/strategic viewpoint. The candidate will have an attention to detail, excellent analytical skills, good judgment, strong oral and written communication skills, and the ability to self-start and self-motivate.
The successful candidate will demonstrate an ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously whilst being comfortable with ambiguity and having an ability to be flexible in a rapidly changing environment.
It is critical that the candidate has a proven track record of earning trust, taking ownership, and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

job_title: Program Manager, Retrofits Data Analytics and Communications
job_description:
Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our software operates to meet the demands of our customers. The Facility Operations Retrofits team supports our data centers by identifying, developing, and managing the global processes, programs, and capital project planning necessary to ensure reliable and state-of-the-art data center facilities. This team provides management and governance of Meta’s MEP/CSLA data center improvement and retrofit project portfolio, through the gating, adjudication, prioritization, and resource management of capital improvement projects impacting Meta’s global data center fleet. Critically, the team aligns Facility operations and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure projects are executed with minimal business disruption and provide guidance, facilitation, and strategic direction for high-complexity, Infra-wide MEP and Network capital projects affecting Meta’s global portfolio. The ideal candidate for this role will be a data-driven professional with a good understanding of capital planning processes, end-to-end project management lifecycle, and leveraging data to enable sound decision-making. This individual would have sound program management skills, including strategic communications at various levels, operationalizing complex processes, and driving accountability within a cross-functional team. This individual would have experience with data including assessment of scope, risk, cost and schedule, communications, and decision gates. A sound technical background and keen understanding of MEP systems and facility operations, as well as working knowledge of the upstream production processes they support, are preferred. Superb communications, program management and organizational skills are also essential.


Program Manager, Retrofits Data Analytics and Communications Responsibilities:

As the program manager, enable the process for identification, development, planning, and prioritization of data center retrofit programs utilizing key metrics to drive business decisions.
Develop and manage end-to-end analytics solutions from requirements gathering, establishing key metrics, building data pipelines/dashboards, and analyzing data to drive the performance of our operations.
Apply quantitative expertise to mine massive amounts of data and extract impactful insights that influence the strategy for Retrofits.
Cultivate relationships and collaborate with cross-functional partners to shape, support, and execute product goals. Identify and share insights and learnings to develop scalable solutions.
Manage complex cross-functional data and metrics projects and programs in a matrix organization covering a range of areas.
Influence what to build in the next roadmap, understand ecosystems, and long-term trends, identify new levers to move key metrics.
Ensure tracking and reporting on portfolio and program health, based on set business-driven metrics and benchmarks. Ensure prioritization is driven through data, analytics and communication to business leaders and stakeholders.
Create and maintain forecast and prediction models using construction data within the retrofits portfolio.
Work with site, regional, and HQ teams to understand business intelligence needs and prioritize efforts to support strategic business objectives.
Create complex queries pulling data from multiple sources, connecting queries as applicable to optimize data sources and providing integration across various platforms.
Develop and maintain databases relative to cost, schedule, quality, safety and other data. Audit existing dashboards, partner to tailor or develop new dashboards and reports for various levels of stakeholders.
Lead the development and execution of a focused communications plan for the retrofits portfolio at all levels, including communications directed towards leadership, cross-functional partners, project managers, sites as well as other support pillars.
Play a lead role in supporting tooling and application development and improvements including solution development, requirement gathering, testing, deployment and training.
Support program leads in ensuring consistency and use of best practices across fleet using global standards and processes in various aspects of portfolio planning and execution.
Coordination and management of cross-functional improvement initiatives across IDC and Infra in support of Facebook’s larger budget, capacity, and reliability goals.
Ensure proper change management in retrofits management and other supporting processes. Identify and leverage appropriate data points to enable leadership to make informed decisions.
Provide crisp and timely communications to leadership, site teams and cross-functional partners at DC sites and global teams, including decisions, risks, and progress reports.
This person will partner closely with the Data Science team to build analytics and metrics for retrofits.
Travel 25-50%.


Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or commensurate experience.
5+ years of experience in operations or project/program management with a global focus.
3+ years of experience in quantitative analysis.
Experience in Tableau, Python and other data analytics applications .
Experience in delivering technical programs methodically and work with cross-functional teams with minimal direction.
Track record of thinking strategically and executing tactically, keeping high-level business objectives in mind.
Track record of developing and consistently tracking and reporting business-critical metrics to drive decision-making.
Experience in program management and deployment.
Experience supporting site teams in a responsive and resourceful manner.
Superior communications skills.


Preferred Qualifications:

Background in engineering/industrial fields
Advanced degree or certification in project/program management
Experience in data centers or equivalent mission-critical environments
Experience with capital expenditure and capital projects
Experience in managing process and program deployment across multiple facilities and stakeholders

Job summary
Join Amazon's HR team and help make a difference for all Amazonians! We are currently looking for an ERC Team Manager,to join our team.

If you have relentless desire to drive process improvement and motivate and lead a team of exceptionally driven, customer-obsessed associates and specialists, all while analyzing systemic issues and implementing solutions to challenging problems, we have the career you’re looking for!

The ERC Team Manager, sets the vision, direction, and culture of their teams by managing individual and team performance expectations and goals, maintaining singular focus on ensuring and improving customer satisfaction, by identifying broader customer impacting issues and implementing solutions to drive quality and productivity, while achieving real time desired service levels.

Position Responsibilities

People Management:

Leads and develops a team of 20-25 associates and Specialists; responsible for the overall direction, performance management, coordination and evaluation of the team. Manages the team and ensures high service delivery and execution.
Actively participates in and drives the continuous improvement culture through ‘kaizen’ and lean projects. Identifies and eliminates barriers to accuracy, productivity, and quality.
Achieves performance goals and objectives in line with the network wide vision and goals.
Communicates policies to associates and become the primary information source for staff; following-up to ensure compliance and consistency; taking corrective action as necessary and documenting the issue and actions taken.
Manages the workflow of the team to maintain service levels and ensure equitable workloads among team members.
Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Amazon’s policies and procedures; additional responsibilities include interviewing, training and motivating employees; planning, assigning and directing work; rewarding and disciplining employees; and effective conflict resolution.

Project Management and Communication:

Identifies customer impacting issues and implementing solutions and process improvements to increase customer satisfaction. Participates in cross-functional process improvement initiatives.
Assists in developing and implementing training programs to improve the quality and productivity of the team.
Drives process improvements to enhance the operational efficiency of the site. Understands and effectively utilizes resources provided by internal systems, departments, policies, and procedures.
Investigates discrepancies, finds and implements solutions.
Creates business cases and manages enhancements. Presents high quality data findings.
Identifies need, creates and distributes standard communications. Maintains departmental content in all channels. With manager oversight, develops and implements communication plans.
Responds to escalations, providing root cause analysis and recommendation. Develops remediation plan and drives to resolution with minimal guidance from Manager.

Customer Service:

Responds to queries from team, internal business partners, candidates, and customers including high level leadership teams.
Manages key stakeholders both internal & external & partnering with them for process enhancement.

Subject Matter Expertise:

Acts as a Subject Matter Expert for customers, team and vendors.
General understanding of HR Services workload and priorities.
Knows and interprets basic legal stipulations.
Knows and works with outside sources to develop interpretations and solutions for complex issues.
Performs audits of team’s work. Assists in developing and approving guidelines.
Advocates for HR Services.
Ability to work a flexible schedule (as we support a 24x7 operations).
ERC Experience
3 - 5 years of related experience. HR contact center preferred.
PHR, GPHR, or SPHR certification.
Ability to handle projects using the Project Management principles and methodology.
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma.
Third Language proficiency is an added advantage.
Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information and adhere to strict data privacy standards.

·

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Project management leadership skills.

AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.
What we are looking for…
We are looking for a Learning & Development Coordinator to join the Learning & Development Team under People + Culture! The ideal candidate will be a thoughtful, detail-oriented team player looking to help continue building and implementing a scalable and efficient Learning & Development structure. This person will be responsible for overseeing our L&D administration. This role will provide you with the unique opportunity to work with an experienced Learning & Development team, as well as cross-departmental partners on a regular basis. More importantly, you will do so in a fun and creative environment where everyone’s voice is heard.
What you’ll do…
Provide administrative support, coordinate and track all L&D sponsored training programs
Administer and operate the Learning Management System platform for items including but not limited to:Maintaining and updating user recordsAssign courses to employeesMonitor course completionTrack and provide reminders/past due noticesRuns reports requested by departments and individualsTroubleshooting platform/user issues
Communicate professionally and effectively with stakeholders at multiple levels of the business
Support the updating of learning materials; including working closely with subject matter experts
Coordinate and organize logistics and support for all synchronous/live L&D programs (internal and vendor led), including logistics, attendee rosters, invites and post-event communications, and reporting
Pull and consolidate various data sources to build custom reports that highlight the impact of L&D programs
Prepare training communications (zoom invites, training guidelines, etc.)
Provide support to the Senior Program Manager and the broader L&D team on ad hoc projects
What you’ll bring…
Bachelor's degree in a related field
1+ years of experience working with a Learning and Development, Human Resources, or Training team
Proven track record of flexibility and adaptability in a rapidly growing and changing environment
Strong communication and public speaking skills
Strong organization skills and superior attention to detail
Must be self-directed, able to work independently, and can manage timelines effectively
Preferred experience in a start-up
Preferred experience in hospitality, travel or real estate industry
Expertise with Google enterprise products (gmail, calendar, docs, sheets)
Demonstrated high comfort level in the use of technology and quickly learn new software
Preferred knowledge of Learning Management Systems and Knowledge Management Systems
Passion for company culture and the employee experience
Perks and Benefits...
Salary: $57,000 - $65,000 DOE
Benefits and Unlimited Paid Time Off
Team bonding and off-site events
Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties

Job Summary:

The Clinical Data Manager is responsible for delivery of an entire clinical trial. Is sponsor facing and works with study project managements and technical data management team to meet the design specs, monitor the health of the trial, ensure quality and data reconciliation.


Major Responsibilities:

Ensures clinical trial databases meet project requirements by:

Attending and participating in sponsor meetings
Managing all data management deliverables for assigned studies
Prepare tracking reports and metrics
Develops the Data Management Plan
Assist Business Intelligence Team with analytical data reporting

Ensures the plan for data management is properly executed by:

Understanding the requirements for study implementation and data collection
Collaborating with project team to develop study-specific edit check criteria
Defining, running, and reviewing edit checks and resolving discrepant data
Maintaining organized, complete, and up-to-date study documentation
Performing study setup, specifications, and obtaining approvals as needed
Coordinating and documenting the receipt and processing of electronic or ancillary data received from outside sources (e.g., data received from other central laboratories, CRO's, or Sponsors).
Keeping supervisor informed of project status

Ensures the accuracy and consistency of clinical databases by:

Reviewing data and identifying errors/inconsistencies
Collaborating with appropriate project team to resolve data issues
Tracking outstanding issues and following-up until resolution
Ensuring accuracy in manipulation and scrutiny of clinical data and that CDM activities are carried out according to regulatory guidelines

May manage staff including professional development/training, goal setting, performance management, coaching and mentoring, employee counseling, and separations.


Qualifications:

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Life Sciences or related field preferred


Experience

5-7+ years’ experience in comparable position within the pharmaceutical, biotech or CRO industry recommended
1-2 years’ line management/supervisory experience
Working knowledge of relational database organization and validation
Experience delivering SAS Datasets
Experience with CDISC
Experience working with office productivity tools including Word, Excel and Access preferred
Understanding of clinical trial terminology desirable
Proven ability in problem solving


What We Offer

Competitive salary
Full Benefits
401k with generous matching
Flexible vacation policy

Company Description

Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands - Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you'll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.

Job Description
 What’s the role?
The Research Operations team at Etsy is looking for a Research Coordinator to join our growing team and support several key areas to help us scale the impact of research.
What’s this team like at Etsy?
The Research team helps inspire product and business decisions, using data to improve the experiences of current and prospective Etsy customers. We advocate a user-centered approach to design in partnership with designers, product, and marketing teams across Etsy. Our research obsesses over understanding who we’re designing for, and how Etsy fits into their lives.
As our team grows, we’re looking for a Research Coordinator to join our small but mighty Research Operations team to further support our culture of continuous learning. In this role, you’ll own logistics for both our Product and Market research teams, and recruiting and maintaining a healthy pipeline of participants for a variety of research studies. Put simply, you’ll keep the train rolling, and we can’t imagine how we’d do it without you.
As a Research Coordinator, you’ll support the team throughout the research lifecycle from end-to-end recruiting, screening, and scheduling efforts to streamlining research operations and team communications. You’ll manage relationships with existing external partners and vendors, and stay up to date on new industry tools and trends to vet and onboard new vendors or processes when needed.
This is a full-time position reporting to the Research Manager. This role requires your presence in Etsy’s Brooklyn office in a flex capacity. Learn more about our Flex and Office-based work modes as well as vaccination policy here.
What does the day-to-day look like?
Coordinating the recruiting and screening of participants for research studies
Understanding recruit needs, and drafting and programming tailored screeners
Recruiting customers from our research participant database
Managing the A-Z of logistics to keep research projects on track, such as:
Owning schedules and communications with researchers and partner teams
Coordinating day-of logistics for testing days
Tracking and managing research operational items (e.g. NDAs, gift cards, facilities requests)
Managing external partners and vendors
Collaborating closely with recruitment vendors to recruit prospective buyers and sellers
Identifying and vetting outside research partners, vendors, and tools for the team
Owning the internal procurement and approval process (working closely with legal and finance)
Handling tool licensing and renewals
Creating and updating resources
Crafting team documentation for a variety of topics ranging from team values to the recruiting process
Auditing team operations and processes to identify areas of improvement
Developing instructions and/or training materials for various tools and tasks
Keeping resources up-to-date
Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at Etsy's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.

Qualifications
Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:
Your natural curiosity, empathy, and eagerness to learn drive everything you do
Some might say you’re hyper-organized, detail-obsessed, and take pride in efficiency.
You're interested in identifying workflow inefficiencies, and optimizing or improving processes and operations. We’d love to learn from you about how to better our workflows and tools.
Familiarity with screener design and survey writing
Experience with or interest in learning:
Spreadsheet / Database software, such as Excel / Google Sheets (vlookups, pivot tables), SQL, etc
Survey software, such as Qualtrics, TypeForm, or SurveyMonkey
The ins-and-outs of contracts, procurement, and vendor management
Bonus: Experience running ongoing recruitment and using research tools; experience working with legal/risk teams on data governance (PII, GDPR)
Additional Information

What's Next

If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a coverletter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you'vehopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality andvariety. We don't want you to be like everyone else - we want you to belike you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.

Position Purpose:
The Digital Content Data Analyst serves as the primary product data category lead for the Digital Content team. You would be responsible for keeping team projects on-task and within expectations of project timelines. You would work with Digital Content Managers/leadership to prioritize projects and own deliverables of the team. You would be the primary point of contact for product data quality, presentation and promotions for the merchandising category on homedepot.com. You would develop and maintain the day-to-day relationships with internal and external partners i.e., Direct Fulfillment Merchants, HD.com business partners, suppliers, etc. to support data initiatives online.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:
30% - Become the subject matter expert for assigned product category online. Learn and report on best practices, industry standards, and legal requirements associated with assigned projects.


10% - Responsible for category product data projects and status reporting SKU collection and maintenance, product cross merchandising online, product presentation, etc.


15% - Measure ongoing effectiveness of programs against metric targets. Develop and execute ongoing enhancement/optimization strategy based on measured performance and customer feedback.


10% - Responsible for prioritizing projects, tasks to ensure deliverables and goals are met or exceeded.


10% - Coordinate integrated teams from one or more external agencies or functional organizations supporting managed initiatives.


10% - Troubleshoot and problem solve for ongoing operational needs as they arise - store sku alignment, online product availability, etc.


10% - Ability to author clear, concise end user/training materials for processes.

Nature and Scope:
Position reports to Manager, Digital Content

Disney Worldwide Shared Services’ Accounts Payable provides global support and services to DWSS partners, ensuring timely, accurate and compliant payments in accordance with corporate guidelines and various federal, state and local regulations. Accounts Payable works closely with Procure-to-Pay partners, Finance and Accounting partners, IT partners, and partners from various business units or functions to continually improve service and processes, decrease processing costs, ensure compliance, and achieve improved economies of scale with regard to payment procedures and processes.

The Accounts Payable Manager is the product owner for technologies related to Invoice Processing, OCR, and smart data validation, ensuring liaison with the third party vendor(s) as well as the Disney Enterprise Technology group regarding tool enhancements and upgrades, as well as troubleshooting, testing, and access.

The Accounts Payable Manager is directly responsible for managing a team of Invoice Processors responsible for processing approximately 1 million PO and Non-PO invoices annually for North America, for invoices across The Walt Disney Company. The Accounts Payable Manager is directly responsible for managing a team of Invoice Processors responsible for processing invoices in support of the Orlando Food & Beverage warehouse to support The Walt Disney World Parks.

The Accounts Payable Manager maintains the relationship with our Third Party Imaging vendor, responsible for receipt and initial scanning/indexing of paper invoices received for processing.

The Accounts Payable Manager is responsible for standardization and optimization of global invoice processing tools, processes and procedures for Disney Worldwide Shared Services, taking into account corporate, regulatory and statutory requirements at a local and regional level. Manager is responsible for monitoring global adherence to compliance policies as well as service standards through Key Performance Indicators related to cycle times and processing accuracy.

The Accounts Payable Manager is responsible for leading projects related to continuous process improvement, technology upgrades, and process changes and/or integration for the areas related to global invoice processing, and acts as a project team member on a variety of other Procure to Pay initiatives involving global invoice processing functions.

Responsibilities :

Transactional Management
Direct oversight of Domestic (US) Invoice Processing for both PO and Non-PO invoices, with an annual invoice volume of approximately 900K invoices per year, with ~$16B in spend.
Direct oversight of Food & Beverage invoice processing to support The Walt Disney World parks Orlando F&B Distribution warehouse.
Direct oversight of domestic contracts and down payment invoice processing
Direct oversight of PO Invoice processing workflows, requiring liaison with other PTP departments regarding aging workflow and general workflow management
Product owner for DWSS’ Invoice Processing Smart OCR and data validation technology, requiring frequent liaison with TWDC Enterprise Technology group(s) to manage configuration, access, and overall performance specifications.
Primary TWDC contact for third party vendors providing tools and systems within the global invoice processing space.
Ensures timely and accurate invoice processing, adhering to local regulatory requirements and corporate compliance requirements.
Ensures compliance to DWSS SLAs regarding invoice processing and monitors team members’ individual performance, providing correction, guidance, and mentorship as appropriate
Indirect oversight of all international ‘spokes’ and their invoice processing performance, coordinating with international PTP leads when appropriate to bring processes within performance standards
Global Strategy and Standardization
Directly responsible for all Processing documentation, SOPs, and Reference Guides related to Domestic (US) invoice processing, including documentation available to both internal and external customers and DWSS personnel.
Indirectly responsible for global processing documentation, SOPs, and Reference Guides related to all invoice processing supported by DWSS Procure to Pay Organization.
Makes recommendations to senior leadership, including DWSS Executive leadership, regarding changes required to DWSS PTP processing guidelines and rules to ensure optimal compliance and efficiency
Monitors invoice processing standards and regulatory requirements for all markets serviced by DWSS to ensure proactive response to changing global markets and environments
Project Management/Continuous Improvement
Serves as a primary project manager on projects impacting invoice processing procedures, tools, systems, and standards for projects in a variety of markets, both internationally and domestically.
Serves as part of a project team on projects with scopes extending beyond that of invoice processing, ensuring invoice processing requirements are met and opportunities for process or performance improvement are exploited to realize gains in efficiency and compliance and/or reductions in processing cost per invoice

Basic Qualifications :

2+ years management experience
2+ years experience in Accounts Payable, Banking, Accounting or Finance
Experience in a global, high volume transactional environment
Experience with OCR and/or artificial intelligence technologies
Project Management experience
Expert knowledge of SAP Finance modules and transaction code executions
Demonstrated computer expertise within Excel
Demonstrated experience partnering with global stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle multiple priorities, and perform job responsibilities accurately with minimal supervision
Demonstrated strong analytical skills
High level energy, self-direction and motivation

4+ years experience in Accounts Payable, Banking, Accounting or Finance

PMP

About Fetch:

Fetch is a company of people taking care of people that is changing the way that packages are delivered to apartment residents. As a last-mile logistics company that serves the multifamily industry, Fetch is an innovative way to solve apartment community(s) package problems and creates a delivery experience worthy of excitement. Packages are sent to our local facilities and we coordinate secure, direct-to-door delivery at the resident's convenience. As a venture-backed startup, we're already operating in cities from coast to coast with exciting growth on the horizon.

Our Opportunity:

The "Productivity, Assessment and Logistics Enhancement Team" (PALET) is the central operations team for Fetch. PALET is a team of logistics professionals with excitement for development with the ultimate goal of improving fulfillment and delivery metrics, along with decreasing cost of Operations all while keeping to the Fetch core value of cultivating fans.

Fetch is looking for an Operations Manager to join PALET in developing best practice and process improvement for all facilities servicing our East region.

The Fetch Operations Team is the driving force of our strategy to bring apartment residents secure and convenient package delivery. We are looking for an individual with a pragmatic and common sense approach to make proper business judgments and get things done.

As a leader responsible for continuous improvement for a large region, you will work alongside a Director of Operations and Regional Safety Manager to strategize key elements around facility, supply, growth, process and engagement. You will travel from site to site regularly to perform audits, identify risks, and work with Operations Managers to solve big picture logistical challenges. PALET Operations Managers are pragmatic, project-based managers with a strong ability to influence others with problem solving and providing solutions that improve the service Fetch provides.


What you'll deliver on the job:

Perform site audits to measure quality of operations of a Fetch facility, and set action plans for improvements.
Work on projects related to creating mechanisms, improving compliance in standard operating procedures and standardization of best practices.
Assist with launches within the region for new market expansion, existing market growth and building to building transitions.
Work alongside human resources, marketing, customer service, account management, sales and other stakeholders when building solutions.
Procure and monitor supply expenditures for consumable and process-related materials.
Strategize fulfillment, dispatch and delivery improvements using lean principles, 5S and six sigma.
Provide support for ground operations of a Fetch facility when needed. This includes filling the role of administrative or management positions.


Does your experience check these boxes?

The will and drive to achieve, maintain and increase high standards.
5+ years of experience in a management position.
3+ years of experience in a position based on learning, development, launch or continuous improvement.
3+ years of managing or executing cross-functional projects with tight deadlines.
Experience in Kaizen, Six Sigma, Lean, 5S and other continuous improvement methodologies.
Flexibility to travel 25% of the year.
Comfort with project based softwares and platforms.
Comfort with data extraction, and with complex data. Familiarity with spreadsheet based applications in terms of advanced functions and macros.
Clear and concise with electronic and verbal communication.
High-level of commitment towards prioritized decision making.
Ability to thrive under pressure.
Multi-tasking skills.
Comfort within a fast-paced environment.


What we'll deliver on:

We understand life can get hectic, for that we offer flexible work schedules with the option to work remotely
Just like we value hard work, we also value a great work-life balance with unlimited PTO
We've got you covered with health and dental benefits
We want to keep time on your side, so we offer a 401k plan for employees


At Fetch, we are always looking for awesome people to join our growing team. If you think you're the right fit for this position, apply today. We'd love to hear from you!

Fetch is an equal opportunity employer, all applicants will be considered without discrimination on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, disabilities, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.
