Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting
The preferred location for this position is Connecticut but other locations may be considered
(eligible for a remote work schedule)
The Manager Healthcare Data Analysis & Reporting manages professional level associates engaged in various levels of data and statistical analysis that includes compiling, manipulating, analyzing, and reporting of data. Typically data is used for both internal and external purposes. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:
Direct management of Data Analytics & Reporting staff including: hiring, providing guidance and direction, determining workload and delegating assignments, training, monitoring and evaluating performance, and initiating corrective or disciplinary actions.
Formulates data management strategies and solutions, engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational strategy.
Understand and manage data lifecycle from data acquisition, evaluation of data integrity, day to day maintenance and synthesis of data to satisfy contractual reporting requirements.
Demonstrates a track record of making difficult and impactful decisions to drive the business forward. Leads the development of a system-wide plan to ensure data is governed, shared, standardized, and analyzed for the key purpose of driving action and decision-making that promotes clinical and operational excellence.

Department specific responsibilities:
Management of staff includes developing the Data Analytics & Reporting staff into a cohesive team capable of timely service and product delivery by providing leadership, professional development, and cross-training. Includes direct collaboration and communication with other departmental leaders.
Works with internal and external stakeholders to design and maintain data to support programs; tracks, prioritizes and manages analytics implementation initiatives across teams; serves as contact and decision maker for analytics and reporting requests.
Presents and communicates data analytic results and procedures performed in a coherent and effective manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Knowledge of clinical documentation and language related to Medical and/or Behavioral Healthcare data elements; Including claims and pharmacy (NDC, ICD-10, HCPCS, CPT, RCC).
Demonstrated project management ability and experience (managing stakeholders, develop data or work flows, task prioritization, and resource allocation).
Ability to thrive and adapt in a fast-paced and rapidly growing environment managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Oversees and directs data collection and validation procedures, including the extraction, retrieval, analysis and transformation of data to facilitate reporting to address organizational data needs. This includes directing and/or providing guidance for team members during analysis, trouble shooting, data collection, and root cause analysis, so that the team can identify analytics solutions.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements
Requires BA/BS
5-7 years related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experience
Knowledge of programming languages, including SQL, required.
Experience with relational databases is required.
Healthcare data experience is required (claims, EHR, pharmacy).
Experience managing direct-report staff is required.
External client facing experience is required.
Decision making skills and experience leading projects required.
Excellent analytical skills and strong oral and written communication and organizational skills strongly preferred.
Experience with Crystal Reports, Power BI and Tableau is strongly preferred.
HEDIS/CMS reporting knowledge and experience is strongly preferred.
We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

job_title: Global Data & Analytics Manager, Customer Experience
job_description:
Bachelor's degree Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics
5+ years experience in Business Intelligence
1+ years leading and managing a team of Business Intelligence Engineers
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Advanced SQL writing and experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, VBA, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Experience with data visualization software, preferably Tableau
Experience with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, Java, C++)
Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

Amazon’s mission is to be ‘Earth’s most customer-centric company’, and our award-winning Customer Service (CS) team is an essential part of that mission. Amazon CS is one of the largest customer service organizations in the world. Our tens of thousands of Customer Service Associates around the globe provide world-class support to customers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and in over 20 languages (and growing).

One of our newest customer service programs, Customer Service by Amazon (CSBA), enables Marketplace sellers to delegate their customer service to Amazon. We are seeking an experienced Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer to lead global analytics for this program. The successful candidate will define the analytics strategy, including automation and creation of new KPIs, and build scalable ways to use data to drive and inform the global program expansion plans. This position can be located in Seattle, Phoenix, Nashville, Austin or another Amazon Corporate location as well as Virtual options are available.

Key responsibilities:

Define the global reporting strategy for CSBA
Build, launch and scale repeatable BI/reporting mechanisms for CSBA for both global and local reporting purposes
Ensure standardization of data between CSBA programs
Conduct deep dives to identify root causes of pain points and opportunities for improvement
Become a subject matter expert in CSBA data, supporting local analytics resources as new programs launch
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Experience successfully communicating with internal customers, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe Business Intelligence decisions or analytics strategy
Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring others on best practices in Business Intelligence
Knowledge of best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, budgeting, and operations
Ability to use data to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analysis
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications
